author: ShamsCharania
text: Wyc Grousbeck will no longer stay on as governor as part of the Boston Celtics' $6.1 billion sale to Bill Chisholm, sources tell me and @ramonashelburne. Plan had been for Grousbeck to remain through 2028. Chisholm assumes governor title and the transfer will be finalized soon.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Riley Minix is re-signing with the San Antonio Spurs on a two-way NBA deal, sources tell ESPN. Minix spent his rookie season last year with San Antonio's G League team and played one game for the Spurs.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Boucher departs Toronto where he has the all-time franchise record in points, rebounds, blocks, minutes and games played off the bench. He also was the Raptors' last remaining member of the 2019 NBA championship team.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Chris Boucher has agreed to a one-year, $3.3 million contract with the Boston Celtics, agent Sam Permut of Roc Nation tells ESPN. Boucher lands a guaranteed deal with the Celtics and is expected to have a significant role in the frontcourt. https://t.co/H13dHVyuu8

author: ShamsCharania
text: Niang returns to Utah now and his salary goes into the massive John Collins trade exception along with two draft assets. The move allows the Celtics have more salary relief below the second apron.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Boston Celtics are trading Georges Niang and two future second-round picks to the Utah Jazz for rookie RJ Luis Jr., sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/l7h0cGobfU

text: Spurs, De'Aaron Fox reach 4-year, $229M max extension - via ESPN https://t.co/V3FLsdPQxv

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: San Antonio Spurs star De'Aaron Fox has agreed to a four-year, $229 million maximum contract extension with the franchise, Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul told ESPN. The max deal secures Fox's future in San Antonio through the 2029-30 season. https://t.co/vvCdMExAbt

author: ShamsCharania
text: Just in on @SportsCenter -- Luka Doncic lands a $165M extension with the Lakers six months to the day of his stunning trade out of Dallas: https://t.co/7JaV2xTAfH

author: ShamsCharania
text: This now keeps Doncic out of free agency next summer and committed to the Lakers -- and makes him eligible for a projected five years and $417 million in 2028.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Los Angeles Lakers All-NBA star Luka Doncic has signed a three-year, $165 million maximum contract extension with the franchise, with a player option in 2028, agent Bill Duffy of WME Basketball told ESPN. https://t.co/oRxAVIm2oD

author: ShamsCharania
text: Charlotte Hornets assistant Chris Jent is finalizing a deal to become the associate head coach of the New York Knicks under Mike Brown, sources tell ESPN. New York and Tyler Glass of CSE Talent negotiated terms for Jent, who returns to Knicks where he spent 1996-97 as a player. https://t.co/oaO1onPUpc

author: ShamsCharania
text: Jent has been an NBA assistant for over two decades and now assumes an elevated role as a significant hire for Brown. He won a title as a player with the Rockets in 1994. And guided the Hornets to the Las Vegas summer league championship in July.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Anthony Davis Injury News: The retina is the light-sensitive layer of nerve tissue located at the back of the eye that helps focus and relay information to the brain, which then helps form an individual's vision. The retina can be "bruised". tear, or become detached.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Multiple NBA players have suffered retina injuries, including Dirk Nowitzki who bruised his right retina in 2006. Players to endure retina tears or detached retinas include Matt Barnes, DJ Mbenga, &, most famously, Amar'e Stoudemire. Fortunately surgery has a high success rate.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard/forward Ricky Council IV will sign a one-year contract with the Brooklyn Nets, his agent Adie von Gontard tells ESPN. The former 76ers wing appeared in a team-high 73 games last season, averaging 7.3 points and 2.9 rebounds.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Minnesota Timberwolves are signing forward Enrique Freeman on a two-way NBA contract, agents Keith Kreiter and Sam Cipriano of Edge Sports tell ESPN. The Pacers' 2024 second-rounder had a strong summer league, averaging 16.6 points, 9.8 rebounds, 1.8 blocks and 56% on 3s.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Johnny Juzang has agreed to a one-year deal with the Minnesota Timberwolves, sources tell ESPN. Juzang played his first three NBA seasons in Utah and averaged 8.9 points and 38% 3-point shooting in 19.8 minutes per game in 2024-25.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Knicks, Mikal Bridges agree to 4-year, $150M extension - via ESPN https://t.co/pVry1oMP5J

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bridges takes a slight discount from his max extension number ($156M) in order to help the Knicks have flexibility to continue building the roster and add pieces to the East championship contender.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: New York Knicks forward Mikal Bridges has agreed to a four-year, $150 million contract extension with the franchise, agents Sam Goldfeder and Jordan Gertler of Excel Sports Management tell ESPN. The new deal includes a player option for 2029-30 and a trade kicker. https://t.co/xuiYvzykqJ

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Bryce McGowens has agreed on a two-way NBA deal with the New Orleans Pelicans, Kyle McAlarney and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports tell ESPN. The 2022 second-rounder enters his fourth NBA season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: On Jonathan Kuminga declining the Warriors' free agent offers and what comes next for NBA Today with @malika_andrews and @anthonyVslater: https://t.co/d4I9qmgB2k

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Golden State made renewed push to retain Jonathan Kuminga, but the RFA continues to decline a two-year, $45 million offer due to Warriors insistence on a team option and waiving a built-in no-trade clause, sources tell ESPN.

Details with @anthonyVslater: https://t.co/GfbB2RvyDz

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Bulls and Billy Donovan started negotiations at the end of last season and continued conversations through this week amid offseason planning, a brief pursuit of Donovan by the New York Knicks, and the draft, free agency and summer league.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Chicago Bulls head coach Billy Donovan has signed a multiyear contract extension with the franchise, sources tell ESPN. Donovan is viewed as a leader within the Bulls organization, and will enter his sixth season in Chicago in 2025-26 with 800 NBA games coached over his career. https://t.co/LVYMiZt2Tv

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard TyTy Washington Jr. has agreed to a one-year deal with the Los Angeles Clippers, Kevin Bradbury of LIFT Sports Management tells ESPN. Washington, a 2022 first-round pick, enters his fourth NBA season after playing 16 games for the Suns in 2024-25.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for NBA Today -- the latest on restricted free agent Jonathan Kuminga and the Golden State Warriors as August nears: https://t.co/hKZMA5rBGb

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Detroit Pistons are signing G/F Colby Jones on a two-way NBA contract, sources tell ESPN. Jones, 23, averaged 8.7 points, 4.3 rebounds, 2.5 assists and 1.3 steals in the final two months of 2024-25, showing flashes as a productive rotation player in his second NBA season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Jared Butler has agreed to a one-year deal with the Phoenix Suns, Mark Bartelstein and Kieran Piller of @PrioritySports tell ESPN. The 2021 second-rounder averaged 9 points in 17 minutes per game over 60 contests for the 76ers and Wizards last season. https://t.co/5RvcgFmOsG

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Phoenix Suns have claimed former Lakers guard Jordan Goodwin off free agency waivers, sources tell ESPN. Goodwin, waived by the Lakers to create roster space for Marcus Smart, is a gritty, upside pickup for the Suns backcourt. https://t.co/SIMQXztpNi

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Charlotte Hornets are signing guard Antonio Reeves to a two-way NBA deal, sources tell ESPN. The 2024 Pelicans second-round pick averaged 6.9 points and 40% 3-point shooting in 44 games as a rookie last season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Lindy Waters III has agreed to a one-year deal with the San Antonio Spurs, agents Shy Saee and Winston Nelson of Klutch Sports tell ESPN. Waters has shot 37% from 3 in his first four NBA seasons in Oklahoma City, Golden State and Detroit. https://t.co/RuUuvXfvdf

author: ShamsCharania
text: David Jones-Garcia – All-Summer League first team breakout guard – has agreed on a two-way NBA contract with the San Antonio Spurs, agents Deirunas Visockas and Guillermo Bermejo of Gersh Sports tell ESPN. Jones-Garcia starred for the Spurs this month (22 PPG, 6 RPG, 53% on 3s). https://t.co/OPJZAQVwFH

author: ShamsCharania
text: Rockets officials and agent Calvin Andrews of Klutch Sports negotiated the new deal for Okogie, who averaged a career high 1.2 steals and ranked fourth in steals per 36 minutes among players to appear in 40 games or more last season.

author: JakeLFischer
text: My understanding is this doozy was already developing into a six-team trade back during the second round of last week’s NBA Draft. Atlanta made this a potentially record-setting behemoth when the Hawks agreed to help Clint Capela join the Rockets by way of sign-and-trade.

author: JakeLFischer

text: It's a two-year, $16.6 million agreement between Deandre Ayton and Los Angeles, hitting the Lakers' books for 2025-26 and 2026-27. Player option in Year 2.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Deandre Ayton's contract with the Lakers is for two years, per source, starting at $8.1 million for this 2025-26 campaign. He's still due $25.6 million from Portland this season, following his buyout from the Trail Blazers.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Going back on @BleacherReport at the top of the hour to talk everything Ayton, Lakers, Knicks, Pacers, Chris Paul and much more: https://t.co/Tdh9bC0U69

author: JakeLFischer
text: Will be writing on this, but my first ☝️ about “free agency is dead” is that plenty of execs and agents are talking behind the scenes about the cap space coming in 2026 FA as part of their current plans. The lack of room teams stalled this summer. Shouldn’t be the case next July.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Brown has been in the New York this week meeting with top Knicks officials. After the slew of denied head coach interview requests, Brown always appeared to be the leader in this race.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
The Bucks held interest in Deandre Ayton, sources say, before Milwaukee’s splash that landed Myles Turner. Will we see Ayton join the Lakers once he clears waivers today at 5 pm ET?

Read @TheSteinLine for more: https://t.co/5wA9YmVxaf

author: JakeLFischer
text: She never expected to still be performing. A broken arm during practice almost led to Red Panda's retirement in 2015. The fact she's still been out there, crushing it, well past 50 years old, has been amazing. Hope she gets well soon and is back on the court.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Kyrie's comments reenforce that recovery, especially for a major injury, is fluid & comes w/ a subjective component from the athlete. Average time lost for ACL tears in the NBA is ~11 months but he shouldn't return until he's physically & mentally ready. I think he is smart to temper expectations.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The thought of Tatum and Lillard rehabbing their Achilles tears together on the same team is certainly interesting.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Jaren Jackson Jr. Injury Update: The term turf toe is used to describe a sprain of the 1st metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joint of the big toe. Surgery is often needed when the plantar plate ruptures. Others to suffer a similar injury include Blake Griffin & Myles Turner. Average lost time for NBA cases that needed surgery is ~3 months.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I previously examined turf toe injuries when Jackson’s former teammate Desmond Bane suffered a G2 big toe sprain in 2022. https://t.co/61TUR4rZA3

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Josh Okogie has agreed to a one-year, $3.1 million deal with the Houston Rockets, sources tell ESPN. Okogie enters his 8th NBA season and gives the Rockets another active wing defender who has averaged 6.3 points over 416 games. https://t.co/RazV3afZq1

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Blake Wesley has agreed to a one-year deal with the Portland Trail Blazers, sources tell ESPN. The former Spurs first-round pick shot 37% on 3s in second half of last season and now lands a new role in Portland. https://t.co/hzEoXlPHAU

author: ShamsCharania
text: On Chris Paul's reunion with the LA Clippers for his likely final season for NBA Today: https://t.co/Xlbmcz8iUd

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent Doug McDermott has agreed to a one-year, $3.6 million deal to return to the Sacramento Kings, Mark Bartelstein and Andy Shiffman of @PrioritySports tell ESPN. McDermott will enter his 12th NBA season after shooting 44% from 3 in 42 Kings games in 2024-25. https://t.co/J6cMwmupxJ

author: ShamsCharania
text:
RT @SportsCenter: Old ➡️ New

CP3 is BACK with the Clippers 🔥 

(via @ShamsCharania) https://t.co/X36UDyk9ca

author: ShamsCharania
text: Twelve-time All-Star Chris Paul has agreed to a deal with the Los Angeles Clippers, CAA's Steven Heumann, Ty Sullivan and Jessica Holtz told ESPN. Paul had multiple suitors, but chose the contending Clippers and their shared history in L.A. for his likely final, 21st NBA season. https://t.co/qC640MFFeI

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers have waived guard Jordan Goodwin, sources tell ESPN. Goodwin emerged as a key rotation piece for JJ Redick late last season, playing 29 games and four playoff contests. Goodwin and Shake Milton were released to clear space for arrival of Marcus Smart.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies are signing forward PJ Hall to a two-way NBA contract, agent Matt Bollero of ProMondo Sports tells ESPN. Hall, who played 19 games for the Nuggets last season, averaged 24.2 points and 14.7 rebounds on 65.5% shooting per-36 minutes in summer league.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Denver Nuggets are signing guard Curtis Jones to a two-way NBA contract, agent Austin Walton of NEXT Sports tells ESPN. After going undrafted out of Iowa State, Jones had a stellar summer league for the Nuggets, averaging 15 points, 4.4 rebounds and 3.8 assists on 47% from 3.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers have waived guard Shake Milton, sources tell ESPN. Milton's $3 million contract for next season would have become fully guaranteed today. Lakers are clearing space for signing of Marcus Smart.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on Marcus Smart intending to join the Los Angeles Lakers after a buyout with the Washington Wizards -- and after playoff berths in all of his nine seasons with LA's rival Boston Celtics: https://t.co/2MASjuBXoK

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Marcus Smart has agreed to a contract buyout with the Washington Wizards and intends to sign a two-year, $11 million deal with the Los Angeles Lakers after clearing waivers, sources tell ESPN. A return to a grand stage for the 2022 NBA Defensive Player of the Year. https://t.co/8g9Bxzz11E

author: ShamsCharania
text: Japanese guard Yuki Kawamura has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Chicago Bulls, sources tell ESPN. Bulls finalized the deal with Kawamura's agents at Wasserman to sign the 5-foot-8 point guard amid a strong summer league. https://t.co/pBYWIwxXz3

author: ShamsCharania
text: Pelicans forward/center Derik Queen underwent surgery to repair a torn scapholunate ligament in his left wrist and will be re-evaluated in 12 weeks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: On the biggest reason Damian Lillard returned to Portland for @SportsCenter at Night: https://t.co/aQVIl6WIrm

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Damian Lillard reaches 3-year, $42M deal to return to Trail Blazers - via ESPN https://t.co/2VjHAPK9Cw

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers plan to sign 7-footer Christian Koloko and forward Chris Manon on two-way NBA contracts, sources tell ESPN. Manon, undrafted out of Vanderbilt, played for the Warriors in California and Las Vegas summer leagues. Koloko played 37 games for L.A. last season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: This is a continuation of the Lakers development plan with Koloko, who had other interested teams as well.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Smart, a three-time All-Defense first team guard, will have a player option on his new Lakers deal to enter a more flush 2026 free agency, sources said. Point of attack defender was a position of need for L.A. as well -- with Luka Doncic recruiting and reaching out to Smart.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Lakers, Phoenix Suns and Milwaukee Bucks all seriously pursued Smart, with positive conversations with personnel from all three teams after he and his agent Jason Glushon received permission to explore options from the Wizards, sources said.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
These were the two sign-and-trade scenarios Detroit had on the table last night. Moving Fontecchio’s $8.3M allows the Pistons to give Robinson his $16M
AAV over a three-year deal.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Jordan Clarkson gave back roughly $3.6 million in his Utah buyout, sources say, about the same veteran's minimum amount the veteran guard is expected to earn when he signs with New York upon clearing waivers.

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: Larry Nance Jr. is signing with the Cleveland Cavaliers, league sources tell @TheSteinLine.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Talking about the future of Damian Lillard, how Myles Turner landed in Milwaukee and much more, coming up right now on @BleacherReport: https://t.co/cnKEO008i8

author: JakeLFischer
text: As @MikeAScotto had, Jakob Poeltl's picking up his $19.5M option for '26-27, and then adding an additional three years, $84M through '29-30. Sources say the fourth-year of Poeltl's new $104M overall agreement has $5M guaranteed in year four, w/ structured language to grow richer.

author: JakeLFischer
text: I’ve been playing NBA free agency pods in the background between calls and texts all day. The Slop Gang’s show is the most hilarious/smart conversation, bar none. Glad I finally tapped in.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
Toronto didn’t want to include Jakob Poeltl in any trade for Kevin Durant. 

They wanted to give that a man a bag.

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: The Knicks have been telling prospective free agents that they are nearing a resolution to their coaching search, league…

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Kings afforded themselves the wiggle room to give Dennis Schroder his $15M AAV by swapping Valanciunas for Dario Saric, netting Schroder above the mid-level exception. Would think this ends any sign-and-trade momentum for Malik Monk to join Detroit.

author: JakeLFischer
text: There’s no additional terms in the trade between Sacramento and Denver, sources say. Straight up swap of Jonas Valanciunas for Dario Saric.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Damian Lillard is indeed being waived by Milwaukee, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: There is certainly more dust to settle from Myles Turner landing in Milwaukee, as ESPN reports. I’m being told the big man wanted to remain with the Pacers, who he helped lead to the Finals, but Indiana’s offers for Turner never truly exceeded the three-year, $60 million range.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Source confirms Yabusele goes to the Knicks. Denver was another leading option for the French big man, sources say, after Yabu received interest from San Antonio and Milwaukee as well.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Sacramento’s unfinished point guard business, and the many teams with interest in Al Horford and Guerschon Yabusele, seem to be the current pivot points at the top of the market this second morning of free agency.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
The Pistons have also been linked to Duncan Robinson, so targeting Monk makes sense in dollar bracket, secondary shooting. Capologists around the league have been penciling Schroder at two years, $28 million on Sacramento’s books for 2025-26.

More NBA: https://t.co/UhCV56RsoZ

author: JakeLFischer
text: An emerging option for the Pistons, sources say, is Detroit trading for Kings guard Malik Monk. Sounds like there’s a chance this deal, if agreed to, could turn into a sign-and-trade that brings Dennis Schroder to Sacramento.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Clint Capela is going to return to Houston by why of sign-and-trade, sources say. The Rockets are sending a 2031 second-round pick swap plus cash to the Hawks, in exchange for helping facilitate the veteran center’s second stop in Houston.

author: JakeLFischer
text: It's a 2027 Cleveland second-round pick, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Hawks are sending a second-round pick and cash to the Timberwolves, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Atlanta and Minnesota are in active conversations on a sign-and-trade for Nickeil Alexander-Walker, sources say.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I hope Josh Corbeil, Carl Eaton, & the rest of the Indy medical staff gets their flowers after tonight. The group has been together for along time & routinely finishes as a top ranked unit in the NBA. Since 2005, they rank as the 9th best medical staff, recording 6 top-5 & 8 top-10 regular season finishes. On to Game 7!

author: InStreetClothes
text: I had a student athletic trainer tell me our Game Ready looks like a Ghostbuster’s Ghost Trap and now I’m just walking around the athletic training room quoting the movie https://t.co/Wfgamn05UB

author: InStreetClothes
text: Interested to hear the results of Haliburton's MRI. I recorded 23 injuries labeled calf strains in the NBA during the regular season. Only one case did not result in time lost with the quickest turnaround being 3 days (1 game lost).

author: InStreetClothes
text: For those looking for more information on Maddy Siegrist, check out my prior breakdown of the injury following Kobe’s tibial plateau fracture: https://t.co/OWC2sViGNV

author: InStreetClothes
text: Tibial plateau fractures are relatively uncommon but several notable basketball players, including Kobe Bryant and teammate Paige Bueckers, have suffered the injury. Average time lost for cases in the NBA is ~10 weeks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report on @RotoWire: Zebby Matthews Out With Shoulder Strain https://t.co/SeFRrV0lLl

author: InStreetClothes
text: Anytime I see a hard foul in the playoffs I think of Stackhouse fouling Shaq in the 2006 Finals. Still salty Stack got suspended.

author: InStreetClothes
text: All the post GSW accomplishments Kevin Durant mentioned are even more impressive considering it was AFTER he tore his Achilles. He’s an outlier for what it means to come back from that injury and I hope Jayson Tatum joins him

author: InStreetClothes
text: New on InStreetClothes: Understanding Jaylen Brown's Knee Debridement: https://t.co/neZqvvHwrW

author: InStreetClothes
text: Debridement suggests this is most likely a partial meniscectomy. Meniscus injuries are all about location, meaning Brown’s problem was likely unrepairable.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Darius Garland Update: Cleveland announced their All-Star guard required surgery on his previously sprained big toe. Other players to undergo similar procedures include Devin Harris, Blake Griffin, & Jared Dudley. Based on these cases, a return by training camp seems realistic.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report for @RotoWire: Twins Rotation Takes Hit https://t.co/jXBghH72y7

author: InStreetClothes
text: Zach Edey's left ankle issues date back to last year's Summer League & carried over into the season. He missed 12 games following a sprain in November & another late in the year with left ankle soreness. His ligament(s) were clearly pushed past their yield point, thus surgery.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Portland traded Damian Lillard for Jrue Holiday, Toumani Camara, assets in 2023 – then Holiday to Boston for Robert Williams III, Malcolm Brogdon, assets (one led to Deni Avdija).

Now, Blazers have Lillard and Holiday, plus Avdija, Williams, Camara, a 2029 first, two MIL swaps.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lillard will use the 2025-26 season to rehabilitate a torn Achilles tendon, but a return to the franchise and Portland where his family and kids reside were of the ultimate importance. He also had multiple mid-level exception and minimum offers from NBA contenders.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lillard and the Trail Blazers both deeply cared about the comeback in recent weeks – with multiple meetings among the Portland franchise icon, general manager Joe Cronin and head coach Chauncey Billups to bond together and move forward united on a new deal.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lillard now will have a 2025-26 set salary of $70M between his Portland and Milwaukee deals, and a salary of $141M over the next two years ahead of an opt-out in 2027. Blazers officials and Aaron Goodwin of Goodwin Sports Management are finalizing terms this week.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Nine-time NBA All-Star Damian Lillard is finalizing a three-year, $42 million contract to return to the Portland Trail Blazers, sources tell ESPN. Deal is expected to include a player option in 2027-28 and a no-trade clause. A storybook reunion home for the 35-year-old. https://t.co/mm1uUtMgO6

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for NBA Today on why Bradley Beal chose to give up $13.9M in buyout with the Suns to team up with Kawhi Leonard and James Harden in LA: https://t.co/82rE6zVoRR

author: ShamsCharania
text: Livingston's progress this month in summer league for the Bucks helps him land a new deal -- 20 points and 5.3 rebounds per game while shooting 50% from the field and 37.5% from 3.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Milwaukee Bucks are re-signing forward Chris Livingston on a fully guaranteed one-year, $2.3 million deal, Rich Paul and Brandon Cavanaugh of Klutch Sports tell ESPN. Livingston, the 58th pick in the 2023 NBA draft, receives a third consecutive year on a guaranteed contract. https://t.co/yRQHzrMZxZ

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full ESPN story on three-time All-Star Bradley Beal agreeing to a contract buyout with the Phoenix Suns to join the Los Angeles Clippers after extensive meetings with a host of suitors: https://t.co/j1C8568BQc

author: ShamsCharania
text: This now gives the Suns increased team-building flexibility by taking them out of the first and second aprons, providing access to more tradeable draft picks in the future, and opening up part of the mid-level exception to utilize.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Beal became extremely excited about the route to part ways after meeting with multiple interested suitors, and Bartelstein then moved forward with the Suns on completing the release Wednesday, opening the path for Beal to start a new chapter in LA.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The crux of the decision for Beal and his representation was finding the best basketball situation first and foremost once he was granted permission by the Suns to speak to interested suitors around the NBA, and Bartelstein led an exhaustive process over the last few weeks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Three-time NBA All-Star Bradley Beal has agreed to a contract buyout with the Phoenix Suns and plans to join the Los Angeles Clippers on a two-year, $11 million deal with a player option after clearing waivers, Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports told ESPN. https://t.co/gxZB0ObSms

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for NBA Today on Paul George's surgically repaired knee and how this impacts his and the 76ers offseason: https://t.co/leOf6zp8u5

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks center Dereck Lively II has undergone surgery to clean up bone spurs in his right foot, sources tell ESPN. He is expected to be healthy for training camp. https://t.co/OdzHjV3zA8

author: ShamsCharania
text: Former Celtics forward Drew Peterson has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Charlotte Hornets, agents Mike Silverman and Troy Payne of Equity Sports tell ESPN. Hornets' Charles Lee coached Peterson in Boston two seasons ago.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Philadelphia 76ers star Paul George underwent a successful arthroscopic procedure on his left knee Monday to treat an injury suffered during a recent workout, a team official tells ESPN. George will now begin a rehab program and be re-evaluated prior to start of training camp. https://t.co/cMX6uANlmY

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies and two-way guard Cam Spencer's representatives, Mark Bartelstein and Ross Aroyo of @PrioritySports, have restructured the agreement to re-sign: Spencer is now inking a new four-year, $10.5 million deal, with three fully guaranteed seasons, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania

author: ShamsCharania
text: Cleveland Cavaliers president Koby Altman – the architect of the burgeoning title contender – has signed a contract extension through 2029-30, sources tell ESPN. Cavs' front office, including Mike Gansey and Brandon Weems, received extensions amid rise to No. 1 seed in East. https://t.co/hd289tXfxs

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians are 2.5 games back in the wild-card race. Trust me, they don't want to trade Kwan unless they get a deal they simply can't refuse. Their plan was upended by injuries, Ortiz and Clase situations. 

Convinced Clase was getting dealt.

Hate if Kwan goes, but it's business

Be prepared for Joe Mazzulla to tweak how the Celtics play.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens says of Jayson Tatum that there is no expectation on a timeline to return, but there is an expectation of a full recovery.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
On the term “rebuild,” Brad Stevens says emphatically, “That’s not going to be a part of the lexicon in our building.”

The reason? The Celtics already have their core in place: Tatum, Brown, White, Pritchard, etc.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Stevens describes Anfernee Simons’ ability to score and make hard shots as “pretty elite.” 

On Georges Niang, Stevens says that he adds value to winning and is “a pain to play against.” Says it’s no coincidence that Niang’s been in the rotation for very good teams (76ers, Cavs, etc).

author: InStreetClothes
text: For those looking for more insight into Jaylen Brown's meniscus injury, I have previously discussed meniscus tears in the NBA here: https://t.co/OvyP3ij2bP

author: InStreetClothes
text:
More NBA injury news: According to @ramonashelburne Jaylen Brown played through a partial meniscus tear. Hard to pinpoint exactly when it occurred.

The first signs of a knee issue surfaced in February when he missed time w/ knee swelling. He missed 12 total games from that point forward w/ what was described as pain or impingement.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The latest update on Aaron Gordon is sadly a big one. A Grade 2 strain is often referred to as a partial or incomplete tear. Average time lost for G2 hamstring strains in the NBA is ~31 days (11.2 games). Gordon’s 2020 season also ended early following a strain of the same hammy.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: guard Cole Anthony agrees to buyout with Memphis, plans to join Bucks on one-year deal - via ESPN https://t.co/mnlxAdY65n

author: ShamsCharania
text: Cole Anthony has agreed to a contract buyout with the Memphis Grizzlies and plans to sign with the Milwaukee Bucks after he clears waivers, sources tell ESPN. Grizzlies finalized the buyout with Jeff Schwartz and Javon Phillips of Excel Sports for Anthony's new opportunity. https://t.co/HnCsmxaqcz

author: ShamsCharania
text: McCollum's four-year term expired and he will now serve in an advisory position. Major new union role for VanVleet, the 2019 NBA champion who has signed multiple deals that have set records for the highest paid undrafted player ever in the league.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Houston Rockets guard Fred VanVleet has been elected as the new President of the National Basketball Players Association, succeeding CJ McCollum, sources tell ESPN. VanVleet begins a four-year term as the next NBPA leader. https://t.co/Ghl3kcjg3m

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Isaiah Jackson has agreed to a three-year, $21 million deal to return to the Indiana Pacers, CAA's Drew Morrison and Sam Rose tell ESPN. Pacers are excited about Jackson's development, return, and now lock in a young member of their core. https://t.co/pHbAJB8Zyq

author: ShamsCharania
text: Herb Jones developed from a second-rounder to two-way stalwart and first team All-Defense in 2023-24. He is one of eight players with 350 steals and 150 blocks since entering NBA in 2021, and ranks in top-10 in defense against isolations over last two seasons, per ESPN Research.

author: ShamsCharania
text: New Orleans Pelicans forward Herb Jones has agreed to a three-year, $68 million contract extension with the franchise, Mark Bartelstein and Kieran Piller of @PrioritySports told ESPN. Jones now has a total five years and $97M on his Pelicans deal – with player option in 2029-30. https://t.co/qXTvYT7Rym

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent Marvin Bagley III has agreed to a one-year deal with the Washington Wizards, sources tell ESPN. Bagley returns to the Wizards after playing in Washington for a year (2024-25) and then being traded to Memphis at the February deadline. https://t.co/AkBE7745Uc

author: ShamsCharania
text: Jalen Williams, Thunder agree to rookie max extension worth up to $287M - via ESPN https://t.co/J2hDpnpQzU

author: ShamsCharania
text: Tune into NBA Today on ESPN 2 at 3 pm ET for more on the Thunder locking in their Big 3 for the long term, and as much as $822 million total.

author: ShamsCharania
text: After becoming the second-youngest team in NBA history to win a title, the Thunder now have long-term commitments from their Big 3 of Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (26), Williams (24) and Chet Holmgren (23) to play together through the rest of the decade as they enter their primes.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Oklahoma City Thunder All-NBA star and champion Jalen Williams has agreed to a five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $287 million, agents Bill Duffy and Justin Haynes of WME Basketball told ESPN. https://t.co/3lwASY42iT

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Phoenix Suns are hiring Orlando Magic assistant Jesse Mermuys as a top assistant coach on Jordan Ott's staff, sources tell ESPN. Critical hire for Ott to lure a lead assistant from a well-respected Magic staff.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Washington Wizards are re-signing 7-footer Tristan Vukcevic to a two-way NBA deal, sources tell ESPN. Vukcevic averaged 9.4 points and 3.7 rebounds in 14.6 minutes per game last season and will enter his third NBA campaign.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Jordan McLaughlin has agreed to a one-year, $3 million deal to return to the San Antonio Spurs, agent Greg Lawrence of Wasserman told ESPN. McLaughlin split last season with the Spurs and Kings, and now enters his seventh NBA campaign as a reserve guard. https://t.co/DzyvaSP5cb

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Phoenix Suns and Devin Booker reaching historic $145 million extension that now keeps the franchise's all-time leading scorer through 2030: https://t.co/mrHQznCMXe

author: ShamsCharania
text: Booker, the Suns No. 13 overall pick in the 2015 Draft, has played all 10 NBA seasons in Phoenix and now lands his third contract extension with the franchise. He doubles down again on his loyalty to the Suns – and wanting to win there – in an era of frequent player movement.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Booker and owner Mat Ishbia met in Las Vegas tonight to finalize the contract, which cements Booker’s commitment to the Suns vision for the future and him as the franchise’s leader moving forward. Booker now has five years and $316 million total on his Suns deal.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Phoenix Suns superstar Devin Booker has agreed to a two-year, $145 million maximum contract extension with the franchise through the 2029-30 season, the highest annual extension salary in NBA history, CAA’s Jessica Holtz and Melvin Booker told ESPN. https://t.co/A5U5VPlSgx

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Philadelphia 76ers are signing former Spurs and Hawks forward Dominick Barlow on a two-way NBA contract, Life Sports Agency CEO Todd Ramasar tells ESPN.

text:

author: twithersCLE
text:
Feel awful for MJ Emerson. Terrific kid. Always upbeat, polite. He was eager to bounce back and have a big season for the Browns, who will miss him.

Wishing him a speedy recovery.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Feel awful for MJ Emerson. Nice kid, always friendly, polite. He was eager to have a big, bounce-back season for Browns, who will undoubtedly miss him. 

Wishing him a speedy recovery.

https://t.co/uBBdaj6PlH

author: twithersCLE
text: Browns CB Martin Emerson Jr. suffered Achilles tendon injury in practice. He'll undergo MRI to confirm severity.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Hopefully we'll know more about Emerson following Browns practice. Doesn't look good.

He spoke earlier about having a big season. This would be major blow to secondary.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Jimmy Haslam described 3-14 finish last season as "disaster." Remains confident in Stefanski and Berry to turn things around. 
"Do they need to do better?" he said. "Yeah. But so do Dee and I."

author: twithersCLE
text: Jimmy Haslam said he's "cautiously optimistic" about Quinshon Judkins playing this season. He said Browns taking a hard look at vetting process in pre-draft evaluations.

author: twithersCLE
text: Dee Haslam opened with thoughtful remarks about the NYC shooting tragedy, which took place in building where NFL headquarters are located.

author: twithersCLE
text: Jimmy Haslam impressed with job coach Stefanski and his staff have done with four-quarterback competition in camp. He was sorry Pickett "got a little dinged up."

author: twithersCLE
text: Asked what he's learned as an NFL owner, Jimmy Haslam quipped: "It doesn't look like very much."

author: twithersCLE
text: Haslams have 99.9% confidence the dome project in Brook Park will get done. They expect groundbreaking early in 2026.

author: twithersCLE
text: Jimmy Haslam dismissed narrative he was responsible for drafting Shedeur Sanders: "Andrew (Berry) made the call to pick Shedeur."

author: twithersCLE
text: Just finished with Dee and Jimmy Haslam availability. No major headlines. They touched on issues ranging from QB situations to stadium. https://t.co/7FDyCN2HTb

author: twithersCLE
text: Concerts are so much better sans phones.

More:…

author: JakeLFischer
text: Isaac Nogués Gonzalez is signing with the Sacramento Kings, per source, where the Rip City alum will compete for a two-way contract.

author: JakeLFischer
text: East Carolina guard RJ Felton is signing with the Indiana Pacers, according to a league source.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Missouri guard Tamar Bates is signing a two-way contract with the Nuggets, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: It's pick No. 59, plus the draft rights to Justinian Jessup, and a top-50 protected 2032 second-rounder from Golden State to jump up to No. 56 with Memphis and take Will Richard, sources say. Jahmai Mashack will be the pick for the Grizzlies.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Warriors are trading up to No. 56 to select Florida guard Will Richard, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Indiana Pacers are taking Taelon Peter at No. 54, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Utah will select John Tonje at No. 53, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Warriors will select Australian wing Alex Toohey with the No. 52 pick, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
The Clippers are trading No. 51 plus the draft rights to Luka Mitrovic in order to jump from No. 50 and select Kobe Sanders. 

The Knicks get more draft rights! (cc @FredKatz)

author: JakeLFischer
text: New York is trading the No. 50 pick to the Clippers, where Los Angeles moves up from No. 51 to take Kobe Sanders, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Tyrese Proctor is going to Cleveland at No. 49, sources say, where the Cavaliers will sign the Duke guard to a multi-year deal.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Memphis is taking Javon Small at No. 48, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Milwaukee will select Bogoljub Marković with the No. 48 pick, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Amari Williams is the pick at No. 46 for Boston, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Brooks Barnhizer to OKC at No. 44, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: At No. 42, Sacramento is going to select Maxime Raynaud, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Phoenix is taking Koby Brea at No. 41, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Micah Peavy to the Pelicans at No. 40, per sources.

author: JakeLFischer
text: While the Hornets originally intended to trade one of their two picks here, Charlotte is keeping Creighton center Ryan Kalkbrenner, sources say.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Brian is on top of things as usual

author: InStreetClothes
text: Severity of the strain will ultimately dictate how much time Steph Curry potentially misses. Average time lost for confirmed G1 strain is ~10 days. That jumps to ~31 days for G2 strains. Time lost for nondescript strains is ~12 days.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I have recorded 125 various injury entries for Steph Curry in his NBA career. This will be the first hamstring-related injury of note.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @JaredSGreenberg: DeAndre Hunter has a dislocated thumb and will be questionable for tomorrow’s game 2 @NBAonTNT @NBATV

author: InStreetClothes
text: LeBron James injury news: Grade 2 sprains are also known as partial or incomplete tears. Surgery isn’t often warranted, especially if the medial meniscus is unaffected. Other players to suffer G2 MCL sprains include Kevin Durant, Marc Gasol, & SGA w/ the injury carrying in an average time lost of ~41 days (~21 games)

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report for @RotoWire: Gilbert Hits IL https://t.co/IMFlZSc1AN

author: InStreetClothes
text: Injury info on Damian Lillard: The average time lost for qualifying NBA players following an Achilles tear is ~10 months. Dame is 54 days older than Kobe was when he tore his Achilles. Bryant was back in action in 240 days (~7.9 months)

author: InStreetClothes
text: The integrity of the Achilles can be tested by a medical professional using a simple but highly accurate special test known as the Thompson test. MRIs are often needed just for confirmation. Hate this for Dame.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @ChrisBHaynes: Milwaukee Bucks star Damian Lillard will not return tonight against the Indiana Pacers, league sources tell me. Injury po…

author: InStreetClothes
text: I launched https://t.co/eAm93BKSY6 & started counting injuries on a daily basis 11 years ago & it still catches me off guard when people cite or reference my work. Thanks to @WindhorstESPN for the shoutout on the pod today

author: InStreetClothes
text: Injury update on Jimmy Butler: A glute contusion is an ideal outcome for the Warriors forward & one he is familiar with. Butler suffered a glute contusion during the 2023 playoffs & never missed a game. The average time lost for all other glute contusions is 5.2 days (~1.0 game).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Somehow managed to avoid waking up the whole house after Seguin’s game-winner! Silent fist pump mastered https://t.co/qP5XEUztCn

author: InStreetClothes
text: Any good AT knows the value of the 4-wing bandage

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report on @RotoWire: Cramps Shouldn't Derail Glasnow https://t.co/B3Ow9D6s99

author: InStreetClothes
text: Shoutout to all the Mavs fans that were in the FedEx Forum tonight especially the group that surrounded and encouraged my visibly upset 9 and 13 y.o. kiddos. Not the ending they wanted but memories made.

author: InStreetClothes
text: A lot more players in uniform than there was on Sunday https://t.co/sgb5n2UQUY

author: InStreetClothes
text: Odd injury note on Jimmy Butler & pelvic contusions: No team in the ISC injury database has suffered more pelvic contusions than Golden State. Other notable names on the list include Andrew Bogut, Draymond, & Steph Curry and Kuminga from earlier this season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Since the 2005-06 season, the average time lost for pelvic contusions league wide is 6.9 days (~2.1 games).  Butler's impending  MRI will provide more context and hopefully nothing more significant has occurred.

author: InStreetClothes
text: UPDATE: Jayson Tatum's wrist injury is being described as a right distal radius bone bruise. Translation: The wrist end (distal) of the forearm bone on his thumb side (radius) has been damaged. The average time lost for nondescript wrist bone contusions is 2.6 days (~0.6 game).

author: InStreetClothes
text: However, the term bruise can be misleading. The body’s natural healing response doesn't differentiate between a bone bruise & a fracture, repairing both in a similar fashion. This takes time & symptoms can linger.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
.@RMBaloncesto (Real Madrid) released the following statement today on Hugo Gonzalez.

It closes with, "Real Madrid expresses its gratitude for his exemplary conduct and commitment throughout his time in our colours, and wishes him the best of luck in this new stage of his career."

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
English translation:
---
I want to thank the entire Real Madrid club for their love and treatment during these eight years and, no less important, teaching me how to play basketball and training me with values. 

This stage closes today and I am very proud to have fulfilled a dream: to compete with the best players in Europe in the best club in the world. Something that that little eleven-year-old boy has not yet assumed, but that he will never be able to repay this club for everything it did for him.

Anyone who knows me knows that I have dedicated my entire life to Real Madrid. I have become the player I am today largely because of this club and wherever I go there will always be another Real Madrid player. I have been since I was a child and turned on the television to see my idols win big titles, without imagining that I would be part of this legendary legacy.

I don't want to forget all the people who have helped me throughout my career: coaches, physiotherapists, delegates, physical trainers, props, press, doctors, etc. Those people who often work in the shadows and do not get the recognition they deserve. Of course, to President Florentino Pérez, Juan Carlos Sánchez, Alberto Herreros, Alberto Angulo and Pablo Sañudo, who trusted me from day one.

Of course, I want to thank our fans for cheering me on and defending me in every game, playing for the best club on the planet.

Finally, I want to tell you that our paths will cross again, of that I am sure. Meanwhile, from a distance, I will support the team as much or more than I do as a player. I love Real Madrid and I couldn't be more grateful for everything they have given me.

See you soon and good luck,

Hala Madrid!

Hugo.

author: ShamsCharania
text: OKC's Chet Holmgren agrees to rookie max extension - via ESPN https://t.co/DEyO0xzoU2

author: ShamsCharania
text: After missing three months during the season, Holmgren returned in February and came back stronger to help lead OKC and its young core to the NBA title. The Thunder will now move toward locking in All-NBA superstar Jalen Williams, who has momentum in his rookie extension talks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Oklahoma City Thunder star and NBA champion Chet Holmgren has agreed to a fully guaranteed five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $250 million, agent Bill Duffy of WME Basketball told ESPN. https://t.co/PsdxZq275C

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Spurs acquire Kelly Olynyk in deal with Wizards - via ESPN https://t.co/3NeXdWdB8c

author: ShamsCharania
text: The deal gives the Spurs another stretch big after the free agent signing of Luke Kornet, and Washington receives two more young players as the Wizards continue to add some talent this offseason with potential for increased opportunity along with an expected later second-rounder.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Washington Wizards are trading Kelly Olynyk to the San Antonio Spurs for Malaki Branham, Blake Wesley and a 2026 second-round pick (least favorable of Dallas, Philadelphia, Oklahoma City), sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/JWiOF2nzq2

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Oklahoma City Thunder are re-signing 7-footer Branden Carlson to a new two-way NBA contract, Ross Aroyo of @PrioritySports tells ESPN. Carlson played 32 games for the Thunder last season and had a standout campaign for the OKC Blue.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Summer of SGA: MVP award, league scoring title, an NBA championship, Finals MVP, a $285 million super max extension, first signature shoe release ... and now Shai Gilgeous-Alexander will grace the new cover of NBA 2K26, per sources.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks All-Star Anthony Davis underwent a procedure to repair a detached retina that he suffered during the season, sources tell ESPN. Davis played through multiple hits to the face last year. He is expected to be healthy for next training camp. https://t.co/Yz8vxBlp06

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent F Isaiah Livers will sign a two-way NBA contract with the Phoenix Suns, Andy Shiffman and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports tell ESPN. Livers missed all of last season due to hip surgery but has made a full recovery and now restarts career for his fourth NBA season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Paolo Banchero, Magic agree to five-year rookie max extension - via ESPN https://t.co/PJ0O0MqfzO

author: ShamsCharania
text: This cements the Magic core of Banchero, Franz Wagner and Jalen Suggs now all under contract for the next five years.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Orlando Magic star Paolo Banchero has agreed to a five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $287 million, Mike Miller of LIFT Sports Management tells ESPN. Deal includes a player option; the first for a rookie max since 2021 (Luka Doncic, Trae Young). https://t.co/bwnCrJbnmu

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Kyle Lowry has agreed to a one-year deal to return to the Philadelphia 76ers, Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports tells ESPN. The 2019 champion is back for his 20th NBA season – and a third consecutive year with his hometown 76ers. https://t.co/6Wnw3S9TT3

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full ESPN story on the Clippers, Heat, Jazz three-team trade that sends Norman Powell to Miami and John Collins to L.A.: https://t.co/mi2Pdc5JPk

author: ShamsCharania
text: Miami is acquiring a major scoring punch in Powell while the Clippers find a dynamic lob threat. Both Powell and Collins are coming off strong seasons. Utah has turned Collins' expiring deal into an asset in the form of a second-rounder in return.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Clippers, Jazz and Heat have agreed to a trade that sends Norman Powell to Miami, John Collins to Los Angeles, and Kevin Love, Kyle Anderson and a 2027 Clippers second-round pick to the Jazz, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/o0FkV0o2l8

author: ShamsCharania
text: Ryan Rollins agrees to 3-year deal to return to Bucks - via ESPN https://t.co/1CKM9XyQQX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Rollins, a 2022 second-rounder, joined the Bucks on a two-way contract in Feb. 2024 and spent most of 2024-25 on a two-way before receiving a standard deal in March. He opted for a rest of season contract, became an unrestricted free agent and now is rewarded with a $12M deal.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Ryan Rollins has agreed to a three-year, $12 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks, with a player option in the third season, agents Mike Silverman and Brandon Grier of Equity Sports tell ESPN. https://t.co/pUIflaivzw

text: The NBA names three-time NBA champion James Jones has been appointed Executive Vice President, Head of Basketball Operations.  Jones joins the league office after working the last eight seasons in the Phoenix Suns and replaces Joe Dumars.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
An executive this afternoon framed Minnesota’s trade conversations at No. 31 as “the Rasheer Fleming sweepstakes.” 

With Phoenix moving up to the second round’s top selection, sources say the St. Joseph’s product is indeed high on the Suns’ board.

author: JakeLFischer
text: James Borrego’s interview for the Knicks head coaching job is scheduled to be held in-person with New York this weekend, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Minnesota, with the No. 31 and first pick of tonight’s second round, is also fielding trade interest for the Timberwolves’ selection, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Chicago informed the league this morning they were fielding offers for No. 45, sources say. Other known spots open for trade: Charlotte, with one of Nos. 33, 34, Toronto (No. 39), Golden State (No. 41) and OKC (No. 44).

author: JakeLFischer
text: When you don't misread any texts and fuck up any picks. https://t.co/61i478tHK1

author: JakeLFischer
text: To close the first round of the 2025 NBA Draft, the Los Angeles Clippers are selecting Yanic Konan Niederhauser at No. 30, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Liam McNeeley's slide ends with the Hornets at No. 29, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Danny Wolf to the Brooklyn Nets at No. 27, source says.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Sacramento Kings are sending a top-16 protected 2027 first-round pick from San Antonio to Oklahoma City, per source, in exchange for the No. 24 pick and the right to draft Nique Clifford.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Georgia product Asa Newell, who Atlanta was very much considering at No. 13, sources say, is going to be the Hawks' selection at No. 23 following their Derik Queen trade with New Orleans.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Had heard plenty of buzz about Washington liking Will Riley at No 18. They get the Illinois product here at No. 21, per source.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Kasparas Jakučionis is going No. 20 to Miami, per source.

author: JakeLFischer
text: I'm hearing Nolan Traore at No. 19 to Brooklyn.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Utah is sending Nos. 21, 43 and two future second-round picks to Washington, per source, to select Florida guard Walter Clayton.

author: JakeLFischer
text: A Nuggets source just texted me: "Chinese Jokic," about the Blazers' surprise selection.

author: JakeLFischer
text: There's no trade here, either. The Blazers are keeping Yang, per source.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Other random NBA injury notes:

1. 3 Players missed all 82 games (Bey, Topic, & Holmes)

2. The bottom 8 teams all set franchise highs for the inactive list era

3. The cumulative total for games lost to injury or illness since 2005-06 surpassed 100,000

author: InStreetClothes
text: The 5 healthiest teams during the regular season were Minnesota, Houston, Sacramento, Golden State with Phoenix & Milwaukee tying for 5th. Rounding out the bottom 5 were Philly, Brooklyn, Charlotte, New Orleans, & Dallas.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My initial total for games lost to injury or illness in the NBA this season comes in at 6779, the second highest total since 2005. If games lost to COVID-19 or healthy and safety protocols are excluded, it is the highest total in my database.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Impressed by the sheer number of injuries the top picks in the WNBA draft have overcome throughout their young careers. The list of injuries to the top 10 include ACL tears, meniscus tears, a tibial plateau fracture, concussions, ankle sprains, & surgeries on feet, ankles, & toes.

author: InStreetClothes

author: InStreetClothes
text: Following last night's games, the total games lost to injury or illness in the NBA surpassed the 6,000 mark for just the second time since the 2005-06 season. The only other time this has occurred was during the 2021-22 season that was ravaged by the Omicron variant of COVID-19.

author: InStreetClothes
text: To add a bit of clarity for those asking, these totals do NOT include games attributed to rest or injury management. It also excludes players on two-way contracts.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Denver has informed Jonas Valanciunas' reps that the franchise fully intends to have him honor his contract as the Nuggets view Valanciunas as a critical center addition to back up Nikola Jokic and play alongside him. Greek team Panathinaikos pursued Valanciunas in recent days.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Terms of the first ever NBA trade involving seven teams.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
PHX: Jalen Green, Dillon Brooks, Khaman Maluach, Rasheer Fleming, Koby Brea, Daeqwon Plowden, 2nd

HOU: Kevin Durant, Clint Capela

BKN: 2 2nds

GSW: Alex Toohey, Jahmai Mashack

ATL: 2nd swap, David Roddy, cash

LAL: Adou Thiero

MIN: Rocco Zikarsky, 2 2nds, cash

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Grizzlies trading center Jay Huff to Pacers - via ESPN https://t.co/i4H0HN0SXV

author: ShamsCharania
text: Rockets trade Cam Whitmore to Wizards, sources say - via ESPN https://t.co/5pjYhbDH09

author: ShamsCharania
text: After departure of Myles Turner, Pacers trade for the 7-foot-1 Huff, who averaged 6.9 points, 2 rebounds and nearly 1 block in 11.7 minutes per night. He shot 41% from 3-point range last season, playing in 64 games after just a total of 31 contests in his first three seasons.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Jock Landale has agreed to a deal with the Memphis Grizzlies, sources tell ESPN. Landale solidifies the Grizzlies frontcourt as the team and his agent, Sammy Wloszczowski of SIG Sports, reach terms.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies are trading center Jay Huff to the Indiana Pacers for one second-round pick and one second-round pick swap, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Rockets worked with Whitmore, the No. 20 pick in 2023, and his reps at WME Basketball over the last few weeks on a new home. Whitmore has averaged 10.8 points over two years -- last season scoring 0.46 points per touch, 4th-best among players to record 1,000 touches.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Houston Rockets are trading Cam Whitmore to the Washington Wizards for two second-round picks, sources tell ESPN. The deal gives Whitmore a tremendous opportunity for an increased role as he turns 21 on Tuesday and returns to the DMV area. https://t.co/8BaBsVxjN2

author: ShamsCharania
text: Wagner, who sustained ACL tear in December, was averaging a career high 12.9 points and shooting a career-best 36% from 3 before injury. Through his 30 games, Wagner had emerged as a Sixth Man of the Year candidate and led NBA in PPG among players to average under 20 minutes.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward/center Moe Wagner has agreed to a one-year, $5 million deal to return to the Orlando Magic, sources tell ESPN. Wagner's agent, Jason Glushon, reached the new contract with Magic executives on Friday. https://t.co/YInqnHBFef

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Jabari Walker has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Philadelphia 76ers, source tells ESPN. Walker spent his first three NBA seasons in Portland, appearing in 188 games.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Hayes emerged as the Lakers starting center last season and shot a career high 72.2% from the field and finished top-10 in field goal percentage allowed as contesting defender on layups and dunks among players to contest 250+ shots. Now backs up new Lakers big man Deandre Ayton.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Jaxson Hayes has agreed on a one-year deal to return to the Los Angeles Lakers, sources tell ESPN. Hayes' agents, Bill Duffy and Marlon Harrison of WME Basketball, finalized a contract with Lakers president Rob Pelinka on Thursday. https://t.co/fZOeqVyo9u

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Houston Rockets are waiving center Jock Landale ahead of his July 7 guarantee date, sources tell ESPN. Landale is expected to sign with his preferred destination upon clearing waivers.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks assistant Jared Dudley is finalizing a deal to become the top assistant coach for the Denver Nuggets under David Adelman, Andy Miller of Klutch Sports tells ESPN. Dudley has been on Mavs' staff since 2021 after a 14-year NBA career. https://t.co/sA5gN2yp8h

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks player development coach God Shammgod has agreed to join the Orlando Magic as an assistant coach, Andy Miller of Klutch Sports tells ESPN. Shammgod has worked for the Mavericks since 2019 and now receives a larger role in Orlando.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Celtics VP of Basketball Ops Mike Zarren says the team's decisions tonight boiled down to wanting to add future assets, all while having the chance to acquire guys that they liked later in the second round.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Hugo Gonzalez (No. 28)
Amari Williams (No. 46)
Max Shulga (No. 57)

Tell me what you're all thinking and feeling after this Celtics Draft and I'm gonna pull a few comments into the pod tonight!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: RT @celtics: When @hugoglezz_ got the call 📞 https://t.co/23euYyMoaE

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
RT @celtics: Hugo Gonzalez already has loads of professional experience under his belt despite being only 19.

“He's a young guy, but a lit…

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens was asked about specific skills that stand out to him about Hugo Gonzalez. He immediately answered, "Cutting." He added that Gonzalez has "a willingness to do sacrificial things" for the betterment of the team.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens says Jayson Tatum has been at the practice facility "pretty much every day." He said Jaylen Brown has also been at the facility and has advanced into some light on-court movement.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens says he could feel it during the postseason when the Celtics' offense got stagnant. He pointed to the two Finals teams as groups that played with elite ball and player movement, and said the Celtics will strive to get back to that next season.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: I asked Brad Stevens about the challenges of drafting and projecting players late in the first round. He said for him, it comes back to finding players who play with competitive character and who fit into the physical style of ball the Celtics want to play.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens on Hugo Gonzalez: "He's tough. He's hard-playing. He cuts. He goes after the ball. He competes. He's got all the intangibles of a winning basketball player."

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
ESPN's Jonathan Givony says "the Boston Celtics got one of the biggest steals of the Draft here in my view," with their selection of Hugo Gonzalez at No. 28.

Givony described Gonzalez as having strong court vision, as a tremendous athlete, as having a high-motor, and says he plays with "frenetic energy."

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Cooper Flagg, the basketball prospect, reminds me a lot of Bryce Harper, the baseball prospect. Both heralded from a very young age. Both all-around impactful players. Both could’ve been in the pros before they actually were in the pros. Both exceptionally competitive.

Harper lived up to the hype. I expect Flagg to do the same.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
RT @celtics: "I'm gonna go to war for this city." 

And the rest is history for JB ☘️ https://t.co/sGDSffY3hR

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Celtics VP of Basketball Ops says that the Celtics believed they'd be able to get quality players at 46 and 57 who were similar to the level of player they would've drafted at 32.

So they got two players they liked, plus added two future assets. Win-win as of tonight.

author: JakeLFischer
text: We’re all bracing for a ton of trade activity throughout the first round this evening, but there’s already been plenty of word on deals to be expected at the top of the second as well.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Hawks have been looking for advantageous trades with their $25 million TPE, and still maintained that tool by sending out Terance Mann and Georges Niang. Atlanta, $30M below the tax line, is still open for business, sources say, potentially in sign-and-trade market as well.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
Atlanta made a lot of calls on Terance Mann this week, sources say. It's a 2031 Cleveland second-rounder heading to Boston along with Georges Niang. 

The Nets now have Nos. 8, 19, 22, 26, 27, in tomorrow night's first round lol

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Denver Nuggets and Calvin Booth failed to reach terms on an extension that both parties felt was satisfactory before the 2024-25 season got underway, sources tell me. Booth, instrumental in helping the franchise capture a title, was on an expiring contract.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Denver Nuggets owner Josh Kroenke: “While the timing of this decision is unfortunate, as Coach Malone helped build the foundation of our now championship level program, it is a necessary step to allow us to compete at the highest level right now. Championship level standards and expectations remain in place for the current season, and as we look to the future, we look forward to building on the foundations laid by Coach Malone over his record-breaking 10-year career in Denver.”

text:
Hank Aaron, lifelong Browns fan. 

He'd attend games in disguise and sit in Cleveland's famous Dawg Pound.

text:
Props to MLB for this year's All-Star jerseys -- or rather their absence.

This is how it should be.

text: Guardians placed reliever Paul Sewald on IL with right shoulder strain.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Let's hear it for the catcher.

Big Dumper. Derby Thumper.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Really enjoyed CNN's documentary on Live Aid. First of four episodes aired last night.

Above all, the reflection after 40 years was a reminder that when we are united by a cause, when we put humanity first, it's a better world.

The interviews with Bob Geldof are fascinating.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 22 Injury Report

W22 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 328
Total Games Lost for Season: 5625

W22 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 21
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 207

Notable new injuries:
Steph Curry: Pelvic contusion
Trey Murphy: Shoulder dislocation

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 23 Injury Report 

W23 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 321
Total Games Lost for Season: 5945

W23 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 25
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 232

Notable new injuries:
LaMelo Ball: Ankle & wrist surgery
Damian Lillard: DVT

author: InStreetClothes
text: After Wemby's DVT in late February, Dame Lillard becomes the latest NBA player to be diagnosed with a blood clot, joining a list that includes Ausar Thompson, Tyreke Evans, Chris Bosh, and Brandon Ingram.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Lillard's DVT is in his lower extremity and determining the cause of the clot will be important for his long-term health. He has been placed on blood-thinners but those obviously make him a risk for increased bleeding and often result in considerable time lost.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I previously discussed DVTs when Ingram was diagnosed back in 2019. https://t.co/YduNYU1pht

author: ShamsCharania
text: Ayton will sign a two-year deal with the Lakers, with a player option, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Lakers find their starting center in Ayton, the 2018 No. 1 overall pick who is the only player in NBA history to average 15+ points and 60%+ shooting in the postseason. He has career averages of 16.4 points and 10.5 rebounds on 59% shooting over the last seven seasons.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Deandre Ayton has agreed to sign with the Los Angeles Lakers, sources tell ESPN. Between Portland and L.A., Ayton will earn $34 million next season. Agents Nima Namakian of Innovate Sports and Bill Duffy of WME Sports reached the deal with Lakers president Rob Pelinka. https://t.co/FUeNAkN19K

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Dante Exum has agreed to a one-year deal to return to the Dallas Mavericks, sources tell ESPN. Exum considered two other contenders but returns to Dallas to share ball-handling duties to start the season with D'Angelo Russell. https://t.co/3GZBxTgb8c

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Hornets, Spencer Dinwiddie agree to 1-year deal - via ESPN https://t.co/Z5lZcpoM1n

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Spencer Dinwiddie has agreed to a one-year deal with the Charlotte Hornets, sources tell ESPN. Dinwiddie averaged 14.3 points and 6.2 assists as a starter for the Mavs a season ago and provides a reliable scorer, passer and leader for a young Hornets backcourt. https://t.co/piYDtPQOxt

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for @SportsCenter on the breaking news that the New York Knicks are set to hire Mike Brown as their new head coach: https://t.co/yTJS5Dk6Zz

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Knicks expected to hire Mike Brown as next head coach - via ESPN https://t.co/Gjrz7QnXcy

author: ShamsCharania
text: Brown is a four-time champion as a top assistant in Golden State and San Antonio under Steve Kerr and Gregg Popovich and has coached an array of superstars across three decades coaching in the NBA. Most recently in 2022-23, Brown's Kings had the best-rated offense in the NBA.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Knicks president Leon Rose underwent a thorough process since the firing of Tom Thibdoeau a month ago. The Knicks requested permission for five NBA head coaches and were denied, then interviewed several available coaches and went through multi-round stages with candidates.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The New York Knicks are expected to land on two-time NBA Coach of the Year Mike Brown as the franchise's next head coach, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/LOXb74LFe4

author: ShamsCharania
text: On Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and the Thunder reaching a record $285 million supermax contract for ESPN's NBA Free Agency special: https://t.co/87LA24KbmP

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Tre Mann has agreed to a three-year, $24 million deal with the Charlotte Hornets, sources tell ESPN. Hornets officials and Mann's agent Aaron Turner of Verus Sports negotiated terms of the new contract in free agency. https://t.co/mcputliCTQ

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Pistons, Duncan Robinson agree to 3-year, $48M deal - via ESPN https://t.co/IcQbtOHZiM

author: ShamsCharania
text: Detroit is trading Simone Fontecchio to Miami to acquire Duncan Robinson in a sign-and-trade, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Robinson departs Miami after spending his first seven NBA seasons with the Heat, and his 1,202 career 3-pointers are the most in Heat franchise history and he's become one of eight undrafted players with 1,000 3s made.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent shooter Duncan Robinson has agreed to a three-year, $48 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources tell ESPN. Agent Jason Glushon navigated multiple options in the market, which included potential return to Miami or move elsewhere. Now Robinson lands in Detroit. https://t.co/0Ysbd58744

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Clippers are waiving center Drew Eubanks and Eubanks plans to sign with the Sacramento Kings on a one-year deal after he clears waivers, sources tell ESPN. Additional frontcourt depth for the Kings. https://t.co/rBgBMV7iLg

author: ShamsCharania
text: Denver prioritized a shooter in free agency Tuesday -- and adds Hardaway to its acquisitions of Cam Johnson, Bruce Brown Jr. and Jonas Valanciunas in the last day.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent sharpshooter Tim Hardaway Jr. has agreed to a one-year deal with the Denver Nuggets, sources tell ESPN. Hardaway had a strong season for the Pistons' resurgent 2024-25 campaign and now Denver officials finalize a deal with Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports. https://t.co/XUaslGumBf

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo (foot sprain) is out tonight vs Denver Nuggets.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Damian Lillard to me on his diagnosis:“It’s unfortunate that something outside of my control would come up. Along with the Bucks’ medical staff, our priorities are to protect my health and safety. As much as I love basketball, I need to be there for my kids and my family. I’m grateful the Bucks acted quickly on this. They’ve been supportive and proactive throughout this process. I look forward to moving past this and continuing my career.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Lillard is on blood thinners, which has stabilized the blood clot. He will continue with regular testing to get him back to good health.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Breaking: Milwaukee Bucks star Damian Lillard will be out indefinitely after being diagnosed with a blood clot in his right calf, league sources tell me. https://t.co/7fbTJji08m

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman said Cedric Coward is “TBD” for summer league. 

He did 1-on-0 workouts during the draft process. Needs to get to contact, 5-on-5.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman said the Grizzlies didn’t interview other candidates for the head coaching position.

“We were incredibly impressed by (Tuomas Iisalo’s) approach.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman also:

“Ja and Jaren are not old.”

He believes Cedric’s timeline could line up with the star Grizzlies duo.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman:

“If we’re being honest with ourselves, we don’t feel like we’re one guy away from winning a championship next season.”

text: If anyone is worried about Cam Spencer being a Grizzly, find something else to worry about.

author: JakeLFischer
text: There was interest in Jrue Holiday from Sacramento, Dallas and others. The plan, for now, is definitely for Portland to keep the veteran point guard, sources say, as the Blazers look to compete in the Western Conference. I've seen some wondering whether or not POR would flip him.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Celtics are getting a 2030 Knicks second-rounder and a 2031 Blazers second-rounder from Portland in addition to Anfernee Simons, per source, all in exchange for Jrue Holiday.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Being told Bulls guard Jevon Carter is exercising his $6.8 million player option for the 2025-26 season.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Lisa Salters crushed it tonight, folks.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Start the buses.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Before this 2024-25* season finale, a public thank you, endless gratitude and love for my old man, @TheSteinLine. This was a really up-and-down year in my life, and it’s meant the world to have his friendship (and outlet) along the way. I do appreciate all of you who subscribe ❤️

author: JakeLFischer
text:
RT @TheSteinLine: For the second straight Sunday before the NBA Draft, we have a trade. A blockbuster trade.

And we have lots more on Kevi…

author: JakeLFischer
text: The second rounders will stretch out to 2032, per sources. There was some talk this week about Phoenix and Houston potentially working on three-team structures, but I’m told this is a straight two-team deal. Jalen Green joins Devin Booker in the Suns’ backcourt.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Suns and Rockets are still working through second round draft capital in Kevin Durant deal, sources say. Phoenix was always motivated to get a trade done before next week’s NBA Draft. Suns now hold No. 10, and have already been in contact with agents of players in that range.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Saturday notes 👀

author: JakeLFischer
text: Being told Dwight Powell’s option is now official.

author: JakeLFischer
text: As @michaelgrange noted earlier tonight, Toronto has been unwilling to include Jakob Poeltl in the Raptors’ trade talks regarding Kevin Durant. The same, thus far, goes for Miami and Kel’el Ware, sources say: https://t.co/mpt1xNk3Gf

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: The fascinating draft case of Egor Demin (@whoisegor3) ... here's @JakeLFischer with a long look at the Real Madrid guard…

author: JakeLFischer
text:
“Outside of Dylan [Harper] and Cooper [Flagg], he has the most upside," said BYU head coach Kevin Young. 

Meet Egor Demin, the Cougars’ supersized playmaker, who’s worked out for teams all across the second half of next week’s NBA Draft lottery: https://t.co/gBlFhR5Ojc https://t.co/gbuWlk1yt7

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: Sixers, Hornets, Jazz, Wizards, Pelicans and Nets ... among the teams covered in this piece: https://t.co/x97Jiqpg89

author: JakeLFischer
text: If they pull this off, the Pacers may be the utmost example of why teams obsess over culture, why intel may matter even more than on-court scouting. What’s in your gut? How bad do you want this shit? Indiana is just full of dogs and underdogs. Did not expect this group to wilt.

author: JakeLFischer
text: What makes Tyrese Haliburton truly special, in my mind, is how his play and personality unites and elevates that entire cast of characters. He’s been the true protagonist of this whole NBA postseason. Be well, man.

author: JakeLFischer
text: OKC has their own special blend going on, of course. These Thunder are all so incredibly present and self-aware and focused, from Mark Daigneault to Kenrich Williams, and have always been — even through youth and inexperience. Quite a group.

text:
This is where my writeups will be rest of season.

They'll be back on social to start next year, though, so don't fret.

Or just go to the link. It's free. It's just a glorified chat room.

author: DanBesbris
text: TONIGHT'S STORM IS DONE BELOW!

author: DanBesbris
text:
This is what I miss while at little league?!

If you're in your playoffs, you probably have to cut. Roto folks can just hold until the end but my *guess* is that he's done for the year, probably playoffs too.

Keep an eye on Gary Trent Jr as we talked about on recent pods

author: DanBesbris
text:
To be clear, BOTH Roto AND H2H require a TON of skill to win. You're not going to win either of them on luck alone.

Your season typically won't be ruined by random rest days in Roto.

author: DanBesbris
text:
It's going to be very complicated, but we as fantasy players need to think MUCH harder about which teams we think are going to be MID-PACK next year, since both the top and bottom are resting guys constantly...

Or you could all switch to roto but I know you won't...

text:
One strike from a win, Guardians now down by 6. 
Speechless.

author: twithersCLE
text: Can't let that happen.

author: twithersCLE
text: Cavs made signing of Sam Merrill official.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Two-hitter and lose.

Don't know what to say, Guards fans.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Because we need each other
We believe in one another
And I know we're going to uncover
What's sleeping in our soul

author: twithersCLE
text:
During their 8-game slide, Guardians, now fourth in AL Central, have scored 13 runs -- 6 in one inning.

They've squandered so many chances. Ex: Left bases loaded last night in 8th in 2-1 game.

Don't know if turnaround possible. Didn't see Tigers doing what they did in '24.
