text:
Guardians give up one run, three hits and lose.

When it's going bad, it's going bad.

Home for the Tigers. Gulp.

Legalized sports gambling is a crisis/fiasco/scandal waiting to happen -- at multiple levels and layers.

author: twithersCLE

author: twithersCLE
text:
Don't think last year was necessarily an aberration for Guardians. Young team with a new leader that started well, believed and rolled.

What's unfortunate is that ownership didn't seize the moment and invest into the on-field product.

Still time in '25, but concerning signs.

author: twithersCLE
text:
The combined effects of Naylor and Gimenez's departures coupled with Fry's injury has gutted the lineup.

Other than Kwan and the extraordinary Ramirez, too many easy outs.

On a positive note, the starting pitching has so much promise and the bullpen is solid.

Gotta score.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jaren Jackson Jr.: A Grade 2 sprain is also known as a partial or incomplete tear. Multiple players have sustained G2 ankle sprains in recent seasons, include teammate Ja Morant. The average time lost for injuries of this severity is ~ 3 weeks.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
RT @NickVanExit: "I will be back... this is not the end of the story... Don't let anybody ever tell you to give up"

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Kyrie Irving: The video doesn't look good. Definitely hyperextended the knee but that's a description of what happened and not a diagnosis. Team is calling it a sprain meaning it's likely a capsule or ligament injury. Additional testing coming.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Exhausted

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jrue Holiday: Mallet finger is an injury to the tendon that helps straighten the DIP joint (finger tip). Players have played with the injury while others have needed surgery. It often depends on the severity of tendon damage & the involved digit.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Re: Daniel Gafford: A G3 MCL sprain is considered a complete tear. Surgery isn’t required, especially if meniscus involvement is minimal. Average time lost for non-surgical cases in the NBA is 26 games (60 days).

Included on this list is current Mavs assistant coach Jared Dudley who missed 34 games in the 2020-21 season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Victor Wembanyama: A deep vein thrombosis (DVT) is a clot that develops in one of the major veins of the body, usually in the lower extremity. Brandon Ingram also developed a DVT in his shoulder, missing the final 19 games of the 2018-19 season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I previously discussed DVTs following Ingram's case, including possible contributing factors and long-term concerns: https://t.co/YduNYU1pht

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Josh Minott has agreed to a two-year, $5 million deal with the Boston Celtics, sources tell ESPN. Celtics executives finalized the new deal with Minott's agent, Aaron Turner of Verus. https://t.co/GYALerDzKM

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Raptors, Jakob Poeltl reach $104M extension - via ESPN https://t.co/VXF7p9oyGI

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Kings agree to $45M deal with Dennis Schroder - via ESPN https://t.co/Ylz6mnVZi5

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for @SportsCenter on the Milwaukee Bucks' creative wildcard acquisition of longtime Indiana Pacers center Myles Turner while waiving Damian Lillard: https://t.co/dljcD9vy43

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Raptors and Poeltl's agents, Michael Tellem and Sam Goldfeder of Excel Sports, discussed several frameworks of a deal such as opt-out-and-extend -- but the sides land on an opt-in-and-extend, giving Toronto flexibility in the next two seasons.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Toronto Raptors center Jakob Poeltl has agreed on a four-year, $104 million contract extension with the franchise through 2029-30, sources tell ESPN. Poeltl will pick up his 2026-27 player option at $19.5M and add three additional years to his deal. https://t.co/wBHnoF5vUV

author: ShamsCharania
text: Raptors present Mamukelashvili with a larger opportunity in the frontcourt to break through in the NBA – as he has displayed glimpses such as a 34-point game in San Antonio.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent F/C Sandro Mamukelashvili has agreed to a two-year, $5.5 million deal with the Toronto Raptors, plus a second year player option, sources tell ESPN. George Roussakis and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports negotiated the new deal with the Raptors. https://t.co/4GWqWrdVUm

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Jericho Sims has agreed to a two-year deal with the Milwaukee Bucks, including a player option in the second season, sources tell ESPN. Milwaukee retains a lob threat big man in Sims, who played in a career high 53 games last season and all 5 playoff games. https://t.co/l4BdgE8X5R

author: ShamsCharania
text: Schroder used the momentum of his strong second half and playoff finish with the Pistons after being involved in the complicated Golden State-Miami Jimmy Butler trade to land this $45M deal in Sacramento.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Dennis Schroder has agreed to a three-year, $45 million deal with the Sacramento Kings, sources tell ESPN. Kings officials and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports finalized the deal Tuesday. https://t.co/Tl1kViu4yW

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Milwaukee Bucks are trading Pat Connaughton and two of their own second-round picks (2031, 2032) to the Charlotte Hornets for Vasilije Micic, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/gLnvpeG2NX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bucks GM Jon Horst and CAA Co-Head of Basketball Austin Brown finalized terms on Harris' deal on Tuesday morning.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Gary Harris has agreed to a two-year deal with the Milwaukee Bucks, with a player option on the second season, sources tell ESPN. Bucks continue to fortify the roster with a veteran wing who played key rotation roles for playoff teams in Denver and Orlando. https://t.co/q5OLpDfEqo

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Sacramento Kings are trading Jonas Valanciunas to the Denver Nuggets for Dario Saric, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/D2Xmbm4DN1

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Milwaukee Bucks‘ stunning release of Damian Lillard to acquire free agent center Myles Turner on a four-year, $107 million deal: https://t.co/2JAItWVwJq

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Bucks found a creative path to waive and stretch Lillard – whose $113M will be stretched over the next five seasons – while leaving their future draft assets untouched. In a stunning turn of events, Myles Turner departs the Pacers to join the Bucks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Just in: The Milwaukee Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113 million on his contract in order to acquire Myles Turner, sources tell ESPN. Lillard's two seasons in Milwaukee come to an end as he rehabilitates a torn Achilles tendon. https://t.co/eg1D1TMFM6

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bucks GM Jon Horst and CAA Co-Head of Basketball Austin Brown partnered on executing a massive deal in a market scarce of salary cap space during the opening days of free agency. Milwaukee retools aggressively around Giannis Antetokounmpo again.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Turner, the longest tenured Pacer, made it known he wished to remain in Indiana. Since the Game 7 exit, Turner’s reps pushed to get a deal done. Ultimately, Indiana’s aversion to the tax, which grew after Tyrese Haliburton’s injury, allowed Bucks to get the new franchise center.

author: MarcJSpears
text: Andscape exclusive: Khaman Maluach is a ‘testament’ to African basketball as a Top 10 NBA draft pick. Selected 10th overall by Phoenix #Suns, Maluach completes incredible rise from the NBA Academy Africa, @theBAL and @DukeMBB to the #NBA. https://t.co/gtPrtNOC61

author: MarcJSpears
text: New Jazz draft pick Ace Bailey said he was excited to go to Utah, had no idea they were interested in him and he had never been there but was ready for the hot and the cold.

author: MarcJSpears
text: Ace Bailey story reminds me about Stephen Curry‘s father and agent asking the Warriors not to draft him in 2009 with the seventh pick so he could go to the Knicks with the next pick. Steph also didn’t workout for Warriors. Undeterred Warriors GM Larry Riley drafted Steph anyways.

author: MarcJSpears
text: Once drafted, Stephen Curry reported to the Warriors without issue. It all worked out.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman is here. He opened things up talking about his appreciation for Desmond Bane and what he meant to the Grizzlies.

When asked about the trade, he talked about changing the roster around Ja and Jaren. 

“Jaylen’s emergence was a significant part of it.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Cedric Coward is ready to join the Grizzlies and make an impact. Local media spoke with him on a conference call after he was acquired by the Grizzlies. 

Here’s what he said:

https://t.co/KpcHPUhIH1

author: DamichaelC
text:
Cedric Coward says his shoulder is fully healthy. He still has to wait and see what the doctors say going forward regarding summer league and playing games. 

“If it’s up to me, I’m playing.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Cedric Coward on Ja Morant and Jaren Jackson Jr.: 

“They’re one of the best duos in the league.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Talking to Cedric Coward now on the phone via a conference call with media. He’s talking about being a gritty, defensive-minded player. 

“At the end of the day, nothing has ever been given to me, and I don’t expect that.”

author: DamichaelC
text: If you’re looking for someone who is extremely high on Cedric Coward, Henry is your guy

author: JakeLFischer
text: Tracking Ace Bailey's draft status has reminded me of reporting on Nerlens Noel's fall to No. 6 back in 2013. Noel was injured, but both prospects declined/cancelled various pre-draft workouts without having a known safety net.

MONDAY

🏀 TEAMS TO AVOID 🏀
LA Clippers: OFF 2 days (1-4)

Orlando: B2B, 3-4, 4-6

author: twithersCLE
text:
"Guards Ball" has devolved from
an identity to a punch line. 

An inspiring team that played with such grit a year ago is currently flat, boring and often unwatchable.

So many of the same problems (let's start with right field) have lingered far too long.

Offense nonexistent.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Cavs say Jaylon Tyson switching to No. 20. He wore it at Texas Tech and Cal.

Team is bringing it out of retirement after Georges Niang trade.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Gotta believe Cleveland fans would feel more attached to the Browns' lakefront home if they had watched even mediocre football the last 25 years.

Zero playoff games. 

The Factory.

author: twithersCLE
text: The soundtrack to "The Bear" may be my favorite aspect of the series.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Indoor football isn't football. 

Get off my field turf. 😂

text:

https://t.co/UaHbEzUmTN

text: Ty Jerome's rise with the Cavs happened as quickly as his fall.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Thrilled that Cleveland's WNBA expansion bid is now official. This community will support the Rockers with even more passion.

It's another step forward for the city and significant growth for women's sports.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Remember Sonny Gray's shutout here in July 2015. A's catcher Stephen Vogt homered for Oakland and had another homer taken away by right fielder David Murphy.

Following the game, Gray and Vogt drove to Cincinnati together for All-Star Game.

author: twithersCLE
text:
That was like watching Greg Maddux. Great performance by Sonny Gray, nearly perfect.

The Guardians are having issues and without Ramirez those problems are quadrupled.

author: twithersCLE
text: Sonny Gray with only 78 pitches through eight scoreless innings. Impressive.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: It started at like $40/month. Reasonable. After the first year or two, they started increasing by like 25-40% every year. But unlike health insurance, you can’t just switch to another company because you’d nullify coverage for most ailments.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Anyone else dealing with the thieves at @Trupanion, who are now charging what amounts to a monthly car payment for pet insurance? If you have a choice, never use this company!

This industry needs governmental oversight. Wild that they can just do whatever they want. No rules. https://t.co/AhQ2xGk4eR

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Well deserved, and what a great hire by Utah. Austin has been such an asset for the Celtics in a variety of roles, and he has been an exemplary human the whole way through. Couldn’t be happier for him. Can’t wait to see what he does for the Jazz.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The incoming game environments for this NBA Finals are gonna be AMAZING! The Thunder and Pacers crowds are two of the absolute best in basketball. I promise you. I’ve experienced them both. Cannot wait to watch this!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Some very strange challenge decisions during these Playoffs. This early in the game you should only do it if you KNOW you’re gonna win. Otherwise, it’s simply not worth it in a game that very well could come down to the final minutes.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: RT @celtics: Another 60-win season filled with NBA records and franchise milestones. Here’s our all-encompassing recap of the 2024-25 campa…

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
It’s extremely rare for a PG to be the best player on an NBA championship team. Only one organization (Warriors) has done it in the last 20 years. Only two (Warriors, Pistons) have done it in the last 35 years.

It’s guaranteed to happen this year thanks to SGA, Hali and Brunson.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Congrats to the Thunder on a berth into the NBA Finals! Amazing story. They’ve been the best team all season long, and they’re doing it in a tiny market. Really cool for the NBA, and happy that the patience has finally paid off for the OKC faithful.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Now this is how you provide an injury update. Well done Hawks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: ICYMI: My attempt to make sense of everything we know about Anthony Davis' current injury issue. https://t.co/6rwCnZJJHz

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Daniel Gafford: His right knee was forced into hyperextension which resulted in a knee sprain according to the Mavs. The involved ligament and degree of sprain will dictate treatment options and time lost. A low-grade sprain would likely be a best case scenario.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I’m very tired of discussing injuries about my hometown team

author: InStreetClothes
text: Happy for Kyrie but I’m clearly still feeling the effects of the last 9 days because man did my heart skip a beat and fear the worst when I got a notification with his name in it.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I tried to make sense of everything we know about Anthony Davis' latest injury: https://t.co/6rwCnZJJHz

author: InStreetClothes
text: Sent this out days before the trade. With surgery being discussed as a possible option, it’s seems more and more likely AD has a core muscle injury (CMI). Surgery comes with a high success rate but would likely end his season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @Baxter: Today, Nate Robinson underwent surgery for a kidney transplant from a live donor.  The surgery was a success. My quick story: h…

author: InStreetClothes
text: By my account there were 14 NBA players traded this season while also appearing on the injury report. Players like Josh Richardson and James Wiseman have already been waived while both teams in the Luka-AD swap await the debuts of their respective acquisitions.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Cody Martin, like his twin brother Caleb, changes team with an injury designation. Martin has missed the last seven games with what was initially called core tightness but has since been changed to a sports hernia.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Caleb Martin is one of 11 injured players to be traded (so far) this season. He's already missed 12 games with a hip sprain and appears on track to miss more time. Interested to see if we ever find out what resulted in the added compensation.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Oh joy another player currently on the injured list has been traded...

author: InStreetClothes
text: Not that anyone cares but when an injured player gets traded it’s a massive headache for me and my injury database. So of course the Luka trade involves not 1 but 3 injured players changing squads.

author: InStreetClothes
text: First job I had as a certified athletic trainer was working with the Mavs Hoop Camps. Those coaches are amazing people.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 15 Injury Report 

W15 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 281
Total Games Lost for Season: 3771

W15 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 10
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 108

Notable new injuries:
Dejounte Murray: Achilles tear
Peyton Watson: Knee sprain

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 16 Injury Report
W16 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 268
Total Games Lost for Season: 4040

W16 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 15
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 123

Notable new injury:
Anthony Davis: Adductor strain

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anthony Davis: The adductor muscles are more commonly known as the groin. A multi-week absence suggests a more moderate strain. Worth noting AD has a history of low-grade left adductor strains dating back to his time in New Orleans. He has also been nursing an abdominal strain that could be connected to this issue. According to @TheSteinLine Dallas is still exploring treatment options.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
The always great @BrianSuttererMD did some great analysis shortly after the injury occurred. 

https://t.co/SPIU482Et0

author: ShamsCharania
text: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has signed two contract extensions now as a member of the Thunder, cementing both sides' partnership and trust since he arrived to OKC in 2019. He joined an exclusive club of players to win the MVP and Finals MVP in the same season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander has agreed to a four-year, $285 million super maximum contract extension with the championship Oklahoma City Thunder through 2030-31, sources tell ESPN. This is now the richest annual salary for a player in league history. https://t.co/eptbVjUo6j

author: katywinge
text: So to sum up what Denver was dealing with Game 7 vs OKC: Westbrook was playing with one good hand, Michael Porter Jr was playing with one good shoulder, and Aaron Gordon was playing with one good leg

author: katywinge
text:
Just saw this in my Word of Westbrook newsletter from this morning after seeing reports on social.

Russell Westbrook is having surgery on his right hand to fix two breaks that happened this season. Played through a broken hand. https://t.co/euecdRk7Wv

author: katywinge
text:

text: Me looking up “spurtability” watching the halftime show @NBAonTNT https://t.co/SPBLFEsm2d

author: katywinge
text:
Josh Kroenke said the Nuggets are “looking at everything right now & it’s exciting.”

Said the guys should be hungrier than ever with how close they saw it “in front of their face.”

Did mention he believes “a lot of our answers are internal right now” given contract situation.

author: katywinge
text:
Josh Kroenke says David Adelman will have the ability to build out his own staff. 

That was part of the reason they made this decision quickly: to give Adelman time to find his people to support him in the area he needs, but also to give the current staff time to look elsewhere

author: katywinge
text:
Josh Kroenke says David Adelman knows this locker room as people. Mentioned the cohesiveness on the human side.

Said “he went above & beyond” when he stepped in.

Said Adelman has a great balance of “challenging with direct communication & encouraging them at the same time.”

author: twithersCLE
text:
Congrats to the OKC Thunder on a phenomenal season. Their defense -- in the age of 3-point storms -- carried them to the finish line.

However, I'll most remember this postseason because of the Pacers, who embodied a team ethos during a magical run ended by stunning misfortune.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Absolutely gutted to hear that @ScottMillerBbl has passed. A consummate pro -- smart, dedicated and fair. 

It was always a better day when I crossed paths with him in press boxes and training camps over the past 30 years.

My deepest condolences to his family. 

RIP, friend.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Watching "Surviving Ohio State" was as difficult as expected. It's my school. 

HBO did a great job in chronicling this shameful coverup. 

My hopes are that we learn from the mistakes and that the athletes and students victimized by a predator and abandoned by OSU find peace.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Hell of a bounce-back for the Knicks. Hell of a missed opportunity for the Pacers.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: There are very well-placed people throughout the NBA who believe that the Pacers are the hardest team in the league to play against. Indy is proving why during this series. Just a relentless pace and effort level from top to bottom.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: They just compared Andrew Nembhard to Derrick White on TNT. Makes sense because Nembhard is also one of the most underrated players in the NBA.

Can’t wait for JT to be back ☘️

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Aaron Nesmith’s close-to-first-words to us in Boston were, “(I’m) an absolute sniper.”

Nearly five years later, he proved it to the world tonight.

text:
“Basketball is fun.” - Tyrese Haliburton

Yes. Yes it is.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Feeling compelled to share actual video of my @BR_NBA livestream on Thursday. Any outlet/account stating I reported something definitive about Giannis Antetokounmpo's trade status didn't note I was merely reflecting what team folks are feeling right now: https://t.co/4TFsTDLBrI

author: JakeLFischer
text: I am excited to watch the basketball tonight!

author: JakeLFischer
text: Another element of this coaching search: Thibodeau was New York’s de facto spokesman throughout his Knicks tenure. His pregame media availabilities also doubled as the New York’s official statements following trades, signings, etc. Not an insignificant part of this job.

author: JakeLFischer
text: There was very loud noise during the first round, when New York was tied 1-1 with Detroit, that Tom Thibodeau’s job security was in jeopardy if the Knicks couldn’t get past the Pistons. This move happening after a run to the Eastern Conference finals is definitely a surprise.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The peaks and valleys of Julius Randle’s season in Minnesota set the stage for one of the biggest lynchpins of the summer, connecting the Wolves, Knicks, Suns and so many more: https://t.co/lQPq2Gx3jp

author: JakeLFischer
text: Saw some inaccurate aggregation about Josh Giddey from this piece. Did not write anything about the AAV Giddey is pursuing. Starters in this current NBA market routinely seek north of $30M in AAV. The 5/120 figure was only mentioned as a low-end projection from league observers.

author: JakeLFischer

author: InStreetClothes
text: As I sit here trying to figure out how I’m going to explain the Luka trade to my Mavericks loving 9 y.o. and 13 y.o. in the morning, let me just tell you I’m for dang sure not going to film their reactions. Hope other parents take the same approach.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I just remembered AD is hurt right now too... SMH

author: InStreetClothes
text: Achilles tendon tears have actually been down over the past three seasons in the NBA. Unfortunately, this season we are seeing a big spike. Dejounte Murray is the fourth Achilles tear of the year, not including DaRon Holmes' injury in Summer League.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Just getting off work and seeing the Dejounte Murray injury. My guy @BrianSuttererMD does a fantastic job breaking down what is likely a serious Achilles injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Kudos to @ESefko for his story on Dante Exum and revealing the injury was a scaphoid fracture. I'm going to need him to do the same for Kleber's foot. https://t.co/w862vW01Ut

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anthony Davis: The average time lost for nondescript abdominal strains is 10.0 days (~3.2 games). If the injury is more complex (think sports hernia or core muscle tear) than the time lost drastically increases.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Maxi Kleber: Like with Lively, the involved bone and location of the fracture will determine treatment options and time lost. Kleber adds another serious injury to a growing list of ailments that includes a pinkie toe dislocation, torn hamstring, & G3 AC sprain.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @iztok_franko: My column on Lively’s injury: what it means in the short term, what the trade deadline might reveal, Luka’s return timeli…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Hoping to hear what bone Lively fractured to provide more insight. A fifth metatarsal fracture seems likely considering how he was injured but waiting for confirmation.

author: InStreetClothes
text: https://t.co/wOubaJKbWQ

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Brandon Miller: The scapholunate ligament is the most frequently sprained carpal ligament. The majority of NBA players that have torn the ligament have ultimately needed surgery, including Jaylen Brown & Bradley Beal. Surgery is accompanied by a lengthy recovery.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Hearing Kyrie discuss the nuisances around his back injury is yet another reason why having a former player like Jared Dudley on a coaching staff is so valuable. Dudley managed a bulging lumbar disc during his playing career, ultimately undergoing a microdiscectomy.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @_petethetrainer: First class move by the @Timberwolves to recognize a true pro, leader and all around great guy! Congrats Gregg 💪🏀⚕️@NB…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jalen Johnson: Johnson becomes the latest NBA player to sustain a significant shoulder labrum injury, joining the likes of Ja Morant, Pascal Siakam, & Jalen Brunson. While his season is over, the success rate of the surgery is high & he should be ready for next season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I discussed the specifics around these types of injuries when Morant was injured.  https://t.co/Bmn1VqK1SR

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 13 Injury Report 

W13 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 261
Total Games Lost for Season: 3214

 W13 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 16
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 90

Notable new injuries:
Donte DiVincenzo: Toe sprain
Brandon Miller: Wrist injury

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 14 Injury Report 

W14 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 269
Total Games Lost for Season: 3487

W14 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 9
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 99

Notable new injuries:
Maxi Kleber: Foot fracture

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Herb Jones: Shoulder labrum injuries in the NBA are relatively common. Shaedon Sharpe, Julius Randle, & Ja Morant have sustained the injury in recent seasons. If the tear is small & the instability is minimal, rehab can improve the issue w/out the need for surgery.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Surgery may be needed if the shoulder remains unstable but does come with a high success rate. I discussed the injury last season when Morant was injured. 

https://t.co/Bmn1VqK1SR

author: ShamsCharania
text: Atlanta is sending a 2027 second-round pick via Cleveland and cash to Minnesota to acquire Nickeil Alexander-Walker via sign-and-trade for four years and $62 million, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent Nickeil Alexander-Walker has agreed to a four-year, $62 million deal with the Atlanta Hawks, plus a player option and trade kicker, sources tell ESPN. CAA Co-Heads of Basketball Aaron Mintz/Austin Brown and Steven Heumann reached the contract with the Hawks tonight. https://t.co/G93cmxsHGo

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Luka Garza has agreed to a two-year, $5.5 million fully guaranteed deal with the Boston Celtics, sources tell ESPN. The Celtics negotiated the new deal with Garza's representatives Mark Bartelstein and Kieran Piller of @PrioritySports tonight. https://t.co/d5x5HzGYIL

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Brook Lopez has agreed to a two-year, $18 million deal with the Los Angeles Clippers, sources tell ESPN. Clippers and Lopez's agents at Wasserman negotiate a new deal for the 2021 Bucks champion to exit Milwaukee and land in Los Angeles. https://t.co/vmxiXtoGqu

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Caris LeVert has agreed to a two-year, $29 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources tell ESPN. Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports and the Pistons negotiated terms of a deal that brings backcourt depth and a Michigan return. https://t.co/C7KY8Arnra

author: ShamsCharania
text: Capela's agents at Wasserman negotiated the fully guaranteed three-year deal with Houston officials tonight, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Clint Capela has agreed to a three-year, $21.5 million deal with the Houston Rockets, sources tell ESPN. Major frontcourt addition – and return to Houston for Capela. https://t.co/1l20sBt9p2

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Luke Kornet has agreed to a four-year, $41 million deal with the San Antonio Spurs, sources tell ESPN. Key frontcourt addition for the Spurs, who negotiated a contract tonight with Kornet's agent Max Wiepking of Gersh Sports. https://t.co/cLnXxWJ2cv

author: ShamsCharania
text: An end of an era in Golden State with Kevon Looney exiting to New Orleans.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Russell will have a player option in the second season of his two-year, $13M deal with the Mavericks, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Kevon Looney has agreed to a two-year, $16 million deal with the New Orleans Pelicans, sources tell ESPN. Life Sports Agency CEO Todd Ramasar and the Pelicans reached a deal tonight for the three-time NBA champion who departs Golden State after 10 years. https://t.co/FAvVBa4Tk6

author: ShamsCharania
text: Almost 1.5 hours into free agency, the Nuggets land Cam Johnson via trade for Michael Porter Jr. and bring back a fan favorite and do-it-all forward in Bruce Brown Jr.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent Bruce Brown Jr. has agreed to a one-year deal with the Denver Nuggets, sources tell ESPN. The 2023 NBA champion for the Nuggets returns to Denver. CAA's Ty Sullivan and Steven Heumann finalized the deal tonight with the Nuggets. https://t.co/YZV094pUs0

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Ty Jerome has agreed to a three-year, $28 million deal with the Memphis Grizzlies, with a player option in year three, sources tell ESPN. Kieran Piller and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports negotiated the new deal with the Grizzlies. https://t.co/guChFbO1BI

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Denver Nuggets are trading Michael Porter Jr. and an unprotected 2032 first-round pick to the Brooklyn Nets for Cam Johnson, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/o6rdWhu3Rl

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Free agent guard D'Angelo Russell has agreed on a two-year, $13 million deal with the Dallas Mavericks, sources tell ESPN. Mavericks officials and CAA Co-Heads of Basketball Austin Brown/Aaron Mintz and Antonio Russell reached the new contract after free agency began. https://t.co/eljDwhDSUu

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Tre Jones has agreed to a three-year, $24 million deal to return to the Chicago Bulls, sources tell ESPN. Kevin Bradbury of LIFT Sports Management finalized the new deal with Bulls officials tonight. https://t.co/gwB1MRn7FX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Fully guaranteed deal for Jake LaRavia in Los Angeles -- negotiated tonight by agents Aaron Reilly and Reggie Berry of AMR Agency.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Kevin Porter Jr. has agreed to a two-year, $11 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks, with a player option in 2026-27, sources tell ESPN. The Bucks prioritized bringing back Porter and finalized a deal tonight with his agent Sam Permut of Roc Nation. https://t.co/ysAtgtitzu

author: ShamsCharania
text: Porter averaged 11.7 points and 3.7 assists while shooting 41% from 3-point land in 30 games for the Bucks last season. He gives Milwaukee a dynamic playmaker in the backcourt as it tries to contend in the Eastern Conference.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Perseverance Update: Former lottery pick Jahlil Okafor — who hasn’t played in the NBA in nearly four years — will sign a 10-day contract with the Indiana Pacers, league sources tell me. https://t.co/TuI74XMinH

Guardians have leaned on their bullpen and scrapped their way to two straight needed wins on road -- just when it appeared the bottom was dropping  out. 

Offense still sputtering, but Cleveland isn't alone there. 

Yankees went 29 innings without scoring.

author: Marc_DAmico

author: Marc_DAmico
text: RT @taylorcsnow: Jayson Tatum finished 4th in MVP voting, tied for the highest finish of his career. https://t.co/0FyElsZMba

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Guys I just played hoops for the first time in only God knows how long. My bball sneaks were packed away so I had to wear New Balance 650s.

My feet are going to fall off.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens on the this season's rendition of the Celtics: "The character in the room is just incredible."

author: Marc_DAmico
text: "They are peaking," Brad Stevens says of the New York Knicks. "You can see it."

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens says "there's real benefit" to Jayson Tatum having undergone surgery so quickly after rupturing his Achilles. He said the surgery happening to quickly was a result of "just an amazing set of circumstances" of being right down the street from the eventual surgeon.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Brad Stevens says Jaylen Brown told him that he was feeling better toward the end of the Knicks series.

Eyes don't lie. It looked like he was feeling better during those final couple of games.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brad Stevens on Jaylen Brown playing through pain in his knee: "Jaylen's a competitor. Jaylen is a warrior. Jaylen takes great pride in being out there."

author: Marc_DAmico
text: There it is, folks: The Thunder will be the only No. 1/No. 2 seed in the NBA to reach the Conference Finals. I imagine they will be overwhelming favorites once the odds come out.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: How is Aaron Gordon doing this?! I thought it would just be an inspirational start for a couple of mins and then they’d realize he was a liability. He’s actually impacting the game still. Insane!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Luke Kornet on Al Horford: "He's the best teammate I've ever played with." https://t.co/N1H8xwqsvY

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Asked what he appreciates most about this group from the past two seasons, Luke Kornet uses the term "competitive character," and describes each player's total willingness to do whatever was necessary individually to contribute to team success.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Payton Pritchard points out that the Spurs never went back-to-back, but they were considered a dynasty. That's now Boston's path/goal. Pritchard says the feeling of defeat, after experiencing a title last year, has him even more motivated to get back to the mountaintop.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Payton Pritchard says definitively, "I will be a better player next year." https://t.co/B8RsT8XGEX

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Al Horford says Jaylen Brown has found ways to improve each and every year since he entered the league. "That's one of the standards that he has set here," Horford says. He adds that he expects that to continue going into next season.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Al Horford says, "The Celtics standard, we didn't live up to it. That's the hard truth."

author: Marc_DAmico
text: RT @celtics: To the best fans in basketball: thank you for being with us every step of the way ☘️ https://t.co/RSwk3VX0B0

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Tried to tell you all that the Knicks are better than everyone thought! https://t.co/QO5LDwTBJv

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Not the way anyone would've predicted Boston's season would end. Was still a hell of a ride with a bunch of guys you can't help but to love.

Thank you for one of the best regular-season title defenses in recent memory, and for giving us that win for Tatum in Game 5💚

author: InStreetClothes
text: The current Mavs season is giving me real 2011 vibes. Mavs were sitting pretty until Dirk hurt his knee and Caron Butler went down. Team got healthy and went on a historic run. We will see if the current version can replicate the success.

author: InStreetClothes
text: It’s actually worse! The great @townbrad helped me out and noticed I missed one… I missed Daniel Gafford’s one game absence due to illness against the Knicks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @InStreetClothes: Kyrie Irving's absence tonight will be Dallas' 11th game lost due to illness this season, the highest total in the NBA…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Kyrie Irving's absence tonight will be Dallas' 11th game lost due to illness this season, the highest total in the NBA. 6 Mavs players have missed at least one game. Milwaukee is a close second with 10 games lost.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Rockets have been one of the healthier teams in the league this season. Surgery suggests the involved bone is displaced. Interested to see if we find out which bone (metacarpal?) is involved. Comparable to Larry Nance Jr.’s recent injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Larry Nance Jr.: This marks the second time in his career Nance has sustained a 4th metacarpal fracture. He broke his left hand in 2021 & missed 12 games after surgery. Average time lost for the injury is 14.4 games (~34.25 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Ja Morant: The average time lost for nondescript or low-grade in-season AC sprains is 12.4 days (~4.3 games). More info on his latest issue including why this is different from last year's injury here: https://t.co/FTTfQItV99

author: InStreetClothes
text: I’ve never met @Jonathan_Feigen personally but he has always been fantastic at reporting injuries while also supporting my work. Congrats on retirement.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Luka Doncic: There’s a lot of variability in calf strains as the calf is a muscle complex made up of multiple muscles. The pending MRI will help determine the muscle involved & severity. All signs point to this being a more moderate strain. Average time lost for a Grade 2 strain is 15 games (~34 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @JonKrawczynski: https://t.co/wVlcnpjAHl

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest NFL Injury Analysis for @RotoWire: Likely Christmas Return for Pickens https://t.co/AJ6OBmxiMk

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest NFL Injury Analysis for @RotoWire: Mild High Ankle Sprain for Mahomes https://t.co/q4Xpv5yU70

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 10 Injury Report
W10 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 282
Total Games Lost for Season: 2429

W10 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 4
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 55

Notable new injuries:
Luka Doncic: Calf strain
Ja Morant: AC sprain

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 11 Injury Report

W11 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 263
Total Games Lost for Season: 2690

W11 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 7
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 62

Notable new injuries:
Kyrie Irving: Bulging disc
Jonathan Kuminga: Ankle sprain

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Kyrie Irving: Disc-issues can be difficult to navigate and are often accompanied by a lengthy recovery. The average time lost for in-season disc herniations that do not require surgery is 28.7 days (~12 games). (1/2)

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Read more here as I breakdown the specifics of Irving's bulging disc and how it compares to a jelly donut. (2/2)
https://t.co/HznLf8aJ5h

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jared McCain: As Sixers fans are all too aware of, treatment options for meniscus tears are dictated by location of the tear. For a true repair to be possible, the damage has to occur to a specific region of the disc. Otherwise a meniscectomy (removal) may be the only option.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
I’ve covered lateral meniscus tears multiple times on the site including in 2019 when Zion sustained the injury.
https://t.co/OvyP3ijA1n

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies and Cole Anthony’s reps at Excel Sports are working toward a resolution that allows Memphis to create the necessary cap space to renegotiate and extend Jaren Jackson Jr. while giving Anthony the opportunity to find his next destination, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies and guard Cam Spencer have agreed to a two-year, $4.5 million fully guaranteed contract, sources tell ESPN. Mark Bartelstein and Ross Aroyo of @PrioritySports finalized a deal with Memphis execs after Spencer had flashes of strong play as a two-way rookie. https://t.co/tbpYujUHNN

author: ShamsCharania
text: Major acquisition to bolster Houston's wing depth with Finney-Smith, who shot a career-high 41% from 3-point land and held All-Star players to 47% effective shooting in halfcourt, which ranked top-10 among players to defend 125+ shots last season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent C/F Paul Reed – aka BBall Paul – has agreed to a two-year, $11 million deal to return to the Detroit Pistons, sources tell ESPN. Reed played a versatile role for Pistons frontcourt, and the team and his agent Ron Shade of Octagon reached the new contract tonight. https://t.co/E18RtqMSqj

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Dorian Finney-Smith has agreed to a four-year, $53 million deal with the Houston Rockets, sources tell ESPN. Finney-Smith's agent, Michael Tellem of Excel Sports, negotiated terms of the deal tonight with Rockets executives for the 3-and-D wing. https://t.co/wUNbGn0rOy

CAA’s Austin Brown, Steven Heumann and Max Sadiman finalized the deal with the Grizzlies for Aldama, who had a career year last season. https://t.co/Pk7j1HjtXy

author: ShamsCharania
text: Massive new deal for Jaren Jackson Jr., including a player option in the final year of the contract in 2029-30, sources said. Memphis secures a franchise cornerstone long term, prioritizing the 2023 Defensive Player of the Year’s extension to begin the offseason.

text: BREAKING: The Memphis Grizzlies and All-Star Jaren Jackson Jr. are expected to agree on a five-year, $240 million maximum renegotiation-and-extension, sources tell ESPN. Head of CAA Basketball Austin Brown and CAA agent Max Saidman negotiated the new agreement with the Grizzlies. https://t.co/pKkI25cFIp

author: katywinge
text:
Coach Adelman said Aaron Gordon is going through an evaluation process right now.

“He’s trying to play. Obviously he is injured.”

Said it’ll be collective decision between Gordon, medical staff, coach. 

“We will get to game time & make the proper decision for him & the team.”

text:
Ok Nuggets Nation. How are we feeling 24 hours out from Game 7? 

Drop a gif, a comment, a question, anything! 

I’m a flight to OKC and want to virtually hang out 😂

author: katywinge
text:
Peyton Watson understands his responsibilities may be bigger tomorrow with Gordon’s injury. Said he “mirrored” him at shoot around and this could be a bigger canvas for him to put his “imprint on the game.” 

“AG is a soldier and we know he’s going to try and tough it out”

author: katywinge
text:
Coach Adelman says there’s a chance Aaron Gordon plays tomorrow. He’ll be a game time decision but he went through the walk-through fully on both sides of the ball. “If Aaron can play, he will play.”

Said AG’s emotions were good - “very consistent in his swagger.”

author: twithersCLE
text:
Sorry to see Nick Chubb leave Cleveland. Class act. Incredible player.

Injuries robbed him of some good years. Still, he's an all-timer for the Browns. 

Wishing him all the best.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians OF Will Brennan had elbow reconstruction surgery this morning. Will need 6-8 months to recover.

Guardians RHP Andrew Walters had shoulder surgery. He's going to be sidelined 8-10 months.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Garland's surgery only complicates things for the Cavs if they were considering a trade involving the All-Star guard.

While he's expected to make a full recovery, it's hard to imagine any team risking a move until he's back on floor.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Cavs say All-Star G Darius Garland underwent surgery on his toe. 
He'll need 4-5 months of recovery time and is expected to be ready by start of training camp.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Fantastic start by Bibee, who deserved better. That looked like strike three to Smith based on what ump had been calling.

Bottom line: Guards' offense not enough. Again.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians option struggling OF Jhonkensy Noel to Columbus, recall OF Johnathan Rodriquez. 

Noel was batting .146 with 2 homers, 9 RBIs in 103 ABs.

author: twithersCLE
text: I owe it all to her. ❤️ https://t.co/6MBPIaqaxs

author: twithersCLE
text: Lord Stanley.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians placed C Austin Hedges on 7-day concussion list. Guessing due to him being struck on helmet by Chisolm's back swing.

Cleveland brought up C Dom Nuñez from Columbus.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians say Shane Bieber will be shut down for a week after experiencing elbow soreness following bullpen session. 

Team doctors and surgeon recommended the down time for right-hander, who will be reexamined next week.

author: twithersCLE
text:
One of my enduring images of the Pacers-Cavs series is Donovan Mitchell trying to quiet Cleveland fans from chanting "over-rated" at Tyrese Haliburton.

He knew.

author: twithersCLE
text: Pacers' relentlessness is so impressive.

author: twithersCLE
text: Feels like Halliburton could get that floater whenever.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians simply must get more production from their young hitters. 
Fried is really tough, and tonight was going to be a challenge, but Naylor, Arias, Noel and others not there yet.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians say Shane Bieber will not pitch in Akron tomorrow after experiencing soreness following bullpen session. 

He's consulting with team doctors and surgeon on next steps.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jaylen played his ass off these last 2 games man. Thankful for him, and always will be!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Alright, time to look in the mirror at halftime and decide whether or not you're gonna make this game at all interesting during the 3Q. It can be done.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The 37-point first half is Boston's lowest-scoring first half of the season.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Knicks up 20, and Brunson only has four points. Not a good combo for the C's.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: For those who haven't been watching the entire series, McBride has been incredible. Consistent two-way impact. Maybe the best reserve of the series to this point.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
- Clean up the defensive glass
- Take care of the ball
- More contributors to offense

Get back into the game

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jaylen was unbelievable during the first quarter. That's good news - but the Celtics are gonna need some other guys to impact the offense in a big way.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: PS: Look for both coaches to roll with their top players for major minutes tonight. With two days before a potential Game 7, we may see all the top dogs play 40+ mins if they don't get into foul trouble.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: KP! Looks like he actually feels good, because he's letting it fly

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Please, basketball gods, allow Porzingis to make his first two shots.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Celts gotta slowwww downnnn. They're sped up right now and are making some uncharacteristically poor decisions.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Go time. Who’s gonna step up and earn a Game 7?

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Kornet = starting

Play with that same energy and effort tonight and Game 7 can happen

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @tomhaberstroh: So excited to have @ChefAdjepong on board

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jordan Hawkins: The Pelicans forward has been diagnosed with a lumbar annular fissure. This injury occurs in a specific region of the vertebral disc known as the annulus fibrosus and can progress to a disc herniation if not properly treated.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest NFL Injury Analysis on @RotoWire: IR Again for McCaffrey https://t.co/6qzBRwpPwq

author: InStreetClothes
text: Luka comes back the same day this hits my desk. Coincidence? I think not. https://t.co/ZBACI6Rexa

author: InStreetClothes
text: My 🦃 day injury analysis for @RotoWire: Patience Required for St. Brown Knee Injury https://t.co/FJ8RZykHKm

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Luka Doncic: Keyword is sprain, indicating the injury occurred to one of the many ligaments in the wrist. There is a high degree of variability in these types of injuries. However, the average time lost for nondescript in-season wrist sprains is 5.9 days (~ 2 games).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Following Tuesday’s games, the total games lost to injury or illness in the NBA passed the 1,000 mark. That didn’t happen until 11/28 last season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: De'Anthony Melton: Surgery was always the most probable outcome. Very few ACL sprains have been treated non operatively. Hate to see him sidelined once again.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
RT @RotoWire: 🤕 Checking in on the status of Mike Evans, George Kittle, and more

It's #NFL Injury Analysis with @InStreetClothes 
https://…

author: InStreetClothes
text: The Thunder have lost 54 man games due to injury or illness through their first 13 games played. Last season they lost 53 games for the entire year. And they are still 11-2.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Immanuel Quickley: UCL sprains of the elbow are far less common in the NBA than in other sports, particularly baseball. Other players to suffer G2 (partial tear) sprains of the UCL include Jimmy Butler & Kurt Thomas. Average time lost is 11.7 games (26.5 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Joel Embiid: Sinus fractures are commonly associated with/ nasal & orbital fractures. The exact sinus broken &  subsequent treatment will dictate recovery. Courtney Lee suffered a sinus fracture during the 2009 playoffs & returned in 10 days, 8 days after surgery.

author: InStreetClothes
text: This marks the 3rd facial fracture of Embiid's career. He suffered a left orbital fracture in 2018 & a right orbital fracture in 2022. The 1st injury required surgery & he went on to miss 22 days (10 games). The 2022 injury cost him 2 postseason games over the course of 8 days.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 6 Injury Report

W6 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 308

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 7 Injury Report

W7 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 12
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 44

Notable new injuries:
Brandon Ingram: Ankle sprain
Franz Wagner: Oblique tear

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Donovan Clingan: Since the 2005-06 season, Grade 2 MCL sprains, also known as a partial or incomplete tears, have resulted in an average time lost of ~41 days (~22 games). Other players to have suffered the injury include Rudy Gobert, Marc Gasol, Steph Curry, & Kevin Durant.

text: The Utah Jazz are waiving forward Johnny Juzang, making him a free agent, sources tell ESPN. The 24-year-old started 18 games and averaged 8 points in 20 minutes last season, shooting 38% from 3, and will receive interest from teams.

text: Free agent forward Ziaire Williams intends to sign a two-year, $12 million deal to return to the Brooklyn Nets, sources tell ESPN. Williams averaged 10 points and 4.3 rebounds in 63 games. Nets officials and Aaron Mintz of CAA negotiated the new contract. https://t.co/xwg3u4Fpfs

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bobby Portis intends to sign a three-year, $44 million contract to return to the Milwaukee Bucks, with a player option for 2027-28, sources tell ESPN. author: ShamsCharania
text: The second year has a player option and is partially guaranteed. This deal furthers the strong partnership Harden has forged with the Clippers since he arrived. He receives a well-deserved raise while providing the team with flexibility to add talent in the present and future.

text: Oklahoma City today locks in Jaylin Williams and now Mitchell, who averaged 6.5 points and 17 minutes last season for the NBA champions. Mitchell was the 38th pick in the 2024 NBA Draft for OKC.

text: Sources: Jimmy Butler’s camp has repeatedly told Heat he’s in shape, healthy and ready to continue his career and move past this immediately. Their messaging to Heat has been to negotiate best deal possible and once in red zone, if that team is granted permission by MIA to speak with Butler’s rep to discuss his longterm future, that dialogue would be welcomed. To date, no team has asked for permission.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: In light of major NBA movement recently, a few teams that are scheduled to travel on Feb. 6 of the trade deadline have adjusted itineraries after realizing the team would be in the air when the deadline passed. This is to prevent a potential awkward flight.

“Opportunities are what they are. The opportunity that’s in front of you - that’s in the present - is the only one that matters.”

author: katywinge
text: David Adelman said today there is a lot the Nuggets can improve on. Said Denver watched a lot of spacing clips today. That’s a priority - mastering spacing against a really good defense the best they can.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Did anyone else have sweet dreams last night 19,000 people barking at a 7-foot-1 man?

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Love having Jaylen Brown on my side since this very moment. Goodnight! https://t.co/gmNIwWEDng

author: Marc_DAmico
text: How does one ever know which on-ramps are open and closed in Boston?

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Derrick White says that Jayson Tatum texted the team before tonight's game. White said it was cool to see that Tatum is still supporting them and cheering them on, just a day after undergoing surgery on his Achilles.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: RT @celtics: LUKE. KORNET. https://t.co/wGMVZJ4cYk

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Luke Kornet (seven) and Derrick White (three) combined to block 10 shots tonight. 

The New York Knicks combined to block four as an entire team.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Joe Mazzulla on Kristaps Porzingis not playing during the second half: “He couldn’t breathe. He was available if absolutely necessary.”

author: Marc_DAmico
text: “Everyone in that locker room has another level that they need to get to,” says Joe Mazzulla.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Joe Mazzulla, after Jaylen Brown tallies 26 points and 12 assists, says that Brown showcased his leadership at the DEFENSIVE end of the floor.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: An UNBELIEVABLE night at TD Garden! The Celtics rise up -- together -- to force Game 6 in emphatic fashion without Tatum. Brown, White and Kornet were incredible. Tell me what you're thinking after this dub!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Luke Kornet has set a new career high with SEVEN blocked shots 🚫 https://t.co/541aLWw1Cp

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Celtics by 23 with 7:36 to go. Anyone wanna board a flight to NYC tomorrow? 👀

author: Marc_DAmico
text: UPDATE: FIVE blocks in the quarter and SIX on the night!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: So the table is set: A 15-point lead for Boston heading into the 4Q, with a chance to send things back to NY for Game 6 Friday night.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: This place is going bonkers right now! Legit feels like the building is shaking

author: Marc_DAmico
text: This crowd is JUICED!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jalen Brunson has fouled out of the game with 7:19 left and the Celtics leading by 21. So Boston no longer needs to worry about him getting to the FT line.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: BUT WAIT! The call is being challenged!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Call upheld. Brunson has fouled out.

author: InStreetClothes
text: ICYMI: I broke down Chet Holmgren’s injury and why the term “hip fracture” may be a bit confusing. https://t.co/deCbNjIjpO

author: InStreetClothes
text:
RT @tomhaberstroh: Embiid. Kawhi. KD. Zion. Ja. Steph. Maxey. Chet. There’s more.

Star absences are up ~24% this season. Games lost due to…

author: InStreetClothes
text: New on InStreetClothes: Understanding Chet Holmgren’s Hip Fracture:  https://t.co/deCbNjIjpO

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Chet Holmgren: Hip fractures are rare. The only 2 examples provide little insight for expected time lost as Mamadi Diakite was waived following his hip fracture & Sundiata Gaines broke his hip in late March & missed the final 12 games of the season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Wow. Waking up to the Chet news. What an awful start to the year for injuries.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
ICYMI: I took a look at Ja Morant’s unique posterior hip subluxation and what it could mean moving forward 

https://t.co/MifGxJ7Jl5

author: InStreetClothes
text: https://t.co/mN0jzmvXeF

author: InStreetClothes
text: New on InStreetClothes: Understanding Ja Morant's Posterior Hip Subluxation: https://t.co/MifGxJ7Jl5

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @_petethetrainer: The profound Impact these two men have had on the @NBA, the @NBATA  and the career paths of so many past, present and…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jeremy Sochan: The thumb is made up of two bones, the proximal & distal phalanges. The proximal is closer to the base of the thumb and is part of the MCP joint. The average time lost for thumb fractures that require surgery is ~21 games (~52 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: I've had a few ?s about injuries to start the year. The number of games lost to injury in the NBA this season is higher than last season by roughly ~90 games. However, the injury rates remain nearly identical. Interested to see how this trend continues as the season progresses.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My annual picture marking the official start of fall. https://t.co/b1t1WALJ7i

author: InStreetClothes
text: What an awesome experience

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Desmond Bane: Oblique strains are far less common in the NBA than in other sports, particularly baseball. For the NBA, average time lost for in-season oblique strains is 4.2 game (~11.6 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: I started following @YNB because of Community and the Talking Dead. I stuck around for her positivity and passion in defending what is good and right. Fan for life over here.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Two of the NBA’s best athletic training staffs acting swiftly in Dallas to tend to Taylor Hendricks and a scary looking lower extremity injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Scottie Barnes: Facial fractures are surprisingly common in the NBA. Time lost varies due to a multitude of factors including the involved bone(s), size of the break, any additional soft tissue or eye damage, or the need for surgery.

text: Philadelphia 76ers guard Eric Gordon is declining his $3.4 million player option to explore free agency, sources tell ESPN. A return to the 76ers is still possible.

text: The Philadelphia 76ers are declining guard Lonnie Walker IV’s team option worth $2.9 million, making him a free agent, sources tell ESPN. Walker averaged 12.3 points, 23.8 minutes and 35.4% 3-point shooting in 20 games for the 76ers last season.

text: Los Angeles Lakers forward Dorian Finney-Smith is declining his $15.4 million player option for the 2025-26 season and will enter free agency, sources tell ESPN. author: ShamsCharania
text: Beasley and the Pistons were in serious talks on a new three-year, $42 million contract to bring the free agent sharpshooter back to Detroit, but now talks are on pause, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: “An investigation is not a charge,” Beasley’s attorney, Steve Haney, told ESPN. “Malik is afforded the same right of the presumption of innocence as anyone else under the U.S. constitution. As of now he has not been charged with anything.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: NBA spokesman Mike Bass: “In March 2023, the NBA was alerted to unusual betting activity related to Terry Rozier’s performance in a game between Charlotte and New Orleans.  The league conductedan investigation and did not find a violation of NBA rules.  We are now aware of an investigation by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of New York related to this matter and have been cooperating with that investigation.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: NBA statement: “The league conducted an investigation and did not find a violation of NBA rules. We are now aware of an investigation by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of New York related to this matter and have been cooperating with that investigation.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Heat guard Terry Rozier is under investigation by federal prosecutors for potentially cooperating in an illegal sports betting scheme in 2023 while with the Hornets.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Kings star De’Aaron Fox is zeroed in on landing spot as franchise looks to possibly move him. Interested teams will likely be discouraged from trading for him being he’s set to become UFA in 2026. Fox’s unwillingness to sign extension has positioned the situation here.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: The Golden State Warriors announce they will retire Andre Iguodala’s No. 9 jersey on February 23 following the team’s game against the Dallas Mavericks. It will be the franchise’s seventh retired jersey.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Kaleb Canales — longtime NBA assistant and current associate head coach of G League’s Texas Legends — to be named head coach of Calgary Surge of Canadian Elite Basketball League. Season begins and runs through summer and he’ll be able to rejoin NBA staff next season. https://t.co/cYYnnZXuV0

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: In 2012 at the age of 33 when he was appointed interim head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers, Canales became the youngest active head coach in the NBA and the first Mexican-American coach in NBA history.

author: DamichaelC
text: He wants to as well.

author: DamichaelC
text: Jaylen Wells also wants to play in summer league this year

author: DamichaelC
text: Jaylen Wells said he’s big on finding the positives in tough situations. He’s talking a lot about working on his left hand while his right wrist is injured.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Edey on his offseason approach: 

“I promise you I’ll put my head down and work hard.”

author: DamichaelC
text: Zach Edey said he hasn’t had the conversation with Zach Kleiman yet, but he think he’ll play a few Summer League games

author: DamichaelC
text:
Brandon Clarke on his PCL injury: 

“I’m built for this.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Vince Williams Jr. is here. He said he’s around 80% right now from a health standpoint. 

“Honestly, I got to get my first step back. That’s really my only problem right now.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Jaren Jackson Jr. hit me with the “next question” when I asked if he would prioritize signing a super-max extension if he makes All-NBA. He added that he’s rarely ever given me the “next question” answer over the years.

Fair point

author: DamichaelC
text:
Jaren Jackson Jr. on if it’s a priority for him to stay in Memphis:

“Of course.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Here are five takeaways on what Zach Kleiman said today in his honest assessment of where the Grizzlies currently stand.

“Forty-eight wins, good for an eight seed, but who cares. It's not good enough."

Story: https://t.co/B2uAU6BrwG

author: DamichaelC
text:
Ja Morant paused because he wanted to be careful with his words, but he clearly had more to say when asked about how the OKC series turned out. 

“I had them figured out.” 

Added that he believes the series would be tied 2-2 headed back to OKC if he didn’t get hurt.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Ja Morant: “I feel like every injury I had this year was out of my control.” 

“Outside of those injuries, I feel like I had one of my healthiest seasons.” 

Added that he didn’t have any knee or back pain like recent seasons.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman said if he’s guilty of anything, he put high expectations on Vince Williams Jr. and GG Jackson coming back from injuries in Jan/Feb. 

“I probably overweighted just how much of a burden they would have been able to put on in a playoff push.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman: “I think we should’ve picked up Jake LaRavia’s team option. The mistake was there.”

“I think Jake could’ve helped us down the stretch.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Zach Kleiman said Memphis was “unintentionally young” this season.

“We’re not trying to make the team younger.”

He specifically pointed out how the team expected Jaylen Wells to start out in the G League. 

“He beat out the vet and earned the starting job and ran with it.”

author: DamichaelC
text: Zach Kleiman: “The discourse around (Zach) Edey is wild because his mistakes are loud.”

author: DamichaelC
text: I’ll add that he loved what he saw from Zach Edey. This is more about the conversation around Edey. Memphis is thrilled with Edey’s progression

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman said Game 3 will come down to mentality.

Said fatigue is part of what the postseason is. 

“Collectively finding energy from each other is how you win.”

Just like round one, Game 3 is its own separate thing. “Another chance to be a better version of yourself.”

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman said he didn’t feel the Nuggets weren’t ready to play in Game 2, but they weren’t ready to play at THAT level. 

“I thought our reaction to it took a really long time to understand what kind of game it was.”

“They hit first, second, and third.”

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman said today the Nuggets watched film and owned it - the poor play, the lack of physicality. Talked about what could’ve done differently. 

“A lot of guys had thoughts on what they felt last night.”

Said mentality has to be different & then adjustments can be made.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Four blocks during the 3Q and five on the night for Luke Kornet 🐶 https://t.co/7lENGzQdel

author: Marc_DAmico
text: There's positive energy behind the ball right now for the Celtics. You can see it. You can feel it. This is what makes them great!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Luke Kornet is barking his ass off!!!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Largest lead of the night for the Celtics, at 75-68, after a quick 7-1 spurt. Derrick White is up to a game-high 27 points. Jaylen Brown is tied for the second-best mark with 21 points. Boys are battling!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Mitchell Robinson made four free throws (!!!!)and Josh Hart made two 3-pointers (!!)... and the Celtics still managed to keep it tied up at the break.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jaylen Brown is cookin right now. Has scored 12 points during the 2Q. You can see it in his body language that he's totally in rhythm

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics are winning every stat other than FTs and turnovers. They clean those area up and they should be in good shape.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: If you placed a bet on Mitchell Robinson making more free throws than the Celtics during the first quarter, you are now rich

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
RT @celtics: Wave your towels and get LOUD 🗣️

Thank you @DICKS Sporting Goods for tonight's giveaway, available now at Loge 7 & 17 on Leve…

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics have gone double-big for almost the entirety of first quarter. First, it was Horford and Porzingis. Then, Horford and Kornet. Now, Kornet and Porzingis.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Sam Hauser makes his return to the lineup for the first time since Game 1, when he logged just four minutes before spraining his ankle.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Looks like Torrey Craig is set to check in for the Celtics with 3:30 left in the 1Q.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Derrick White has more points (14) than the Knicks (13) through the first 7+ minutes of Game 5

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
RT @celtics: Injury Report update:

Sam Hauser - AVAILABLE

author: Marc_DAmico
text: RT @celtics: The comeback will be greater than the setback 💚 https://t.co/r7r92lBb93

author: Marc_DAmico
text: This series is not over. It may wind up being the case that these unfortunate circumstances will lead to the Celtics and their fans rallying together for an electric atmosphere and performance. I expect TD Garden to be awesome tonight.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: WHAT?!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Imagine a big man from the 50s/60s coming back to life and seeing Jokic play. Like what would they even think?

author: Marc_DAmico
text: I had faith in the Cavs all season long. Hard to believe their season just came to an end in five games before the ECF.

PLAYOFF STREAMING GUIDE (March 7-8! #FantasyBasketball 

FRIDAY

🏀 TEAMS TO TARGET 🏀

Charlotte: B2B, 3-4, 4-6
Dallas: 3-4, 4-6
Denver: 3-4, 4-6, 6-9
Memphis: Same as Denver
Okla. City: 3-4, 4-6
Phoenix: 3-4, 4-6, 7-11
Portland: 3-4, 4-6
San Antonio: Same as Denver
Toronto: B2B, 3-4, 4-6, 7-11
Utah: 3-4, 4-6, 7-11

🏀 TEAMS TO AVOID 🏀
Philadelphia: OFF for 2 days (but then a Sun-Mon B2B)
No one plays less than 2 games over the next 4 days

· Charlotte

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full ESPN story on LeBron James exercising his $52.6 million player option for the 2025-26 season and what it means for his Los Angeles Lakers future: https://t.co/dG42VHUSkz

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Breaking: Los Angeles Lakers' LeBron James is opting into his $52.6 million player option for the 2025-26 season, Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul told ESPN. 

Paul adds: LeBron "knows the Lakers are building for the future ... but he values a realistic chance of winning it all." https://t.co/q5mT1O2R35

author: ShamsCharania
text: The third season will be a team option for Jaylin Williams, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Oklahoma City Thunder C/F Jaylin Williams is signing a new three-year, $24 million contract extension with the franchise, sources tell ESPN. Thunder declined Williams' $2.1M team option and negotiated the new raise with his agents Marcus Monk and Sean Kennedy of Excel Sports. https://t.co/16rvbMDpyG

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent Garrett Temple intends to sign a one-year, $3.6 million deal to return to the Toronto Raptors, sources tell ESPN. The Raptors and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports reached the deal for Temple, who will enter his 16th NBA season. https://t.co/W87onCqMLX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Los Angeles Clippers forward Nicolas Batum is declining his $4.9 million player option for the 2025-26 season to become a free agent, sources tell ESPN. There's mutual interest between the NBA veteran and the Clippers in a new deal together. https://t.co/mDyfBTzIGp

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Davion Mitchell intends to stay with Heat for $24M - via ESPN: https://t.co/bR7gl6qJaf

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Cleveland Cavaliers and sharpshooting guard Sam Merrill reaching a new four-year, $38 million contract that helps cement the franchise's point guard depth chart: https://t.co/azxinpQr1H

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Sam Merrill intends to sign a four-year, $38 million contract to stay with the Cleveland Cavaliers, sources tell ESPN. The Cavs negotiated the new deal with Kieran Piller and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports, a success story for the 60th pick in 2020 draft. https://t.co/NUo8CKR9vH

author: ShamsCharania
text: Mitchell averaged 10.3 points and 5.3 assists in 30 games with the Heat and shot a career-high 40% from 3 for the season. He ranked top-5 in field-goal percentage allowed as a contesting defender (among players to contest 500+ shots), per ESPN Research.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Restricted free agent Davion Mitchell intends to sign a two-year, $24 million deal to return to the Miami Heat, sources tell ESPN. Heat officials and Mitchell's agent, Josh Beauregard-Bell of Wasserman, negotiated the new fully guaranteed contract. https://t.co/u91l6mKQlG

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Cavaliers acquiring Lonzo Ball from the Chicago Bulls for Isaac Okoro as Cleveland prepares to potentially lose Ty Jerome in free agency: https://t.co/oKcMQEtYIz

author: ShamsCharania
text:
RT @SportsCenter: ZO IS HEADED TO THE CAVS 😱

(via @ShamsCharania) https://t.co/bIoUnlzHkb

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Chicago Bulls are trading Lonzo Ball to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Isaac Okoro, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/W0FTrRhe7y

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Naz Reid to sign 5-year, $125M deal to stay with Wolves - via ESPN https://t.co/PMG5ZTrN3Z

author: ShamsCharania
text: RT @espn: Breaking: Minnesota Timberwolves Naz Reid intends to sign a new five-year, $125M contract to stay with the franchise, including a…

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reid averaged a career high 14.2 points per game last season and served as an indispensable complement to Rudy Gobert and Julius Randle. He is one of just three NBA players over the last three seasons to score 2,000 points off the bench.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reid declined a $15 million player option for next season and chose to stay with Minnesota despite a vibrant market developing of teams interested with similar money but with starting roles. The 2024 Sixth Man of the Year and Minnesota are locked in for the long term.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Oklahoma City Thunder are trading guard Dillon Jones and a second-round pick to the Washington Wizards, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Washington is sending guard Colby Jones to the Thunder, who will then release him, sources said.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Steph: The peroneals (also known as the fibularis muscles) are primarily responsible for plantar flexion & eversion. They are often stretched when the ankle is forced inward. Other players to suffer the injury include Donovan Mitchell & Nick Young. Low-grade strains have an average time lost of 1.8 games (~6.75 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Steph Curry: The MRI will be crucial in determining severity of the sprain & the subsequent missed time. Hearing the word ”moderate” is concerning. Historically his R ankle has been more problematic but he has injured his L ankle at various points of his career, most recently in Dec. 2022.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Maxi Kleber: Hate hearing Kleber injured his hamstring, especially the right. He suffered a right semitendinosus (one of the 3 hamstring muscles) tendon tear in the 2022-23 season and missed 35 games. I hope it's nothing serious.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Brandon Miller: Not a ton of examples of glute strains in the NBA but there have been a few including Danilo Gallinari, Joe Harris, and Kevon Looney. The average time lost is 2.4 games (~7.3 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: James Wiseman: Hate to see him injured again. Season-ending injuries in Game 1 are relatively uncommon. It's happened 4 times since 2005, including Nene (ACL), Jeremy Lin (patella tendon tear), Julius Randle (leg), and, of course, Gordan Hayward's infamous leg fracture.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Just finished cataloguing all of last night's injuries in the NBA & had no trouble kicking off the rust. Hard to imagine it's been 11 years since I launched https://t.co/eAm93BKSY6 & started counting injuries on a daily basis. Thank you all for the support through the years.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Dejounte Murray: Time lost will be dictated by treatment options. If the fracture is non-displaced (like Hartenstein) & surgery is not needed then the average time lost is 15.6 games (35.2 days). If surgery is needed, the numbers go up slightly. (17.2 games, 40.5 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text:
The Thunder were the healthiest team in the NBA last season but face injury concerns right out of the gate. Check out the new team previews and reviews up now on https://t.co/eAm93BKSY6

https://t.co/jsBUzLCRef https://t.co/7rOyZdp1Cj

author: InStreetClothes
text: The NBA is back and so are Team Health Previews & Reviews on https://t.co/eAm93BKSY6 Each team has its own infographic and breakdown of player health entering the new season. Check it out! https://t.co/jsBUzLCRef https://t.co/zzffSlMNQ2

author: InStreetClothes
text: It's Day 1 & we already have something listed on the League's Injury Report I have never seen. Josh Richardson is listed as out w/ a heel enthesopathy. The term is used to describe a disorder at the attachment site of a tendon or ligament to a bone. Probably more common than we expect, I've just never seen it listed.

author: InStreetClothes
text: InStreetClothes Team Previews and Reviews are coming soon but here's a sneak peak on the eve of the NBA Season starting https://t.co/XoHbdwducq

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @PodcastPShow: PG provides an update on his recent injury. https://t.co/ESdPrLxReh

author: InStreetClothes
text: One year after missing a league low 53 games to injury or illness, the Thunder will start the season without Isaiah Hartenstein & Nikola Topic. Kenrich Williams (knee) & Jaylin Williams (hamstring) are also working their way back from injuries of their own. Looks like OKC’s depth will be tested early.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Isaiah Hartenstein: Based on the description it seems likely he fractured one of his metacarpals. Because it is non-displaced, he will likely avoid surgery. The average time lost for hand fractures that do not need surgery is 15.6 games (35.2 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Paul George update: 76ers confirm the hyperextension resulted in a bone bruise of the knee. Location of the bruise is a major contributing factor to recovery but the average time lost for a knee bone contusion is 14.4 days. Fortunately it sounds like he avoided a serious injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @ginamizell: Chatted with Paul George in the postgame locker room. He had a sleeve on the knee but was walking and said he is “not too c…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Brian coming in and reiterating my point...

author: InStreetClothes
text: To be clear, a hyperextended knee can result in a wide variety of injuries including bone bruises. ligament sprains, or capsule injuries. Each injury carries its own recovery timeline. Like I said earlier, I expect PG-13 to undergo further testing to determine exact diagnosis.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Paul George: The term hyperextension is more of a descriptor of what happened to the knee than an actual diagnosis. Expect more tests to come. Injuries labeled as "hyperextended knee" result in an average time lost of 6.4 days.
