author: DamichaelC
text:
Tuomas Iisalo on if he wants to be the permanent head coach for the Grizzlies:

“Yes, why not.” 

More here:

author: DamichaelC
text:
The Memphis Grizzlies have one playoff series win with the current core — a stretch that lasts five seasons. Tough conversations and decisions are needed ahead of a pivotal offseason in Memphis. 

Story: https://t.co/znniY0zyqv

author: DamichaelC
text: Regarding challenges, Tuomas Iisalo said the Grizzlies have a team on the second row that is one of the most accurate in the league. He relies on them for quick decisions on when to challenge or not. He added that you don’t want to be too emotional just because it’s the playoffs.

author: DamichaelC
text: Tuomas Iisalo called turnovers the weakness of the four main points the team emphasized. He said it will be a key component going into next season.

text:

OKC 60 Grizzlies 59

Memphis is competing hard with its season on the line.

author: DamichaelC
text:
We’ve seen home crowds here be electric in the playoffs. People showed up in 2022 and 2023. Some fans will show up regardless but many aren’t wasting hard-earned money for what they deem a mediocre product. That’s how the business works. 

Better results = better crowd

author: DamichaelC
text: It’s tough and unexpected, but the Grizzlies played several games without Ja Morant this season. And won many. A 26-point lead at halftime should have been enough. Crushing loss, but this is a team that has relied on depth all season.

text:
Jam du jour: "Book Of Brilliant Things" by Simple Minds.
https://t.co/1P42QBFFHB

author: twithersCLE
text:
That Indiana comeback was like a fever dream.

Even this morning, it's hard to believe it happened.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Pacers have grit, togetherness, balance. 

Bigger, though, they have belief.

author: twithersCLE
text: Pacers comeback looked vaguely familiar.

author: twithersCLE
text: Indiana Stones.

author: twithersCLE
text: With Reggie Miller courtside.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Remember a national writer arguing with me about TJ McConnell several years back.
He called him "the worst player in the NBA."
I'd take four of him.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Music fans. Strong recommendation on new album by the Waterboys. "Life, Death And Dennis Hopper," is fun, interesting celebration of late actor's life.

There's also an accompanying documentary, "A Wild and Beautiful Ride," with the magnificent Mike Scott (@MickPuck).

Check it.

author: twithersCLE
text:
To clarify: Guards and Twins will finish suspended game before scheduled one tomorrow.

Today's rainout will be made up as part of doubleheader on Sept. 20.

author: twithersCLE
text: Guardians-Twins rained out, doubleheader tomorrow.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians prospect and 2024 No. 1 overall pick Travis Bazzana could miss more than two months with internal oblique strain. 
He'll begin rehab in Goodyear, Arizona.

author: twithersCLE
text: Also, and I get the disappointment, not sure why fans can't accept the Cavs lost to a better, more seasoned, deeper team.

author: twithersCLE
text: Guardians-Twins suspended in 4th. They'll try to finish tomorrow before regularly scheduled game.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Appreciate feedback on Cavs. I'm not saying their lack of physicality wasn't a problem. It was. It has been.

Also, the weakened East didn't help in curbing expectations for a team that's clearly not a title contender.

I thought they would make conference finals -- with breaks.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Jam du jour: "The Song Is Over" by The Who.

Happy 80th, Pete.

https://t.co/E6o36VQQBT

author: twithersCLE
text:
In a weird way, Cavs' incredible start was detrimental. 
It certainly raised expectations above where they should have been for team that barely got out of second round a year ago.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Agreed with much of what I heard from Cavs president Koby Altman today.

Cavs were physically tough enough, but lacked postseason experience and mental strength to deal with Pacers.

Indiana's confidence, force and pace made difference. Injuries were factor, but not reason.

author: twithersCLE
text: Star player "exploring his options" is such a non-story story. The Giannis stuff is already jumping the shark.

author: twithersCLE
text:
I'll say it again: "Welcome to Wrexham" @WrexhamFX is exceptional story telling.

Every episode has humor and heart. The city's passion for its team is inspiring.

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman’s initial reaction to the Game 2 loss. 

“We got punked. They came out with the right intensity and we didn’t…we aren’t just going to flush this.” 

“We have to be better and we know that.” https://t.co/QEYiQysSsH

author: katywinge
text:
Asked David Adelman what was the most concerning part of the way the Nuggets lost.

“Physicality.” 

He said they showed up late to the party. 

Finished his presser with “Tonight take that personally. Everybody within the organization. That will help you succeed in game 3.”

author: katywinge
text: Hey everyone the radio voice of the Nuggets is back on twitter, give him a follow @Koznuggets

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman expects the same effort from OKC tonight. Said for the Nuggets, it’s not the first punch - “you have to take a couple punches early.”

Said the first 18 minutes against a team this good is important. 

“Take punches and get back up .”

author: katywinge
text:
Mark Daigneault pregame said there are “a lot of areas of the game where we can be better…we have a ton of pathways to approve.” 

Said OKC needs to be physical & disciplined. “If you’re not physical with them you have no shot, but if you’re physical you toe the line of fouling”

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman talked about how the Nuggets could’ve used the excuse of being tired after Game 7. 

“This is our opportunity tonight.” 
“Be present.”
“Don’t waste your energy.”

Adelman said the word of the night tonight was mentality.

author: katywinge
text:
David Adelman on the win: 

“The mentality was consistent throughout.”

“I never felt like anyone wavered.” 

“You just try to give yourself a chance. And we did that.”

author: katywinge
text: David Adelman on Aaron Gordon: “He is a Denver Nugget…he is the soul of our team.”

author: katywinge
text: RUNNING INTO THE LOCKER ROOM TO TALK TO EVERYONE

author: katywinge
text: David Adelman today on the Nuggets players communicating and having/sharing their opinions: “More of it, please. More of it, please. Not a bunch of guys going and sitting on the bench, waiting for me to tell them something. Talk to each other. We can figure it out as a group.”

author: katywinge
text:
More from Adelman on communication and how it helps win games: 

“I have my own opinion, I know what I see, when I watch film, or the game is flowing, to be able to have the relationship with the players, where we're on the same page, it leads to trust in really tough moments”

author: MarcJSpears
text: Warriors say  guard Brandin Podziemski underwent surgery yesterday to repair a core muscle injury. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of training camp. Podziemski previously underwent left wrist debridement surgery on May 27.

text: Former NBA head coach Don Nelson has been named the recipient of the 2025 Chuck Daly Lifetime Achievement Award, the National Basketball Coaches Association announced. In 31 NBA seasons as a head coach, “Nellie” recorded 1,335 regular season wins and ranks second all-time.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Just in: Minnesota Timberwolves' Naz Reid intends to sign a new five-year, $125 million contract to stay with the franchise, including a player option, sources tell ESPN. Critical agreement between the Wolves and Reid's agents, Sean Kennedy and Jeff Schwartz of Excel Sports. https://t.co/FF9MjGvwb9

author: ShamsCharania
text: Edwards will receive two guaranteed years on the new deal, sources said. He earns $2 million next season after the 76ers declined his $1.9M option. Edwards emerged as an upside rotation player last season, shooting 45.5% from the field and 36.3 from 3.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Philadelphia 76ers intend to sign F Justin Edwards to a new three-year contract after declining his team option, sources tell ESPN. 76ers and Klutch Sports' Rich Paul and Josh Hairston negotiated the new deal for Edwards, who averaged 10.1 points and 26 minutes last season. https://t.co/hA3cuYa2ww

author: ShamsCharania
text: Over the last 13 days, the Rockets have reached deals to acquire Kevin Durant, extend Steven Adams and coach Ime Udoka, and bring back their free agents Fred VanVleet, Tate, Holiday and Green.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Houston Rockets intend to sign their free agents Jae'Sean Tate, Aaron Holiday and Jeff Green on new contracts to bring them all back for next season, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/8yRqFRtGUz

author: ShamsCharania
text: Philadelphia 76ers center Andre Drummond has picked up his $5 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment and Masai Ujiri have decided to part ways, as Ujiri was entering the final year of his contract, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Masai Ujiri is out as Vice Chairman and President of the Toronto Raptors, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/JIXUMUXz55

author: ShamsCharania
text: St. John's star RJ Luis Jr. has agreed to a two-way NBA contract with the Utah Jazz, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Auburn's Miles Kelly has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Dallas Mavericks, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Kansas' 7-footer Hunter Dickinson has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the New Orleans Pelicans, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Real Madrid’s Eli John Ndiaye agreed to a two-way contract with Atlanta Hawks, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Michigan 7-footer Vlad Goldin has agreed to a two-way NBA contract with the Miami Heat, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Alabama's Mark Sears, a first All-American, has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Milwaukee Bucks, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Wake Forest's Hunter Sallis has agreed to a two-way NBA contract with the Philadelphia 76ers, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Villanova star Eric Dixon has agreed to a two-way NBA contract with the Los Angeles Lakers, sources tell ESPN. Dixon was the No. 1 scorer in college basketball last season, shooting 41% from 3-point range.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Louisville's Chucky Hepburn – the ACC Defensive Player of the Year – has agreed to a two-way NBA contract with the Toronto Raptors, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Arizona’s Caleb Love – one of the most prolific scorers in college basketball – is expected to sign a two-way NBA contract with the Portland Trail Blazers, sources tell ESPN. Love went undrafted and now lands a deal to be on the Blazers’ roster next season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Knicks moved Kobe Sanders to the Clippers, sources tell ESPN. Knicks now have No. 51.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Lakers sent No. 45 and cash to the Timberwolves, sources said.

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: As Jimmy Butler's return to Miami draws near, @JakeLFischer delivers a richly reported piece on Mike Dunleavy Jr.'s days…

author: JakeLFischer
text: On the continuing rise of three-plus team trades in the NBA, and how the ability to use MLE as trade facilitators impacted the Feb. 6 deadline as well: https://t.co/IXqOKyIhp9 https://t.co/k8AIBdLboq

author: JakeLFischer
text: We’re going to keep seeing multi-team trades in this new NBA apron era. That, plus the creativity from front offices dealing into open mid-level exceptions, was one clear theme of the 2025 trade deadline after polling some league executives. More here:

author: JakeLFischer
text: I'm just here for the Vít Krejčí point guard minutes, baby.

author: JakeLFischer
text: And it's Washington Wizards assistant Adam Caporn who gets the nod as the next Australian men's basketball head coach. Subscribers had a detailed accounting of the Boomers' search process over multiple @TheSteinLine stories, such as this one from earlier in the week:

author: JakeLFischer
text: Another chapter of the NBA-to-NIL story currently unfolding throughout basketball: Kings assistant Luke Loucks, who we wrote was a prominent candidate to be the next Florida State head coach a few weeks back, will indeed depart Sacramento to lead his alma mater Seminoles.

author: JakeLFischer
text: With the Sixers’ 2025 first-rounder hanging in the pick-protected balance, I spoke to Tyrese Maxey… and Mike Muscala, about the Bubble jumper that changed the course of Philadelphia history. Only at @TheSteinLine: https://t.co/xzhSpBWtlm https://t.co/lliRZkZB1b

author: JakeLFischer
text: Braxton Key will join Golden State on the Warriors’ open two-way spot, per sources.

author: JakeLFischer
text: After waiving Kendall Brown, Brooklyn is signing Tyson Etienne from its G League affiliate Long Island Nets to a two-way deal, according to league sources.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The Warriors are converting two-way guard Pat Spencer to a standard contract, sources say.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Once clearing waivers at 5 p.m., and before today’s two-way deadline, former Knicks wing Jacob Toppin plans to sign a new two-way deal with the Atlanta Hawks, per sources. He’ll have eligibility for double-digit games.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Another round for this morning’s story. Have heard from several NBA scouts today who went so far as deeming Isaac an elite defensive prospect. “He’s a pest and a dog,” one texted.

author: JakeLFischer
text: In a rare mid-season move, Rip City Remix guard Isaac Nogués Gonzaléz is submitting paperwork to enter the 2025 NBA Draft. “I can defend a lot of positions. Not only the point guard. Not only the best player,” he told me. More here @TheSteinLine: https://t.co/EoT0fxXrq9 https://t.co/rwvqq5xqNp

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: Around-the-league NBA notes from last night tackling a slew of major post-deadline trade topics … involving the Suns, Wiz…

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: Suns, Wizards, Mavericks, Lakers, Bucks, Timberwolves, Knicks and more featured …

author: JakeLFischer
text: As we wrote yesterday, the plan was to finalize a decision on Joel Embiid's status by the end of this week. It's telling the Sixers' statement this afternoon shares Philadelphia is still working to "determine the exact treatment plan," with how convoluted this process has been.

author: JakeLFischer
text: I feel like the more WWE tones in the NBA, the better. This is a television show — honestly, a reality television show — as much as there's an unscripted, tactical and athletic battle between rosters, and team building is such a fascinating science experiment on its own.

author: JakeLFischer
text: The buildup for tonight has been clever and consistent. Kudos to @Jumpman23. There's so many ways to promote NBA storylines like this on a regular basis, and not just when the most shocking trade in league history sets a "Tuesday night in February" stage for Lakers vs. Mavericks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Shaedon Sharpe: Sharpe has been down this road before having suffered a similar injury in the summer of 2022. If the tear is small & the instability is minimal, rehab can improve the issue without the need for surgery.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Luka Doncic: No reason to be overly concerned about this type of injury at this point of the preseason. Average time lost for an isolated calf contusion is ~3.8 days (0.7 games missed).

author: InStreetClothes
text: This one hurts. I didn’t spend a ton of time around Dikembe but when I did I walked away smiling. He made a shy grad student feel like an important  part of the athletic training room & seemed genuinely interested in my story. He was an ambassador of the game & will be missed.

text: Re: RJ Barrett: An acromioclavicular (AC) sprain is better known as a separated shoulder & occurs where the collarbone meets the shoulder blade. The average time lost for low-grade or nondescript AC sprains in the NBA is ~4.8 games (12.5 days).

author: DamichaelC
text: Tuomas Iisalo said the Ja Morant injury “quite drastically” changed the energy and execution.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Brutal. All things were going well and Memphis led by 29 points. Then a Ja Morant injury and the second half happened. Memphis is now down 3-0 and on the brink of elimination.

Final: OKC 114 Grizz 108

https://t.co/QQyqZ9FlMR

author: DamichaelC
text: Not looking good. Memphis just can't generate good looks with this level of pressure and no Morant

author: DamichaelC
text: Jaren Jackson Jr. has to get busy. Memphis needs him. He’s the guy who can create shots for himself and teammates. Let’s see if he does it

author: DamichaelC
text:
End of 3: Grizz 95 OKC 87

Memphis led by 26 at halftime. 12 minutes left

author: DamichaelC
text:
Uh oh. A 26-point halftime lead has been cut to 13 in 7 minutes. 

Timeout Memphis.

Grizzlies lead 84-71

author: DamichaelC
text: Ja Morant is out for the remainder of tonight with a hip injury

author: DamichaelC
text: Luke Kennard is starting the second half

author: DamichaelC
text: Team is back out. No sign of Ja Morant

author: DamichaelC
text:
A frustrated Ja Morant took his jersey off while being helped off the floor. No further updates yet. 

https://t.co/XbW2a3vdUX

author: DamichaelC
text: Ja Morant is limping to the free-throw line to shoot the free throws. Tough. Fans are cheering

author: DamichaelC
text: Oh no. Ja is down after a hard fall at the rim

author: DamichaelC
text: Y'all see Desmond Bane sitting on defense against SGA? These boys want this game

author: DamichaelC
text:
Scotty Pippen Jr. why you playing like that??

Scotty: https://t.co/Abu8gq8RoM

author: DamichaelC
text:
Scotty Pippen Jr. has a new season high for made 3-pointers. It's the second quarter.

He's 5-for-6 from deep

author: DamichaelC
text: This looks like a different Grizzlies team tonight. They're everywhere. Memphis leads OKC 54-37

author: DamichaelC
text: Hartenstein just picked up his third foul with 9:08 left in the second quarter. He's headed to the bench. Memphis leads 49-37

author: DamichaelC
text: End of 1: Grizz 40 OKC 29

author: DamichaelC
text: We’re 7 minutes into the game and Scotty Pippen Jr. has already tied a season high in made 3-pointers (4)

author: DamichaelC
text:
Timeout OKC

The Grizzlies are punching first in Game 3

Memphis 12 OKC 4

7:31 left in the first quarter

author: twithersCLE
text: Journalism won (01).

author: twithersCLE
text:
I've had a bad left knee for 50 years. That's me as a 13-year-old hooper with wrap on it. Being a catcher didn't help. So after decades of pain, I got joint replacement surgery yesterday.

Big thanks to Dr. Irwin Mandel and the folks at UH St. John Westshore for quality care. https://t.co/kfQFG7cWZB

author: twithersCLE
text:
Truly sorry, Cavs fans.

Worried about this second round, but thought they'd have enough.

As much progress as was seemingly made in the regular season, Cleveland's weak spots were exposed by Pacers.

It was a pleasure to cover this team for much of this run. 

Catch you soon.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Mitchell has been slowed by a calf injury, which is also what cut his playoffs short last season. Sometimes Cavs will label an injury in the general vicinity of what's wrong. They aren't required to be specific.

Knowing Mitchell, he'll do everything possible to play tomorrow.

author: twithersCLE
text: MRI for Mitchell tomorrow. That's not encouraging.

author: twithersCLE
text: From Cavs: Mitchell has left ankle injury.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Mitchell has been dealing with a calf issue. Hit the floor a couple times in first half.

Will pass along any team medical update when it comes.

author: twithersCLE
text:
I don't think either player should have been ejected. Double techs. Move on.

Appreciate the rational responses. 

Happy Mother's Day.

text:
If Mathurin is ejected, Hunter should be too.

Huge break for Cavs.

author: twithersCLE
text:
This is fantastic. Congrats to Greg. Quite an honor. Well deserved.

Go Bucks.

text:
Another notable aspect of this Nuggets vs Thunder series: playoff experience. 

Top 6 players on each team in terms of career playoff experience added up…

Denver 452 games
OKC 119 games

author: katywinge
text:
Looking back at the previous meetings this season between Nuggets and OKC and a couple things stand out pretty glaringly:

When Nuggets won:
17 3PM 
19.5 FBPS
26.5 FTA

When Nuggets lost:
9.5 3PM
11.5 FBPS
17 FTA 

Make shots, own your pace, be the aggressor/set tone physically

text: Happy Mother’s Day to all you badass moms out there! Can’t overstate the appreciation for what you do every day! 🌺🌹

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Hauser has been upgraded to questionable.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
The Celtics are 35-9 on the road. Luke Kornet points back to a primetime Saturday-night matchup with the Knicks at MSG, a 131-104 win for Boston, as a game that helped him to realize just how much this team thrives in hostile environments.

Some may remember this as 'The Denzel Game' for JT.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Great question from @FredKatz to Mazzulla on subtle tweaks from game to game. Mazzulla says, "Everything we do is relatively player-driven." He says his players have been around a long time, and they recognize those necessary subtleties while on the court.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Joe Mazzulla says Sam Hauser is a little bit better today than he was yesterday, but is still day-to-day. Hauser's availability for Game 4 and beyond is still TBD.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Al Horford says that the Celtics' offense played with good pace and spacing, and that the guys also converted on more of the open looks, and those were the differences in his mind that led to offensive success in Game 3.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Lakers are acquiring the No. 36 pick in the NBA draft from Minnesota, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Over the next seven years, Orlando still owns four first-round picks and nine second-rounders. 

They send a 2026 most favorable second-rounder of Detroit, Milwaukee, Orlando; 2027 second is most favorable of Orlando and Boston.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Boston Celtics are trading No. 32 to the Orlando Magic for Nos. 46 and 57, a 2026 second-rounder and 2027 second-rounder, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for night two of the NBA draft on the team that planned to select Saint Joseph's Rasheer Fleming before the Phoenix Suns jumped to acquire No. 31: https://t.co/MPlDu6bzb4

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Suns' war room right now is eyeing St. Joseph's big man Rasheer Fleming at No. 31, finalizing their research and scouting before making their selection at 8 pm ET on ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Minnesota Timberwolves are trading the first pick in tonight’s NBA draft -- No. 31 -- to the Phoenix Suns for No. 36 and two future second-round picks, sources tell ESPN. Suns continue rebuild by moving up to 31 and 41 in draft -- send out 36, 52, 59 and two future seconds.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Phoenix Suns are trading the Nos. 52 and 59 picks to the Golden State Warriors for No. 41, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Brooklyn Nets are trading the No. 36 pick in tonight's NBA Draft to the Phoenix Suns for two future second-round picks, sources tell ESPN. Suns now own Nos. 36, 52 and 59.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lakers move up 10 picks as they eye a young talent in the second round of the draft tonight.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers are moving up in the second round of the NBA Draft tonight, acquiring the No. 45 pick from the Chicago Bulls for No. 55 and cash, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: 29th pick goes to Charlotte in this trade: Liam McNeeley.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Sacramento Kings are trading for the No. 24 pick from the Oklahoma City Thunder and taking Nique Clifford, sources tell ESPN.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Bruce Brown Jr. is not a buyout candidate. The Pelicans are keeping Brown, sources said, and both sides sound open to a new deal at season’s end. Brown should also have plenty of interest in free agency, if he continues a strong return from injury.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: The Atlanta Hawks have been fined $100,000 for violating the league’s Player Participation Policy regarding Trae Young missing the team’s Emirates NBA Cup game on Nov. 12 against the Boston Celtics at TD Garden.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: The league says “following an investigation, including review by an independent physician, was determined that the Hawks held Young out of a game that he could have played in under the medical standard in the Policy.  The organization’s conduct violated the Policy, which is intended to promote participation in the NBA’s regular season.”

author: InStreetClothes
text: RE: GG Jackson: 5th metatarsal injuries are relatively common in the NBA  & can occur in several ways & in multiple locations. The average time lost for in-season 5th metatarsal fractures in the NBA is ~42 games, though multiple players have missed substantially more time. 1/3

author: InStreetClothes
text: Multiple NB players, including Kevin Durant, Zion Williamson, & Aaron Gordon, have suffered 5th metatarsal fractures. I've previously discussed the injury here: https://t.co/J8P4n1RLEl 2/3

author: InStreetClothes
text: I'm betting this carries over into the regular season and results in time lost for Jackson and the Grizzlies. Tough way to start a new season after all their injuries last year. 3/3

text: RT @LucasFinton: A Shelby County Circuit Court judge ruled Monday that Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant was immune from being sued over a s…

author: DamichaelC
text:
The key for Jaren Jackson Jr. today was being more aggressive, he said.

“I just read the defense differently than I did in Game 1. I didn’t just allow myself to be double and tripled. I didn’t just let the help win. But yeah, it wasn’t enough. It wasn’t enough.”

author: DamichaelC
text: Ja Morant: “I just got to be better. I be better, we’ll be better.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Scotty Pippen Jr. pointed out how taking the first good shot was something Memphis did better as the game progressed. 

“They’re such a good defensive team. When we try to pass and move it around too much, it leads to them recovering and us taking tougher shots.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Ja Morant on his mentality going back to Memphis:

“Go see my fam, get some love, chill.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Ja Morant on what needs to be better going forward: 

“Start the game better, start the quarters better. Take care of the ball.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Tuomas Iisalo said the message to the team after the game was short and simple:

“They took care of their business so now it’s time for us to take care of business at home.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
Final: OKC 118 Grizz 99

Memphis will head home down 0-2 against OKC. Points off turnovers were a major problem again. 

Three takeaways:

https://t.co/nws7O9HnYZ

author: DamichaelC
text:
Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 13 points in the third quarter and Memphis had another productive period. 

End of 3: OKC leads 90-79

author: twithersCLE
text:
Part of me wishes the Cavs had let Garland speak to the media about his toe injury. At least those fans who are questioning his commitment and toughness would have more to consider.

I know he wants to be on the floor.

Same for Mobley and Hunter. 

It's the playoffs.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: I wonder if the Knicks fans who paid $100k for seats today are happy with their investment so far

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Still true midway through the 3Q

author: Marc_DAmico
text: What a half from Boston, my goodness

author: Marc_DAmico
text: What's that old saying from Brad Stevens? Water finds its level?

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Still early, but the Celtics are converting on some of the answers they didn't have during the first couple of games.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Tatum from Brooklyn!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Boston's 36 first-quarter points tie for its second-highest scoring quarter of this postseason. Celtics lead 36-20.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Another incredible defensive start for Boston. Has held NY to just 12 pts through the first 9+ mins of the 1Q, after allowing just 13 during the 1Q of G2.

The difference is that the offense has come along for the ride this time. Celts already have 27 points and five 3s.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics averaged 17.5 APG through Games 1-2, this after averaging 26.1 APG through the regular season. Really want to see that number pop to the mid-20s today.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Hearing that the atmosphere inside MSG is off the charts. Fortunately for the Celtics, they’ve thrived in these environments the past couple of seasons. Time to find out if that will continue this afternoon.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: KP remains a reserve for G3

text:

Sam Hauser (right ankle sprain) - OUT

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics have not lost three consecutive games in nearly two full calendar years. The last instance was May 17-21 of 2023 — Games 1-3 of the ECF. https://t.co/vEreebCcxZ

author: Marc_DAmico
text: It’s go-time today. We all know the history of teams that have fallen behind 0-3. Back-against-the-wall matinee for the Boston Celtics. Excited to see what they deliver.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Denver! Aaron Jordan! Jamal Murray! The story that’s developing out there is so cool

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jamal Murray has been amazing at both ends during crunch time. Props!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Aaron Jordan!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Have always loved and respected just how hard Russell Westbrook plays. It’s incredible to see it continue so deep into his age-36 season.

author: JakeLFischer
text: My understanding is the Warriors and Heat agreed to their initial swap of players for Jimmy Butler, and it's been Miami's business since then rerouting Dennis Schroder, Lindy Waters and Kyle Anderson.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Now being told Kyle Anderson may not be ending up with the Raptors... as @michaelgrange reports. But he's certainly out the door from Golden State to Miami, first and foremost, and we'll see what the next home is coming for him.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
So the players we've got on the move, per sources: 

GSW: Jimmy Butler 
DET: Lindy Waters, Josh Richardson
Miami: Andrew Wiggins, P.J. Tucker
Utah: Dennis Schroder
TOR: Kyle Anderson

author: JakeLFischer
text: Kyle Anderson isn't going to Miami, either, sources said. Anderson will be going to the Toronto Raptors.

author: JakeLFischer
text: From what I've heard, Dennis Schroder won't be staying in Miami as part of the Golden State Warriors' trade for Jimmy Butler. The Utah Jazz are playing facilitator once again.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Can confirm.

author: JakeLFischer
text: It's two second-round picks to Washington for Jonas Valanciunas, sources said. Denver was very much involved in pursuing the big man from the Wizards, as were the Suns in Phoenix's efforts to find a new home for Jusuf Nurkic.

author: JakeLFischer
text: As Golden State continues sifting through trade options to add talent, the Pelicans are gaining traction on deal structures that would move Brandon Ingram, sources said. Toronto and Atlanta, we've reported @TheSteinLine, have been engaged with New Orleans: https://t.co/LxypvxNaJR

author: JakeLFischer
text: All the details you need about Kevin Durant's disinterest in returning to Golden State, reported earlier on @TheSteinLine: https://t.co/LxypvxNaJR

author: JakeLFischer
text: RT @TheSteinLine: The Pelicans are sending a 2031 second-round pick to Oklahoma City as part of the Daniel Theis-to-OKC trade, league sourc…

author: JakeLFischer
text: Another note tucked in here: On Khris Middleton's future in Washington... https://t.co/LxypvxNaJR

author: JakeLFischer
text:
I’m remembering some old intel… when Washington entered draft week with two first-round picks last June, the Wizards were calling around the league looking to acquire a third. 

Now, they’ve got four of the 2024 first-round selections rostered in Washington. https://t.co/9I0CWbmKfe

author: JakeLFischer
text: Not necessarily. It doesn’t sound like either Milwaukee or Golden State were ready to make a final move on LaVine when the Bulls were ready to send him to Sacramento.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
Milwaukee was definitely involved in talks with Chicago about acquiring Zach LaVine, sources said, before the Bulls included their All-Star guard in the De’Aaron Fox three-team deal. 

We first wrote about the Bucks’ Kuzma interest on Monday: https://t.co/oZSZFSqca7

author: JakeLFischer
text: I’m told a key element of the trade talks that brought Kyle Kuzma to Milwaukee in exchange for championship mainstay Khris Middleton: a large vote of support for Kuzma from one Giannis Antetokounmpo.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Our latest, as of last night, on everything Kevin Durant: https://t.co/6y7OFxl02L

author: JakeLFischer
text: Come get your midnight slop https://t.co/6y7OFxl02L https://t.co/05cBFU8Cwj

author: JakeLFischer
text:
We’re actively monitoring Golden State’s pursuit of Kevin Durant, all of Phoenix’s trade possibilities, Milwaukee’s conversations with Washington about Kyle Kuzma-for-Khris Middleton, and more NBA trade situations this evening.

Much of it detailed this morning @TheSteinLine:

author: JakeLFischer
text: Sounds like Philly is weighing multiple options for KJ Martin, with a deal expected to be completed by tomorrow.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Los Angeles Lakers announced they have commissioned a statue of Pat Riley to join Lakers legends on Star Plaza outside of https://t.co/aSaOHCG67S Arena.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: “Pat is a Lakers icon,” said Jeanie Buss. “His professionalism, commitment to his craft and game preparation paved the way for the coaching we see across the league today. My dad recognized Pat’s obsession and ability to take talented players and coalesce them into a championship team. The style of basketball Pat and the Lakers created in the 80s is still the blueprint for the organization today: an entertaining and winning team.”

author: DanBesbris

author: twithersCLE
text:
Players want to play. 

Injured players will play unless they can't be effective. 

No NBA player is going out there if they're going to be a detriment to the team.

author: twithersCLE
text:
I've really enjoyed my season with Coach Atkinson, who is a straight shooter but also someone with a soft human touch.

I was told by some media colleagues he was a great guy and he came as advertised.

Hoping the Cavs hold on to him for a long time.

text: Re: Kyrie: Mavs called his injury a hand fracture, suggesting the involved bone is one of the metacarpals.  Average time lost for metacarpal fractures that require surgery is ~43 days. Irving suffered a 5th metacarpal fracture in July of 2012 & was back in time for training camp.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Kristaps Porzingis is off the injury report for the Boston Celtics. Sam Hauser (right ankle sprain) remains and is listed as doubtful.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brunson makes two FTs with 12.7 seconds left to push NY ahead 90-89. The Celtics choose not to call timeout for the final shot. Tatum misses a fadeaway - excellent team defense by the Knicks - and NY has suddenly taken a 2-0 series lead. Reactions? Send 'em in.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
RESOUNDING ANSWER: QUICK SHOT!

Tatum drives to the rack for an uncontested dunk that required only 5.7 seconds. Celtics now lead 90-89 with 18.5 seconds left.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Current situation:
- Celtics trail 89-88
- Timeout Celtics
- 24.2 seconds left

So the question is: Do you take the final shot for the win, or do you take it with time left?

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Joe Mazzulla is now 39-17 on Coaches Challenges this season, good for a 69.6% success rate

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Celts in rhythm, sound the sirens for New York 🚨

author: Marc_DAmico
text: OG Anunoby has now had both a 3-pointer and a poster dunk taken away from him tonight.

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Jayson Tatum scored two points during the first half.

He just scored five points during the first two minutes of the second half.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: 50-41 at the half, in favor of the Celtics. Feels like Boston could be up by 15, but the rough shooting (38% FG) has held them back. Believe it or not, NY actually shot it better, at 38.6%.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jaylen Brown has scored a game-high 16 points, and he has shot 6-for-10 from inside the arc. https://t.co/nU0OY7gO0l

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Sometimes I watch Jrue Holiday play defense and my brain can't figure out how he's able to do what he does

author: Marc_DAmico
text: There Celtics fans go again, barking at Luke Kornet...

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Tatum is doing an unbelievable job on the glass right now. Really attacking the ball. Already seven boards less than a minute into the 2Q. That's 21% of the total rebounds in the game thus far.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics lead 24-13 after the 1Q after New York shot just 6-for-23 from the field. Feels like the lead could be larger, but don't think anyone would complain about an 11-point edge.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Porzingis checks in for the first time at the 2:39 mark of the 1Q.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Luke Kornet is the first big man off of Boston's bench.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The refs signaled for a review after the initial shot was made. They don't review it until the next stoppage of play.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: New York had three points, now it has zero. The Knicks had made a 3-pointer that is now deemed a shot-clock violation. Scoreless nearly five minutes into the game.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: New York has opened the game 2-for-13 from the field and has just four points after 7+ minutes of action.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Now 2-for-16

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Dallas Mavericks nine-time NBA All-Star Kyrie Irving is declining his $43 million player option and intends to sign a three-year, $119 million contract with the franchise, sources tell ESPN. The deal includes a player option in the 2027-28 season. https://t.co/hduY1vEVVP

author: ShamsCharania
text: Opportunistic acquisitions for the Hawks and Nets -- while the Celtics are now out of the salary cap's second apron.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Boston, Atlanta and Brooklyn are finalizing a three-team trade that sends Kristaps Porzingis and a second-round pick to the Hawks, Terance Mann and Atlanta's No. 22 pick to the Nets, and Georges Niang and a second-rounder to the Celtics. https://t.co/1fcbIslyVF

author: ShamsCharania
text: The trade swaps guards -- the Wizards shifting from Poole to the veteran in McCollum, who has an expiring contract. Washington now is expected to approach $100 million in projected cap space in 2026. Pelicans move younger, possibly more dynamic with Poole and Bey.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The New Orleans Pelicans are trading CJ McCollum, Kelly Olynyk and a future second-round pick to the Washington Wizards for Jordan Poole, Saddiq Bey and the No. 40 pick, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Portland Trail Blazers forward Matisse Thybulle is picking up his $11.5 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The New York Knicks are interviewing Minnesota Timberwolves assistant Micah Nori for the team's head coaching job, sources tell ESPN. Now three candidates – Nori and two former head coaches Mike Brown and Taylor Jenkins – have done formal interviews for the Knicks' vacancy.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Boston Celtics' first major move of an active summer, sending two-time NBA champion and six-time All-Defensive team member Jrue Holiday to the Portland Trail Blazers for scoring guard Anfernee Simons and two second-rounders: https://t.co/lmucIKTteW

author: ShamsCharania
text: An extremely active offseason begins for the Celtics with the trade of Jrue Holiday, who played a critical role in Boston's 2024 NBA championship. The Celtics remain engaged in trade talks surrounding multiple key players on the roster, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Portland makes an aggressive move to re-acquire Holiday, who the franchise originally received from Milwaukee in the Damian Lillard trade in 2023 and later moved to Boston for a deal that included two first-round picks to Blazers. Simons joins Boston on an expiring contract.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Boston Celtics have traded Jrue Holiday to the Portland Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round picks, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/2ycXQicGkT

author: ShamsCharania
text: Heading into Hornets restricted free agency, Tre Mann has fully recovered from his back disc herniation – which limited him to just 13 games last season – and has participated in all of Charlotte's offseason activity and 5-on-5s, his agent Aaron Turner said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Dallas Mavericks and center Daniel Gafford reaching agreement on a new three-year, near $60 million contract extension to further solidify a premier NBA frontcourt: https://t.co/uRDlGwHZ9u

author: ShamsCharania
text: Gafford averaged a career-high 12.3 points last season and will team with Anthony Davis, Dereck Lively II and Cooper Flagg in the Mavericks frontcourt. Gafford ranked in the top-10 in field-goal defense as contesting defender in 2024-25 among players to contest 800 shots.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks center Daniel Gafford intends to sign a three-year contract extension worth nearly $60 million, sources tell ESPN. Mavericks officials and Gafford's agents, Mike George and Shy Saee of Klutch Sports, negotiated the new deal through 2028-29. https://t.co/KinN3vFri6

author: ShamsCharania
text: Washington Wizards three-time NBA All-Star Khris Middleton has picked up his $33.3 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/skVrixdlA5

author: ShamsCharania
text: Tyrese Haliburton and the Pacers authored one of most thrilling playoffs in NBA history. An unbelievable run.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton sustained a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7 against Oklahoma City, sources tell ESPN. Haliburton played through a calf strain in the same leg during the NBA Finals for an opportunity to win a championship. https://t.co/7pr3z2Lubq

author: ShamsCharania
text: After the late season firings of coach Michael Malone and GM Calvin Booth, the Nuggets hired David Adelman – and now will name Tenzer and Wallace as the heads of their newly restructured basketball leadership group.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Denver Nuggets are naming Ben Tenzer as the executive vice president of basketball operations and hiring Minnesota Timberwolves executive Jon Wallace as the franchise's new executive vice president of player personnel, sources tell ESPN. Both will report to Josh Kroenke.

author: JakeLFischer
text: It’s been kinda fascinating talking with teams about Caleb Martin’s four-year, $28 million deal. A lot of execs view that as negative future money. Dallas clearly likes the team control Martin’s contract brings, after they didn’t find an extension with Quentin Grimes this fall.

author: JakeLFischer
text: Caleb Martin drew some real interest around the league, as the Sixers’ season slipped away due to injuries, sources said. The Bucks had an eye on Martin, and we’re still monitoring Milwaukee as a suitor for Caleb’s twin brother, Cody Martin, in Charlotte.

text: A few team folks are pointing this out to me: Charlotte's 2025 first-round pick that Sacramento is landing from San Antonio is top-14 protected — essentially guaranteed won't convey, and will instead become 2026 and 2027 CHA seconds. Kings *really* got back two firsts.

author: JakeLFischer
text: This deal between Chicago, Sacramento and San Antonio is on track to send De'Aaron Fox to his desired Spurs, finally land Zach LaVine in Sacramento, and I'm being told will give the Bulls back their top-10 protected pick from San Antonio.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
Dallas had contacted several teams this week, looking to reroute additional salary for a potential three-team deal, sources said. 

A bunch of teams knew inklings about the Mavericks being close on a trade.

Nobody knew it was trading Luka Doncic.

author: twithersCLE
text: Atkinson characterized Mobley and Hunter as "doubtful," adding they were hurt on plays when referees missed foul calls. Hunter on the contested layup by Mathurin and Turner getting into Mobley's landing zone on shot.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Injuries to Mobley (ankle) and Hunter (thumb) only adds to Cavs concern and pressure going into Game 2. 
Garland (toe) remains questionable.

author: twithersCLE
text: And those guys who asked me about 8.5 points, you're welcome.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Impressive performance by the Pacers, better balanced squad tonight.

Cavs relied too much on Mitchell and 3s -- 9 of 38. Spida was 1 of 11.

Cleveland's got some adjusting to do.

author: twithersCLE
text: Two straight bad possessions for Cavs -- Strus gets 3 blocked, Mitchell forces one.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Cavs have not been sound in late-game situations throughout this season.

They've also not had many. 

Have to be near perfect rest of way.

author: DamichaelC
text:
I hear you Jeff and I’m sure there are people who agree with you, but I’m going to politely disagree again. 

In my opinion, this is the litmus test. This series will give the FO a strong indication of what needs to be done to get this team to a championship level.

author: DamichaelC

text: With the NBA season officially over, I just wanted to say thank you for everyone that read, shared, or listened to my work. I love basketball and providing  insight when injuries unfortunately occur. It was a heck of a season and I'm already looking forward to next season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report for @RotoWire: Key Dodgers to Miss Time https://t.co/h9BcaODp6u

author: InStreetClothes
text: As we wait to see if Porzingis plays, I looked through my Draft Prospect Injury Database in search of a comp. Closest I could find was a player who missed 16 games (~ 2 months) w/ a sup. lateral peroneal tendon retinaculum tear on the opposite side of the foot. Surgery was needed.

author: InStreetClothes
text: New on InStreetClothes: Understanding Kristaps Porzingis' Medial Retinaculum Tear: https://t.co/qnj94GJVN5 https://t.co/ykKPWMOvRA

author: InStreetClothes
text: Not to further confuse people but there is a medial retinaculum in the knee too. Porzingis' problem is in his ankle.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Hat tip to @malika_andrews for nailing her medical segment on the KP injury. Well done.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Went back and listened again. Great report but it may have been from @saltersl Either way it was well done. Kudos.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Porzingis: The medial retinaculum is connective tissue that serves as the roof of the tarsal tunnel (think carpal tunnel but in the foot). It anchors multiple structures in place, including the tendon of the posterior tibialis.

author: InStreetClothes
text: If the retrinaculum is torn, the tendon can shift out of place (dislocate), causing pain and instability of the ankle and foot.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I only have one real comp in my database but it was in conjunction with other traumatic ankle injuries that required surgery. It will be interesting to see how this is managed but given his injury history there is reason for concern.

Come talk Celtics-Knicks OT thriller with me, as NY steals Game 1

Give me a subscribe
🔊 https://t.co/ujvrmDtGbm

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics grabbed a rebound with 17 seconds left while trailing by three, but were unable to get a shot off to potentially tie the game. And so the Knicks steal Game 1. What's everyone thinking after this one?

author: Marc_DAmico
text: This late contest from Horford on the help - and he gave it everything on this contest - saved the game for Boston. https://t.co/BroqlOqaOn

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Brunson missed a bunny for the win!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Tatum misses a stepback 3 and NY grabs the board. Timeout Knicks with 5.5 left. They're out of timeouts, and the Celtics can take some time off the clock with a foul.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: D-White with an unreal rebound in traffic https://t.co/XuFwPo8NTx

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Boston falls behind by six, its largest deficit of the night, and responds immediately with a 7-0 run. Jrue Holiday is HOUNDING on defense right now - and he's the one who just made the kick-out pass to White for a triple and the lead.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics are taking a ton of 3s (as they should... that's what they do), but many of them tonight are coming off of low-pass and low-pace possessions. Gotta move the ball and move bodies to get those rhythm shots!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Jrue has IT! That dude always makes the big ones

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Questionable to return is a win in my book. That was tough to watch.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: McBride just fired up three 3-pointers in 77 seconds. He made only one of them - the most important note for Boston - and the C's are still clinging to a four-point lead.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full ESPN story on the Houston Rockets acquiring Kevin Durant in a blockbuster trade that sends Jalen Green, Dillon Brooks, the No. 10 pick in the NBA draft and five second-round picks to the Phoenix Suns: https://t.co/t5p6xfbgqk

author: ShamsCharania
text: Blockbuster trade on the final day of the NBA season. The Suns engaged in deep conversations with the two Durant finalists -- Houston and Miami -- over the last 24 hours and reached agreement on the deal Sunday morning.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The deal places Durant on the No. 2-seeded Rockets and elevates the team’s positioning for title contention in the West. The Suns land a 23-year-old scorer for a high-powered backcourt with Devin Booker, a tough 3-and-D player and now have 3 firsts and 8 seconds to use in trades.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Phoenix Suns are trading two-time NBA Finals MVP Kevin Durant to the Houston Rockets for Jalen Green, Dillon Brooks, the No. 10 pick in the 2025 draft and five second-round picks, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/EwrbA2ES9O

author: ShamsCharania
text:
The late Jerry Buss purchased the Los Angeles Lakers for $67.5 million in 1979.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: John David, one of the attorneys representing Shelton, issued me a statement: “We hope that our client’s lawsuit will serve as a wakeup call to the Clippers organization that their players are not just dollar values, but are humans requiring proper - and not hastened - health and recovery treatment for the careers and lives afterwards.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: The Clippers issued me a statement, disputing the claims: “Mr. Shelton’s claims were investigated and found to be without merit. We honored Mr. Shelton’s employment contract and paid him in full.  This lawsuit is a belated attempt to shake down the Clippers based on accusations that Mr. Shelton should know are false.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Former Los Angeles Clippers trainer Randy Shelton is suing the franchise for wrongful termination, among other things, after he claims he was fired after complaining that Kawhi Leonard was being subjected to unsafe and illegal treatment for injuries. https://t.co/qv1vOwhO7l

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Dončić: The term thoracic refers to the thorax of the body & is most often associated w/ the middle segment of the spine where the ribs attach to the thoracic vertebrae. Luka appears to be favoring his ribs more than his back & this likely comes down to managing his associated symptoms, particularly pain.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Josh Hart: The average time lost for nonspecific abdominal strains is 8.1 days (~3 games). Hart may try to play through the injury for New York’s Game 7 but this issue will likely linger should the Knicks advance.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The season of the soleus in the NBA apparently. Conley is the third player since April 9 to suffer a strain of that portion of the calf. Average time lost is ~17 days with Porzingis currently on day 16.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I know everyone is focused on the injuries impacting the NBA playoffs. Rightfully so. But I'm surprised by the the lack of offseason news re: possible surgeries. By this time last year we had 9 surgeries already performed. Besides Thanasis has there been anything?

author: ShamsCharania
text: Walter has been a minority stakeholder in the Lakers since 2021 and has interests in multiple professional sports organizations, including the LA Dodgers, WNBA's Los Angeles Sparks, the Billie Jean Cup, Cadillac Formula 1 team and the Professional Women's Hockey League.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Jerry Buss bought the Lakers from Jack Kent Cooke in 1979 for $67.5 million, and the franchise passed to his children when he passed away in 2013. Now the iconic, 17-time championship is entering agreement to sell majority interest.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Buss family is entering an agreement to sell majority ownership of the Los Angeles Lakers to Mark Walter, the CEO and chairman of diversified holding company TWG Global, sources tell ESPN. Jeanie Buss will continue to serve in her role as Governor after the sale. https://t.co/1Da6LDD7TJ

author: ShamsCharania
text: RT @ESPNNBA: "Once the Pacers and Haliburton get the results back on this MRI, on that calf strain, they're going to be able to identify th…

author: ShamsCharania
text: More on NBA Today at 3 pm ET on ESPN 2 surrounding Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton with Game 6 of the NBA Finals against the Oklahoma City Thunder looming Thursday.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton is believed to have suffered a strained right calf and will undergo an MRI to determine the severity of the strain, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/4FTIoB1RVU

author: ShamsCharania
text: New Orleans now owns the Nos. 7 and 23 selections in the first round of the NBA draft on June 25.

author: ShamsCharania
text: NBA draft deal: The Indiana Pacers are trading their No. 23 pick and the rights to Mojave King to the New Orleans Pelicans for Indiana's own 2026 first-round pick back which the Pelicans had previously acquired, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for ABC NBA Countdown Halftime on Indiana star Tyrese Haliburton dealing with calf tightness on the same leg that he limped off with ankle soreness last week: https://t.co/vZoaNNWWHJ

author: ShamsCharania
text: Former Sacramento Kings general manager Monte McNair, the 2022-23 NBA executive of the Year, is joining the Los Angeles Clippers in an advisor role, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Fun news: ABC is airing the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers starting lineup introductions ahead of Game 5 of the NBA Finals tonight (8:30 pm ET) – the first time starting introductions will be broadcast at the Finals since 2013, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Developing ESPN story on the first blockbuster trade of the NBA offseason, the Memphis Grizzlies sending Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four first-round picks and a pick swap: https://t.co/FY7rnfzdXI

author: ShamsCharania
text: Massive swing for Orlando to compete in the Eastern Conference, and for the Grizzlies, an opportunity to add a championship defensive wing, backcourt depth and a major haul of draft picks to utilize.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Orlando is sending to Memphis the No. 16 pick in the 2025 NBA Draft, Phoenix's first-round pick in 2026, Magic 2028 unprotected first-rounder and Orlando's 2030 unprotected first, sources said. Pick swap is lightly protected in 2029.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Memphis Grizzlies are trading Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/UcQnmHbgZb

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Kevin Durant prefers to land with the Heat, Rockets, Spurs, as three teams he would commit with long term - ESPN: https://t.co/oxWEuJJU5Q

author: ShamsCharania
text: Durant is on an expiring $54.7 million deal for 2025-26, and the Suns have made clear to six-to-eight seriously interested teams that they will make the best deal for the franchise – even outside of his preferred list of Miami, San Antonio and Houston.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Miami Heat, San Antonio Spurs and Houston Rockets are 15-time All-Star Kevin Durant's preferred trade destinations out of Phoenix, sources tell ESPN. Those across the NBA have been made aware in recent days that those are the three teams that Durant would commit to long-term. https://t.co/Hqn5hDaWxC

author: ShamsCharania
text: Magic President Jeff Weltman made clear the franchise was taking an aggressive, win-now approach to this offseason, and they kicked off the summer Sunday by adding Bane to the core of Paolo Banchero, Franz Wagner and Jalen Suggs.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bane is one of three NBA players with 800 made 3-pointers and 40% 3-point shooting since entering the league in 2020, and has shot 43.2% on catch and shoot 3s in last 5 seasons. He'll be a major boost for the Magic, who ranked last in 3-point field-goal percentage this season.

text: New York Knicks last won an NBA title in 1973. Indiana Pacers won ABA titles in 1970, 1972, and 1973 but never an NBA title. author: twithersCLE
text:
Let's not crown the Cavs just yet. They did what they were supposed to do, sweeping a play-in team.
That's what a top seed should do, must do.
Now it's important to get rest, re-focus and get Garland healthy.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text:
Not my usual beat, but….

LBA (Little Basketball Association) News.

Sources say New York City Sky guard/retired streamer @KaiCenat left the arena with a right knee sprain after Monday nights game. He’ll likely be ready for the Finals tonight, but it’ll be a game-time decision. Kai Cenat’s legacy is on the line.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: This is a major hurdle cleared by Sacramento State. They have a new football stadium in the works, a huge NIL commitment of over $35 million and thanks to the Sacramento Kings, now have a world class basketball facility to warrant admittance into an FBS Conference.

author: ChrisBHaynes

author: InStreetClothes
text: More on Kleber: A Grade 3 sprain denotes a rupture of the ligaments of the AC joint resulting in movement of the clavicle (collarbone). A non-surgical approach is most often used but may be needed in some cases. Chris Paul suffered a G3 sprain in 2014 & missed 18 games (37 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Maxi Kleber: The shoulder sprain diagnosis is a bit ambiguous. We know the injury involves a ligament but multiple joints & articulations make up the shoulder. The fall suggests a possible AC sprain but severity & location will dictate recovery & time lost.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Porzingis: KP suffered the same injury that is currently keeping Giannis sidelined. As I mentioned then, the soleus is a part of the calf muscle complex.  The average time lost for strains specified as a soleus injury is ~17 days (6 games). Read more here: https://t.co/dJjGBdCaMv

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Luka Dončić: The word sprain lets us know the injury involves a connective tissue (ligament or joint capsule). However, it is difficult to estimate a recovery timeline without knowing the specific structure involved. Each ligament carries its own unique timeline and treatment options.

Re: Anthony Davis: The shoulder is a complex joint made up of multiple articulations, meaning his current issue could be anything from a stinger to a sprain. He did suffer a left shoulder injury earlier this season and has a history of injuries, including a torn labrum.
New on @RotoWire: Fantasy Baseball Injury Report: Casas Moves to 60-Day IL https://t.co/ew4OCMFw13

author: InStreetClothes
text: It's always weird when we have a random spike of a specific injury but  a variety of calf injuries are causing problems throughout the NBA playoffs. Giannis (soleus), Dame (Achilles), Jamal Murray (calf), and now Porzingis. Heck, Luke Kornet just returned from a calf strain of his own.
Re: Damian Lillard: A Grade 1 Achilles strain is considered mild but can be a problematic injury that lingers. Average time lost for in-season nondescript Achilles strains is 10 days (4.2 games).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Just so you know @BenRogers and @SkinWade are two of the good guys. I look forward to whatever is next for them. Best wishes fellas.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Joel Embiid: I have three other cases of Bell's Palsy in NBA players including Trenton Hassell and Zach Randolph. Time lost was usually linked to a viral infection that resulted in the condition.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Before returning to action Daniel Gafford was wearing a @Hyperice Venom 2. It provides heat and vibration. They are amazing.  @MFollowill

author: InStreetClothes
text: I have a ton of respect for Zion being honest and forthcoming with his emotions regarding the injury. Processing and the mental side of rehab and recovery is often overlooked.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Kleber: You don't really "dislocate" your AC joint. This is likely a high grade AC sprain, commonly known as a separated shoulder. AC sprains are usually a multi-week injury and can require surgery if the accompanying ligament damage is significant.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Two current Mavs, Dante Exum and Kyrie Irving, have previously suffered injuries to the AC joint w/ Exum missing most of the 2017-18 season after undergoing surgery. I previously detailed AC joint injuries when Chris Paul suffered a G3 AC sprain: https://t.co/3DIJ5ISLrh

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jimmy Butler: The recovery rate for an MCL sprain is dependent on the severity of the sprain & any possible meniscus damage as fibers of the MCL are intertwined with the medial meniscus. Even mild sprains are often multi week injuries. (Average time lost is ~23 days)

author: InStreetClothes
text: Also worth noting that Butler missed time during the 2017-18 season with a meniscus tear in this same knee. He has then missed time with soreness and tendinitis in the right knee at various points of the subsequent seasons.

text: ESPN story on the Rockets and center Steven Adams reaching agreement on a three-year, $39 million contract extension that keeps him in Houston and out of the free agent market: https://t.co/zQ0KDFB0FT

author: ShamsCharania
text: Adams played 58 games after missing the 2023-24 season, and averaged 22.1 minutes in the playoffs in a critical role for a team that was +44 with him on the floor versus -44 without. Adams led the NBA in offensive rebounding percentage this season as well, per ESPN Research.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Just In: Houston Rockets center Steven Adams has agreed to a three-year, $39 million contract extension to stay with the franchise, sources tell ESPN. After playing a key rotation and leadership role in the Rockets' playoff run, the new deal keeps a top center out of free agency. https://t.co/yWUnnQrRgh

text: Two significant front-office hires for the Hawks and Saleh. Graham started as an intern in New Orleans, rose to the GM role, and leaves after 15 years with the Pelicans. Dinwiddie has worked in the 76ers front office since 2020 after 14 seasons with the Indiana Pacers.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Derrick Rose sent me a message on his retirement perspective: “Basketball was and always will be my first love. As a teenager, I had a goal of becoming an NBA player, and I achieved that. This isn’t a goodbye to the game I love; it’s a thank you.” https://t.co/QDefRlqquA

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Embiid to me on his UN participation: “I’ve never experienced UN week and it was very eye opening. I met so many leaders from Africa trying to create opportunities. I think of my own experience, and all the Africans in professional sports around the world, and how we can get all that influence working together.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text:
I’m told Sixers star Joel Embiid is in New York for United Nation General Assembly week with focus of how business of sports can transform Africa financially. He will speak at two events today, including Earthshot Prize hosted by Prince William.

Monday night Bloomberg hosted an intimate dinner featuring Embiid, Toronto Raptors president Masai Ujiri, and a number of prominent leaders from Africa to discuss sports and Africa. Embiid went back to Cameroon this summer after the Paris Olympics.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Watson spent a total of 18 seasons in the NBA: 13 as a player and five as a coach. He was instrumental in the development of Devin Booker, OG Anunoby and Scottie Barnes. McCain, of course, was having a standout first season in Philadelphia, and was a leading candidate for Rookie of the Year. 

The injury luck for the Sixers is something to behold.

author: JakeLFischer
text:
Jared McCain informed Sixers staffers of left knee soreness following last night’s game vs. Indiana, sources said. 

An MRI today revealed a lateral meniscus tear in his left knee. The injury requires surgery, and he is out indefinitely.

More NBA news: https://t.co/POD3SCxI99

author: Marc_DAmico
text: 🎟️TICKET PUNCHED🎟️ The Celtics are on to the Conference Semifinals with a gentleman's sweep of the Magic. Who's got thoughts on their mind after this dub? Send 'em in for the postgame pod! https://t.co/iibcUKNRBR

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Scheierman just did the wrist grab after a 3 lmao

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
The Boston Celtics trailed by two at halftime.

They now lead by 32 with 3:49 left on the clock.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: "They Not Like Us" blaring from the TD Garden speakers right now, as the Celtics lead 103-78 with 5:06 remaining until they advance to the next round 👀

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Watched Jayson Tatum spin a full 360 on the sideline as he celebrated Luke Kornet's alley-oop slam - then Tatum had to throw the big man a forearm shiver as he came back to the bench https://t.co/oRMTxaehaO

author: Marc_DAmico
text: It's such an incredible experience to watch a playoff game here at TD Garden. If you ever have the chance to do it, ya better take advantage. It's worth every penny!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Understand why Banchero remained on the bench with his five fouls, but while the Magic preserved his eligibility for the 4Q, they might've just let the game totally slip away.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics just landed a knockout punch to the Magic - a 24-4 run to close the 3Q, and they now own a 21-point advantage heading into the final frame.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Ruh roh... Celtics are finding their rhythm 👀

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
It really happened. The Celtics just went an entire half without making a 3-pointer. They currently have nine turnover and only six 3PA.

And they trail by just two!

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Celtics, still without a 3-pointer and with seven turnovers, just tied the game up with 3:11 to go in the first half. Note this as something that is not a good sign for Orlando.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Foot on the line not once, but twice, for Al Horford from the right corner. https://t.co/AcWusbK08c

author: Marc_DAmico
text: Right now, Horford's corner jumper is ruled a 2-pointer instead of a 3-pointer, so the C's are still without a triple.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: We're midway through the 2Q and the Celtics have yet to make a 3-pointer. However, they have converted on a couple of conventional three-point plays (and missed the FT on another).

author: Marc_DAmico
text:
Joe Mazzulla spoke before tip-off about the importance of controlling the margins. The Celtics didn't do that during the 1Q. Their 6 turnovers played a huge role in Orlando owning a 26-18 shot margin after the 1Q.

Still, Boston managed to stay within 4 pts after the opening 12 mins.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: The Magic finally just ran two at Jayson Tatum (and fouled him). Feels like we've barely seen that during this series. They've been trusting their defenders on an island against him.

author: Marc_DAmico
text: 8:52pm tip for a first-round game I'm not sure I've experienced this in my 17 seasons covering the league

author: Marc_DAmico
text: This crowd is already passing the test 😤

author: DamichaelC
text:
Games never come down to one play, but many times it’s one moment that stands out in big matchups. 

I broke down what happened on the 5-second violation, and the challenge Memphis has to move past it.

"The season will be over if you don't. It’s simple.”

https://t.co/5FcN8Zfy5I

author: DamichaelC
text:
Grizzlies coach Tuomas Iisalo said it wasn’t exactly the same, but seeing Ja Morant return and gut it out reminded him of Isiah Thomas hobbling around in the 1988 NBA Finals. 

- Morant’s status for Friday 
- why Memphis didn’t “call 12” in closing minutes
https://t.co/dvPuW5eURF

author: DamichaelC
text:
Scotty Pippen Jr.: 

“I guess (the official) thought I hit him on the elbow or something. We didn’t have any challenges at the time. I didn’t touch him. He missed a layup, so it probably just threw the ref off a little bit that he missed a layup, so he probably just called it.”

author: DamichaelC
text:
I asked Ja Morant about his potential availability for Friday. 

“I’m playing. That’s basically the answer I’m giving. It ain’t nothing different.”

author: DamichaelC
text: Santi Aldama said he didn’t see anyone open and felt like it was a quick five seconds.

author: DamichaelC
text: Whoa…

author: DamichaelC
text: Grizzlies coach Tuomas Iisalo said Memphis decided to cross match Zach Edey on Jimmy Buttler in part because it wanted to keep Jaren Jackson Jr. out of foul trouble with Butler’s ability to draw fouls. He also mentioned how Butler hadn’t been an effective pull-up 3-point shooter.

author: DamichaelC
text: Tuomas Iisalo said Desmond Bane was the first option on the play leading to the five-second violation. The Grizzlies had a small window of time to get him the ball and hesitated. By that point, Golden State recovered and took away the second and third options.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Final: Golden State 121 Memphis 116 

The Grizzlies will play at home on Friday to determine their playoff fate. Incredible effort, but not enough

author: DamichaelC
text: You got to be kidding me. Five-second violation on the Grizzlies in a one-possession game. Have to foul now. Wow

author: DamichaelC
text: He’s out. Just picked up his sixth. Not sure why he was in there.

author: DamichaelC
text: A few missed calls in the last 2 minutes  that benefited both teams. Notably for Memphis, Ja Morant poked the ball out of Steph Curry’s hand. According to L2M report, the ball went off Curry. If that was called correctly, Memphis would’ve got the ball down one with 7 seconds left

author: DamichaelC
text: Podziemski being called for a foul on Scotty Pippen Jr. also should’ve been a no call, so it goes both ways but those were big plays.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Zion Williamson: This season, hamstring strains have resulted in an average time lost of ~13 days. However, the term "re-evaluated in two weeks" is worrisome. Re-evaluated does not mean return to play.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Hard to provide much context for Zion with such limited info. Most of his prior injuries (MCL, meniscus, hamstring) have involved his opposite (right) leg but testing tomorrow will paint a clearer picture.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Giannis: The soleus is a part of the calf muscle complex.  The average time lost for strains specified as a soleus injury is ~17 days (6 games). Other players to suffer soleus strains include Giannis' brother Thanasis and teammate Damian Lillard.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Following last night’s NBA slate of games, the total number of player games lost to injury or illness surpassed the 5,000 mark. It’s the 6th straight season (excluding the COVID shortened season) in which that has occurred. It happened just once in the prior 12 seasons.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
🧵NBA injury points to end the year that only I may find interesting.

1.) The total number of games lost to injury or illness is the second highest total since 2005-06.

2.) Memphis is the first team in my database to lose more than 500 man games to injury in a single season.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
3.) 4 players (Steven Adams, Lonzo Ball, Damion Lee, Vlatko Cancer) on standard contracts missed the entire regular season. All four were the result of knee injuries.

4.) Thanks to an in season trade, Steven Adams missed 83 games to injury or illness.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
5.) Two seasons after losing 309 games to injury, the Thunder finished with a league-best 53 games lost to injury or illness.

6.) The #1 seeds in each conference (OKC and Boston) were the healthiest teams in each conference as well.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
NBA Week 1 Injury Report

Total Games Lost to Injury or Illness: 118

Total Games Lost to Rest or Injury Management: 2

Notable new injuries:
De'Aaron Fox: R ankle sprain
Anfernee Simons: R UCL thumb tear

Guardians will start Ben Lively in Game 1.
Rookie Doug Nikhazy will make his debut and start Game 2.

author: twithersCLE
text: Red Sox-Guardians series opener postponed. Teams will play split doubleheader on Saturday. Game 1 is scheduled for 1:10 p.m. and Game 2 at 6:10.

author: twithersCLE
text: Should have official word momentarily on Guardians. Sounds like doubleheader tomorrow.

author: twithersCLE
text: Update. https://t.co/2CtNhKXjFS

author: twithersCLE
text: Weather forecast not promising for Guards-BoSox. https://t.co/gyF8IU2k6O

author: twithersCLE
text: Guardians INF Juan Brito could be sidelined 3 months after injuring his thumb and undergoing surgery.

author: twithersCLE
text:
I know some fans are upset by the trade. But it makes perfect sense given where this Browns team is presently.

Berry had to pull the trigger at the Jax offer. It will pay dividends -- so long as they choose wisely and the track record isn't comforting.

I get it.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Not long after the Browns picked Graham, Journey returned to the stage for another encore of "Don't Stop Believin'." 

By then, most of the faithful were heading home.

author: twithersCLE
text: Neal Schon still rips. https://t.co/jaX5Tmclw2

author: twithersCLE
text: First saw Journey in 1978. Jersey Jam at the Meadowlands with Frank Marino and Mahogany Rush, Ted Nugent and Aerosmith. https://t.co/ToqDzoN8yg

author: twithersCLE
text: An Ev-olution. https://t.co/TFsa7rWySZ

author: twithersCLE
text: Reaction. https://t.co/rHeoe67UTl

author: twithersCLE
text:
Remember what Jimmy Haslam said: "We gave up a lot of picks to get him (Watson), so we've got to dig ourselves out of that hole."

Shovel. Backhoe. Excavator.

author: twithersCLE
text: Btw, Journey was solid. The crowd down here is bewildered.

author: twithersCLE
text: Browns might as well trade down again.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guess Browns couldn't down the deal.
To me, this is further Watson fallout. Set the franchise so far back they have to add as many assets as they can.

author: twithersCLE
text: Spring is sprung. https://t.co/qTWmzcm15f

author: twithersCLE
text: Tanner Houck starting for Red Sox in series opener against Guardians tomorrow -- weather permitting.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Donovan Mitchell saved the Cavs from themselves. He was the only one who met the moment in the fourth.

Cleveland leads 2-0.

On to Miami.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Offensively, Cavs have gotten stagnant.

Defensively, giving Heat too many second-chance oops.

Game on.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story with details on the Phoenix Suns hiring Cleveland Cavaliers assistant Jordan Ott as the franchise's next head coach: https://t.co/RQSU1Iov7k

author: ShamsCharania
text: After a comprehensive, four-round search that included over 15 candidates, the Suns' ownership and front office aligned on Ott, who joined Coach of the Year Kenny Atkinson's staff last summer and played a key coaching role on the East-best 64-win Cavaliers this season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Just In: The Phoenix Suns are hiring Cleveland Cavaliers assistant Jordan Ott as the franchise's new head coach, sources tell ESPN. Ott has been an NBA assistant since 2012 and has a strong background of offensive and defensive creativity, player development and communication. https://t.co/doDE6Fahdj

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for @SportsCenter on the New York Knicks firing Tom Thibodeau as head coach: https://t.co/NpqAULqQiW

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Knicks are singularly focused on their pursuit of a championship and believe a new voice will serve as the focus for the organization's next step, sources said. After five seasons with the Knicks, Tom Thibodeau is out as head coach.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The New York Knicks are relieving Tom Thibodeau of his duties as head coach, sources tell ESPN. Thibodeau led the Knicks to their first East Finals in 25 years, made playoffs in 4 of 5 years and led Knicks to consecutive 50+ win seasons for first time since the 1990s. https://t.co/B7w8KhoEcF

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Phoenix Suns narrowing the franchise's head coaching search to two assistants from the East-best Cavaliers -- Johnnie Bryant and Jordan Ott -- for an expected hiring later this week: https://t.co/CvaIfllbQu

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Phoenix Suns have narrowed their head coaching search to two finalists from the Cleveland Cavaliers, associate coach Johnnie Bryant and assistant Jordan Ott, sources tell ESPN. Both will meet with Suns owner Mat Ishbia in Michigan ahead of a hiring as soon as later this week. https://t.co/6JSG8EiuaU

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Utah Jazz are hiring Boston Celtics assistant general manager Austin Ainge as the franchise's president of basketball operations, sources tell me and @TimBontemps.
