author: DamichaelC
text: Scotty Pippen Jr. and Zach Edey have five fouls. Memphis needs to foul here. Konchar is in for Edey, but Pippen remains in.

author: DamichaelC
text:
Wow. Loose ball foul on Looney. Zach Edey went to the line with 14.3 left and made both free throws. 

Timeout Golden State. 117-116 with 10.5 left

author: DamichaelC
text:
Scotty Pippen Jr. misses the second free throw. Timeout Warriors.

Golden State leads 117-114 with 36.7 remaining. For Memphis, find your best five defenders and throw them on the floor.

author: DamichaelC
text: Ja Morant is out there gutting it out, but he just doesn’t look all the way right. This is usually his time, but it’s tough right now

author: DamichaelC
text: Zach Edey has battled his butt off. Started slow, and there have been moments, but he’s competing. His rebounding has a difference. Forced Golden State to go big at a point.

author: DamichaelC
text: Steph Curry … bad man

author: DamichaelC
text: Desmond Bane with a big shot right there. Huge

author: DamichaelC
text: The call stands. Challenge unsuccessful

author: DamichaelC
text: Unbelievable

author: DamichaelC
text: Grizzlies vs Warriors. What else did you expect… here we go

author: DamichaelC
text: Wow. Ja Morant is back in

author: DamichaelC
text: The Grizzlies have the lead

author: DamichaelC
text: Desmond Bane is putting the team on his back right now

author: DamichaelC
text:
End of 3: Grizzlies down 94-91. 

Ja Morant is trying to move around, but he’s not moving well.

author: DamichaelC
text: Ja Morant is behind the Grizzlies bench working on his ankle. Memphis is making a run, and you can tell he’s doing whatever he can to get his ankle right. Still limping.

author: DamichaelC
text: Uh oh. Ja Morant is down

author: DamichaelC
text: The Grizzlies are back within four points

author: DamichaelC
text: All things considered, Golden State hasn’t been able to put Memphis out of reach. The Grizzlies are hanging around.

author: DamichaelC
text: When we talk about maximizing players, I can’t fathom how putting Zach Edey on Jimmy Buttler does that, but hey, here we are.

author: DamichaelC
text: First one back out. Memphis needs more from 13. https://t.co/8sT4CgEglk

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anthony Davis: Corneal abrasions are relatively common in the NBA. Since the 2005-06 NBA season, the average time lost for an in-season corneal abrasion is 1.0 games (4.0 days). Other players to sustain the injury include Kyrie Irving, Kevin Love, and LeBron James.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Kawhi: Thoracic spasms mean his issue involves the thoracic region of the spine where the ribs connect to the 12 corresponding vertebrae. Generally spasms in this area are indicative of a muscle injury but can be caused by other underlying issues w/ the ribs or intervertebral discs.

author: InStreetClothes
text:

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @ptpaplayers: Providing players and their teams with improved continuity of care, ensuring they have 24/7, 365 access to their medical r…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Şengün: Have to be thankful for the final diagnosis. It could have been much worse. The bone bruise in the knee likely the result of the hyperextension but happy to hear all other structures intact.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Malik Monk: The estimated timeline is consistent with a Grade 2 MCL sprain. Grade 2 sprains, also known as partial or incomplete tears, result in an average of ~41 days lost (~21 games). Other players to suffer the injury include Kevin Durant, Marc Gasol, and SGA.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jrue Holiday: His injury is listed as an AC sprain (often known as a separated shoulder). The term dead arm suggests there is also a nerve issue, likely an injury to the brachial plexus (ie a stinger). However, dead arm syndrome is usually associated w/ injuries to the glenohumeral joint.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The average time lost for low-grade/nondescript AC sprains in the NBA is ~ 4 games (12.2 days). That amount of time should allow any transient nerve issues to subside. Interested to see how this progresses.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Quite a half by the Cavs, who go 14 of 23 on 3-pointers.

Bench goes 6 of 8 from downtown. 

Don't think Miami has firepower or depth to stay with Cleveland.

That said, long way to go.

author: twithersCLE
text: Spring doesn't arrive until May in NE Ohio.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Jam du jour: "It's Over" by Boz Scaggs.
https://t.co/bwZ3PkzjQD

author: twithersCLE
text:
Yankees starter Carlos Rodón on Aaron Judge, who went 7 for 12 in the series -- two doubles, a triple and no homers.

"Right now, he's like Tony Gwynn," Rodón said. "Next week he'll probably be like Hank Aaron."

author: twithersCLE
text: Carlos Rodón gives New York strong start, Yankees down Guardians 5-1 to salvage series finale https://t.co/fjhxhdVjFt https://t.co/DV9odzuWcE

author: twithersCLE
text:
Strange outing for Ortiz, who throws a career-high 104 pitches in just 4 1/3 innings.
Five walks.
Eight strikeouts.

author: twithersCLE
text: Ortiz at 60 pitches. We're still in the second inning.

author: twithersCLE
text: Judge now 6 for 6 in last two games (he struck out to end Monday's game). He's batting .424.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Luis Ortiz gives up an RBI triple and RBI double before striking out three straight.

He survived.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Aaron Judge with his fifth hit in five at-bats -- RBI triple in first.
He's reached base in 21 straight games and is leading the majors with a .418 average.

He's really good. #analysis

author: twithersCLE
text: 1:10, beautiful. https://t.co/LYSHs8YzOP

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt said closer Emmanuel Clase had some "shoulder discomfort" after Sunday's outing.

Playing catch now. Availability for today not yet known.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Interesting night. Maybe the most "Guards Ball" inning we've witnessed.
See you in the morning. https://t.co/WcSgoDq6nf

author: twithersCLE
text: Cleveland hasn't swept New York at home since 1970.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians are 7-1 at home for the first time since 2002, sixth time in team history.
Cleveland has won a series over New York for the first time since 2021, first at home since 2019.

Guardians go for the sweep Wednesday.

author: twithersCLE
text:
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt said Clase was not available after throwing 30 pitches on Sunday.
Vogt dismissed the notion there's a closer controversy. Asked if we should be looking deeper into the situation, Vogt told reporters, "No. Not at all."

author: DanBesbris
text:
#FantasyBasketball Victor Wembanyama Fallout

📈📈📈 Charles Bassey (when healthy)
📈 Sandro Mamukelashvili (until Bassey's back)
📈 Jeremy Sochan
📈 All the other heavily rostered dudes

In straight 9-cat I'm not sure anyone moves from outside the top-100 to inside UNTIL Bassey's back. Sochan might get into that top-100 to 150 range again, though, and far better in punt 3's or punt FT builds.

My hope is that he's back soon because he would be a huge winner if so.

In the INTERIM, they'll probably run small lineups and I'm not adding those guys yet.

author: DamichaelC
text:
One name Tuomas Iisalo has mentioned a few times on the Warriors side over the past couple of days? Kevon Looney. 

Looney hasn’t had a major impact against Memphis this season, but he’s had some good games against the Grizzlies over the years (see Game 6 2022). 

Interesting.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Trae Young: Not a ton of great examples for comparison as this is an uncommon injury. While most finger injuries are repaired during the offseason, RCL injuries of the pinkie are often functionally limiting and it likely made more sense to act now.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Okongwu: The new update is interesting. Big toe sprains are hard enough but sesamoiditis has been added to the description. Okongwu missed time his rookie season w/ a stress fracture in the same bone. The sesamoid bones of the big toe sit at the base of the toe & help bear weight & create leverage when pushing off.
